jobDescription:
2025 Capital Markets, DSCI, AI Engineer (12-16 Months)

Job Description

The nature of finance is changing, and the Aiden team within RBC Capital Markets team is now recruiting the next generation of AI engineers that will bring in new cutting-edge trading and digital analytics solutions.

At RBC Capital Markets, AI and machine learning are powering the next generation of digital trading and analytics solutions for our clients. Developers and AI Engineers on the team to apply leading-edge methods including reinforcement learning to develop RBC’s core multi-asset trading algorithms and provide data-driven trading insights to clients. You will grow your technical and problem-solving skills and have an opportunity to also gain entrepreneurial experience by working with developers, product teams, and cross-functional sales and trading teams. You will work alongside the researchers and developers in Algo Research and contribute to new and exciting research projects that will deliver value to the firm and client-driven insights to help teams across Capital Markets to better serve their clients.

Role Duration: May 2025 - August 2026

What will you do?

  • Apply unconventional and innovative machine learning techniques to solve cutting-edge business problems
  • Use your critical thinking and problem-solving skills to improve the performance of machine learning algorithms and integrate AI in client-focused applications
  • Develop key support systems and frameworks to help train and explain the actions of our machine learning algorithms
  • Collaborate with traders and subject matter experts across the trade floor
  • Be challenged to think critically within a collaborative team working on a variety of projects for Canada’s largest trade floor

Core Competencies:

  • Creative and first principles problem solving approach
  • Programming experience in Python machine learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch)
  • Proficiency in optimization and Bayesian statistics
  • Interest in developing machine learning models
  • Strong desire to be part of a team
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills
  • Experience in finance not required

In order for your application to be considered, please upload your COVER LETTER and RESUME as ONE PDF FILE.

We thank all interested candidates; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Candidates will be shortlisted on a rolling basis.

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 206630

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: September 2025 – August 2026

Application Deadline: 16/02/2025

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.

  3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides corporate and institutional clients with lending and transaction services, investment banking, advice, and access to capital markets. GBM is a full-service wholesale bank in the Americas, with operations in 21 countries, serving clients across Canada, the United States, Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.

Client Insights and Analytics is part of the COO (Chief Operating Officer’s) office in Global Banking and Markets. Our mandate is to lead the execution of our business strategies through powerful reporting and analytics. We are closely integrated with our business partners to drive adoption, and client strategies/insights and opportunities.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Assist our teams in report engineering, data analytics and data engineering and business relationship management.

  • Work with our relationship managers for business lines including Corporate & Investment Banking, Capital Markets, Global Business Payments and International Corporate and Commercial Banking.

  • Help leverage internal and external client data to facilitate opportunity identification.

  • Support adoption, change management and enhancement of our CRM (client relationship management) system.

  • Attend program meetings, and facilitate organization and follow-up as required.

  • Carry out ad-hoc projects and tasks as required.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.

  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.

  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.

  • You are interested in or have knowledge of the capital markets and wholesale banking business.

  • You have experience working on a major project and/or initiative in a team.

  • You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a matrix-based environment.

  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills.

  • You have advanced experience with Excel.

  • You have experience with programming languages such as Python and C++.

  • You have considerable initiative, curiosity, creativity, and attention to detail.

  • You have a high level of energy, commitment, and a strong sense of teamwork.

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.

  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!

  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!

  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

  • You will be provided with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward.

jobDescription:
Our Company

Moody’s provides financial intelligence and analytical tools to help business leaders make better, faster decisions. Our deep risk expertise, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology help our clients confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.

Our Product

AXIS actuarial system is widely used by life insurers, reinsurers, and consulting firms for pricing, reserving, asset and liability management (ALM), financial modeling, capital calculations, and hedging. The AXIS actuarial system provides the flexibility to deploy large-scale computing power through an advanced cloud-based delivery platform.

Job Description

As an intern Actuarial Software Developer, your role will entail working independently alongside actuaries and actuarial students in a team environment:

  • Designing and implementing new features for AXIS using C++ programming
  • Testing, reconciling features and troubleshooting issues for clients
  • Writing technical implementation specs and presenting jobs in team meetings

What we offer?

  • Paid study time with exam material and exam fees covered
  • Options for fully remote work, attending office or a hybrid mode
  • Flexible work hours and a casual work environment
  • Opportunity to learn and grow in a fast paced, challenging environment
  • Career development and advancement opportunities

A typical candidate usually meets at least three of the four criteria:
» You have completed at least two actuarial exams
» Have a CGPA of 3.0 / 80.0% or higher
» Completed at least one previous work term (actuarial or computer science related)
» Possess a Computer science background or have an interest in programming

jobDescription:
Responsibilities
Within the Research and Technology team, the student will work as a developer on a fast-paced team to develop a Multi-Disciplinary Optimization (MDO) software tool to aid the initial design of aircraft landing gear based on early stage aircraft configuration data.

You are likely to succeed in this role if

  • Are an aerospace/mechanical engineering candidate with a knack for software development
  • You took programming courses in High School and actually enjoyed it
  • You prefer to write to do your lab reports in MatLab/python over Excel
  • You’ve been heavily involved with (or preferably led) a student team (bonus points if you’ve been working with avionics)
  • You’ve held a research position at your university
  • You’re a strong self-learner and have a proven track record of teaching yourself new skills
  • You have an eye for product design

About us

  • We are developing a large scale code base using modern coding standards and practices in python
  • We actually use the skills we learned in school (your calculus skills will not get rusty on this team)
  • We work with design engineers and see the tools we develop used for real aircraft development programs
  • At the core, we are a research team – previous interns have had the opportunity to be involved and credited on publications and patents

Qualifications

• Bachelor or Master Candidate in Engineering (Aeronautical/Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical, Engineering Physics or Engineering Science)

• Prior experience with programming required (Python preferred, strong experience with MatLab, C/C++, Java, .net) acceptable

• Experience with Agile Engineering, Git, Distributed Version Control an asset

• Strong Mathematical background an asset (Optimization, numerical solvers, partial derivatives, matrix operations & differentiation)

• Bonus points for experience with any of the following python frameworks: Dash, plotly, openmdao, numpy, pyopt, scipy

• Experience with Finite Element Analysis or Topology Optimization an Asset
• Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a fast-paced team

• Strong self-teaching ability, initiative and autonomy required

• Prior Research or Student Team experience an asset

• Candidates should be in strong and competitive academic standing

• Please include an unofficial transcript alongside resume

The above statements reflect the general items considered necessary to describe principal functions of the position and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position. Other duties may be assigned as per management instruction.

jobDescription:
Tenstorrent is leading the industry on cutting-edge AI technology, revolutionizing performance expectations, ease of use, and cost efficiency. With AI redefining the computing paradigm, solutions must evolve to unify innovations in software models, compilers, platforms, networking, and semiconductors. Our diverse team of technologists have developed a high performance RISC-V CPU from scratch, and share a passion for AI and a deep desire to build the best AI platform possible. We value collaboration, curiosity, and a commitment to solving hard problems. We are growing our team and looking for contributors of all seniorities.

In this role, you will learn functional/performance verification of high-performance AI-accelerator and/or CPU chiplets going into industry-leading AI/ML chip architecture. You will be mentored by and work alongside a group of highly experienced engineers across various domains of the AI chip.  In this role, you may develop tests targeting functional behavior, tests targeting performance analysis, checkers, coverage monitors, debug aids, execution flows and more.  In pre-silicon verification, one learns the architecture and micro-architecture of the SoCs/chiplets/IPs/Subsystems such that one is able to verify their behavior, stress the device under test, and (with any luck) find some bugs.

This role is full-time and on-site, based out of Toronto, Canada

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute DV testplans for the microarchitecture
  • Understand and debug RTL code, help make changes to the design
  • Help with development of tools for various levels of verification (sub-system, SoC...)
  • Write C/C++ (or SV-UVM) based stimulus that scales from pre-silicon to emulation and post-silicon domain
  • Help with infrastructure and tool development for RTL, Performance and DV environments
  • Support development and integration of testbench components such as microarchitectural models, checkers and coverage

Experience & Qualifications:

  • BS, MS or PhD candidate in EE/ECE/CE/CS
  • Prior academic work in the field of computer architecture, internship experience preferredAcademic projects in C++ / SV / UVM as well knowledge of scripting languages
  • Understanding of assembly level programming a plus but not required
  • Knowledge of hardware description languages (Verilog, VHDL)
  • Strong academic skills or internship experience in verification methodologies and techniques – Simulation/debug, TB development, stimulus, checking, coverage
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills

jobDescription:
Analog Design Intern

Description of Role

The Alphawave Semi Analog Design team in Toronto is composed of a group of nerdy engineers who have still not forgotten how to have fun.  We recognize that, as an undergrad student, you probably don’t have a lot of integrated circuit (IC) design experience, and that is ok.  We are looking for smart and motivated engineers who like a good challenge and are willing to learn.  We will work with you to build upon the knowledge of circuits that you have developed through your courses or projects, and will help you become a productive member of our team.  Our aim is to help you learn a lot, and return to school with confident knowledge in the subject.  It’s our hope that you will become part of Toronto’s expanding ecosystem of hardware engineering talent, and we hope to work with you again longer term after you graduate.

What You’ ll Do:

  • Work with a team of world-class engineers who are very willing to help when needed and are happy to receive help when offered.
  • Ensure analog circuit performance adheres to standard and system model specifications.
  • Propose design and verification strategies to ensure high quality design.
  • Oversee physical layout to minimize the impact of parasitics, device stress, and process variation.
  • Present simulation data for peer review.
  • Document design features and key testbench performance metrics.

What You’ll Need:

  • Enrolled in Electrical or Computer Engineering University program
  • Familiarity with transistor-level circuit design using advanced CMOS technology nodes.

What Would Be Nice for You to Have (but not required to apply):

  • Experience with EDA tools for schematic entry, layout, and verification.
  • Knowledge of SPICE simulators and simulation methods.
  • Knowledgeable in Verilog-A for analog behavioural modeling.
  • Design experience with one or more of the following circuit blocks: continuous time linear equalizer, slicer, high-speed ADC, voltage-controlled oscillator, phase interpolator, bandgap reference, voltage regulator, serializer, deserializer, voltage/current-mode transmitter, phase-locked loop, phase detector

Diversity & Inclusivity

Alphawave Semi is based out of one of the most diverse countries in the world. This includes differences related to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability and socioeconomic status. To us, diversity is one our strongest assets to our organization. We commit ourselves to promoting the recognition and appreciation of our diverse and rich culture. We believe that it is critical to our success to promote freedom of thought and opinion in a respectful environment. The decisions we make are rooted by respectfully considering each other’s thoughts and opinions and by working towards a greater common goal.

Accommodation

Alphawave Semi is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including visible minorities, Indigenous People, and persons with disabilities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. If as a qualified job applicant, you request accommodation, Alphawave Semi will consult with you to provide reasonable accommodations according to your specific needs. If you wish to make a request, you will be provided an opportunity if you’re applications is selected to proceed in our hiring process.

jobDescription:
At The Six Semiconductor (TSS), a rapidly growing start-up, our vision is to offer best in class mixed-signal IP combined with exceptional service.  When compared to competitors, our IP achieve higher performance at lower power and area, while offering the flexibility and ease of integration to our customers in variety of markets such as AI, machine learning, automotive, HPC and mobile. Our team is highly experienced with a long list of achievements and accomplishments in the semiconductor industry.

If you love to work and grow in a fast-paced environment where you can innovate and truly enjoy your work, please send your resume to careers@thesixsemi.com .

jobDescription:
Introduction:

Work with Cadence's semiconductor IP team, designing best in-class SerDes in the latest semiconductor processes using  leading industry tools and methodologies. We are seeking an exceptional intern to join our SerDes IP team in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates will be joining some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to develop products that make data faster.

Our Approach to Internships:

Make you an integral part of the team by providing training, mentorship, and encouraging your creative Talents. As part of a smaller, tight-knit design group, you will be given opportunities to work on various tasks that span the entire business-engineering cycle. Our goal is to equip students with practical work experience and a big picture view of how business is conducted in the semiconductor industry. You will only be limited by your desire to learn and ambition to assume more responsibilities. We understand that it is best to learn by doing. We will provide tasks that enable you to learn while also making meaningful technical contributions. We also consider interns as full-fledged team members and as your knowledge grows, so does the number of tasks and their complexities. The internship program is also an important step in our full-time post-graduation recruitment strategy, with many of our former interns returning as full-time employees.

Description:

The Analog IC Characterization Engineer works with ultra-high speed lab equipment to prove Cadence’s designs in silicon.  The job entails silicon evaluation, characterization, debug, and support.  Also, the intern will be part of creating demonstrations of Cadence’ silicon to prospective customers.

Company Information:

Cadence is the global leader in software, hardware, and services that is driving the transformation of the electronic design automation (EDA) industry. This application-driven approach for creating, integrating, and optimizing designs helps customers realize Analog & Digital ICs ,  System-On-Chip devices, IP and complete systems at lower costs and with higher quality.

Cadence is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluation of Cadence’ leading edge SERDES designs in lab using cutting-edge test equipment such as BERTs, Oscilloscopes, Spectrum Analyzers, Network Analyzers, Protocol Analyzers
  • Development of software for configuring the device and test automation
  • Test Report generation
  • Development of test methodology and making improvements to current test practices
  • Conducting customer demonstration of Cadence’ products using evaluation boards

Skills/Requirements:

  • Students who have completed third year engineering in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Science
  • Strong academic background, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and an ability to excel working in a team environment
  • Proven self-starter with the ability to proactively identify problem situations and propose technically viable solutions
  • Prefer some understanding of practical and theoretical aspects of high-speed analog/mixed-signal testing, including test equipment (BERTs, Oscilloscopes, Spectrum/Network Analyzers), types of measurements (eye diagrams, jitter histograms, bathtub curves, s-parameters, TDR, etc), board design, GUI development, and test automation.
  • Prefer software programming experience using Python or similar object-oriented languages.

Application Requirements:

  • Please include a cover letter, resume, and transcript
  • Indicate preference for internship positions on the cover letter. If more than one internship position is of interest, than please rank your preferences.

jobDescription:
Signal Integrity Products - Semtech
Aanalog IC Design Engineering Internship

Job Summary:
This position is for 12-16 months as an Analog Circuit Design Student Internship at Semtech Canada with the Signal Integrity Products Group (SIP) in the High-Speed Analog and Mixed-Signal Design team in our Burlington Design Center.

Our approach to internship is to make the successful candidate an integral part of our team. We understand that it is best to learn through direct involvement and we will provide you with tasks that enable you to learn and to be productive at the same time. The more you learn the more complex your tasks will become. The internship program is an important part of our recruiting strategy.


Job Responsibilities:

The position contributes to a team working in the development, design, simulation, verification, and post-manufacture characterization of analog integrated circuits for use in Semtech's optical data communication products.

The position includes work related to blocks such as CDRs, equalizers, drivers, and typical support circuits such as bandgap references and opamps. State-of-the-art BiCMOS and CMOS technologies are used for these circuits.

Advanced CAD tools are used for the design, layout, simulation, and verification of the analog blocks plus scripting work for IC design and validation automation.

The position also involves analyzing and characterizing chips in a lab environment using high-speed oscilloscopes, bit-error-rate testers (BERTs), and custom data capture boards all driven by customizable automation software.

The student will work in a team environment and receive mentoring and guidance from seasoned IC designers.

Qualifications:

  • Interest in semiconductor concepts and the industry, and learning about analog and mixed-signal transistor-level design
  • Good understanding of analog electronic circuit fundamentals
  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently or in a team environment
  • Exposure to transistor level circuit design/analysis would be an asset
  • Exposure to CAD circuit design tools (e.g. Cadence Virtuoso) would be an asset
  • Experience with Matlab and/or scripting languages such as Python would be an asset
  • Desired start date May 2023, 12-16 month term, (16 preferred)

jobDescription:
We are seeking a candidate that will work closely with our custom silicon and application. This role provides the opportunity to be part of a team that delivers industry leading SERDES products and help our experts in design, firmware and software teams develop leading edge and differentiating IPs

What You'll Do

  • Validation of our leading-edge custom silicon designs.
  • Verification and Debugging of our customer products.
  • Develop test and verification plans for our silicon regression suite.
  • Review and understand SERDES PHY sub-component sequencing and electrical requirements.
  • Develop programs and scripts to characterize SERDES blocks for both electrical and interoperability requirements

What You'll Need

  • Strong analytical/problem solving skills and pronounced attention to details.
  • Must be a self starter, and able to independently drive tasks to completion.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Added Advantages:

jobDescription:
By submitting your resume, you’re expressing interest in one of our 2025 Artificial Intelligence or Deep Learning Internships . We’ll review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out if your experience fits one of our many internship opportunities.

NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our work in AI and digital twins is transforming the world's largest industries and profoundly impacting society — from gaming to robotics, self-driving cars to life-saving healthcare, climate change to virtual worlds where we can all connect and create.

Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on with one of our industry leading Hardware teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. Throughout the internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business.

The hourly rate for our interns is 18 USD - 71 USD. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

You will also be eligible for Intern benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.

Potential Internships in this field include:

Autonomous Vehicles

  • Developing and training state-of-the-art Deep Neural Networks for path generation

  • Collecting training datasets and real-time inference run-times using simulators/gyms as well as performing in-vehicle tests

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Computer Vision, Mapping, Localization, SLAM, Image Processing, Segmentation

Deep Learning Applications & Algorithms

  • Developing algorithms for deep learning, data analytics, or scientific computing to improving performance of GPU implementations

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Deep Neural Networks, Linear Algebra, Numerical Methods and/or Computer Vision, Software Design, Computer Memory (Disk, Memory, Caches), CPU and GPU Architectures, Networking, Numeric Libraries, Embedded System Design and Development, Drivers, Real-Time Software

Deep Learning Frameworks & Libraries

  • Building underlying frameworks and libraries to accelerate Deep Learning on GPUs

  • Contributing directly to software packages such as JAX, PyTorch, and TensorFlow, integrating the latest library (e.g., cuDNN) or CUDA features, performance tuning, and analysis

  • Optimizing core deep learning algorithms and libraries (e.g., CuDNN, CuBLAS), maintaining build, test, and distribution infrastructure for these libraries and deep learning frameworks on NVIDIA supported platforms

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Computer Architecture (CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs or other accelerators), GPU Programming Models, Performance-Oriented Parallel Programming, Optimizing for High-Performance Computing (HPC), Algorithms, Numerical Methods

Robotics

  • Building the fundamental infrastructure and software platforms of our system, working at the very heart of the software system, which will power every robot and application built with Isaac

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Robotics, Autonomous Vehicles, Validation Frameworks for Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Operating Systems and Data Structures (threads, processes, memory, synchronization), Physics Simulation, Simulators, Computer Graphics, Version Control, Computer Vision, Cloud Technologies

Machine Learning

  • Developing and maintaining the first-generation MLaaS (Machine Learning as a Service) Platform including data ingestion, data indexing, data labeling, visualization, dashboards, and data viewers

  • Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Accelerated Computing, GPU Computing, Deep Learning Frameworks, NVIDIA RAPIDS

Qualifications:

-Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree within Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence or a related field

Depending on the internship role, prior experience or knowledge requirements could include the following programming skills and technologies:
-C, C++, CUDA, Python, x86, ARM CPU, GPU, Linux, Direct3D, Vulkan, OpenGL, OpenCL, Spark, Perl, Bash/Shell Scripting, Container Tools (Docker/Containers, Kubernetes), Infrastructure Platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), Data Technologies (Kafka, ELK, Cassandra, Apache Spark), React, Go

jobDescription:
Seeking a highly motivated and innovative ASIC/firmware digital verification engineer intern.  Working as part of a highly experienced mixed-signal design team, the candidate will be involved in verifying current and next generation Backplane Ethernet, PCIe, SATA, and USB SERDES products. The position offers an excellent opportunity to work with an expert team of digital and mixed signal engineers responsible for delivering high-end mixed-signal designs from creating testplans to performing functional and performance tests on the test-chips/products.

Looking for a 12 month commitment starting in Sept 2024. Based out of our Markham office.

Skills required:

-Solid understanding of digital circuit design
-Basic understanding of C/C++ and RISC processors
-Hands-on experience in writing testcases in Verilog and System Verilog
-Familiarity with scripting languages (Python or Perl) and working in Linux environment


Skills desired:

-Knowledge of high-speed digital & mixed-signal design
-Familiarity with industry digital verification methodology such as VMM/UVM
-Familiarity with version control systems (GIT/SVN/Perforce)
-Good organization and communication skills for interacting with teammates


Responsibilities of this job include:

-Creating and updating test plans and test cases
-Writing modular constrained-random/coverage driven Verilog, SystemVerilog
and UVM/VMM testbenches
-Writing SystemVerilog assertions
-Monitoring simulation regressions and debugging RTL and Gate level simulation failures
-Writing functional coverage and performing functional/code/assertion coverage analysis
-Tracking issues in Jira and documenting in Confluence

Applicants must be currently enrolled in accredited institution to be eligible for an internship.

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our department in the role of a Business Analyst, with the Data Management and Operations Section (DMOS) . Business Analysts play key roles in the delivery of projects that the organization undertakes which have an impact on Canadians. The DMOS undertakes projects that involve ingesting new meteorological datasets, quality assessment of the data ingested and project management for mission-critical data and products to benefit prediction and forecast to meet the needs of the Government of Canada and Canadians. We are looking for enthusiastic students who are interested in making an impact to join us.

Business Analyst duties may include:

  • Developing decoder specifications for ingesting new meteorological datasets
  • Developing business process models, requirements catalogues, use cases, maintaining controlled vocabularies, and detailed data specifications for meteorological data and metadata based on research and engagement of clients and subject matter experts.
  • Developing dashboards and interacting with relational databases via SQL or tools such as MS Access, Power BI, etc.
  • Documenting existing and proposed business processes, policies, and systems, and validating proposed processes, designs, or applications against requirements.
  • Opportunities to explore new technologies (AI, OCR) to provide solutions for data management challenges.
  • Supporting Research & Development and operations to implement data quality assessment techniques.
  • Eliciting and analyzing business requirements through documentation and client engagement and designing solutions to meet organizational needs.
  • Aid in project management by providing support in project tracking and reporting.
  • Technical writing of business processes, policies, and systems, and assessing the impact of proposed changes to the organization and recommending solutions.
  • Working with other business analysts and developers to represent client needs.
  • Supporting project and operational activities, which may include the extraction and validation of data, inventory preparation and post-processing of data, and/or data quality analysis.
  • Supporting software developers and others as they work with the models and data.
  • Performing external scans to determine industry standards and best practices.

You will be assigned to work in multiple project teams, as well as on independent work packages. Students hired into the role are expected to make real contributions to the analysis of business processes and information systems.

You may be assigned to projects in areas such as meteorological and hydrological data management, data quality assessment, information systems renewal, analysis and development of data products, and the development and adoption of metadata standards.

You may also be involved in other major Environment and Climate Change Canada initiatives.

Your application should address how you meet the essential qualifications, along with which assets you may have.

Essential Qualifications:

  • Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing in English
  • Ability to analyze, evaluate, and troubleshoot
  • Ability to manage time effectively
  • Ability to work as part of a team and/or independently
  • Ability to demonstrate initiative
  • Knowledge and experience using Microsoft Excel and Word
  • Demonstrates willingness to learn and fill knowledge gaps
  • Knowledge or understanding of Meteorological data.

Assets:

  • Knowledge of use cases and UML
  • Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and ER diagramming techniques
  • Knowledge of business process modelling, BPMN, and process improvement methodologies
  • Knowledge and/or experience working with XML
  • Ability to program in object-oriented languages or scripting languages
  • Ability or experience working with large datasets
  • Ability to work with databases, such as Oracle and PostgreSQL using tools such as MS Access.
  • Experience in project management or working in a project management environment
  • Experience in using business intelligence tools (e.g. Microsoft Power BI)
  • Experience using Enterprise Architect, Microsoft Visio, or similar applications

Additional Information
The positions are available for 16-month work terms starting May 2024 through August 2025 at our Downsview (Toronto) office at 4905 Dufferin Street and remotely (hybrid working model).

Preference will be given to Canadian citizens. Preference may be given to students with job-related experience and to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Security Clearance as a condition of employment.

Successful completion of both your educational program and the full work term may lead to temporary or permanent federal public service positions for which you meet the merit criteria and conditions of employment.

Interested applicants must submit:
• Cover letter (with clear indication of their citizenship status)
• Resume
• Complete transcript (unofficial transcripts accepted)

The transcript should contain courses for both fall and winter terms of the current academic year and all previous courses.

INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.




ABOUT ENVIRONMENT AND CLIMATE CHANGE CANADA
Environmental issues have wide-ranging implications for social, economic and health decisions for Canadians. The protection and conservation of the environment require the commitments of not only Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) but also all of its partners throughout the federal government and provinces, territories, Indigenous peoples, stakeholders and Canadians. It is for these reasons that ECCC emphasizes partnerships. Ensuring effective engagement helps to advance policies, regulations and services, and provides for a coordinated approach to achieve results that are representative of all interests. ECCC is also relied upon to provide science-based environmental information and services so that Canadians may make informed decisions relating to their health and safety.

There are few major environmental issues for which Canada can find causes or solutions solely within its borders. For this reason, ECCC must engage not only at home but also work with international partners to develop effective solutions to global environmental challenges. The Department seeks to be flexible in order to respond to these challenges and changing circumstances.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is the lead federal department for a wide range of environmental issues. The department addresses these issues through various actions including the implementation of the Pan-Canadian Framework on Clean Growth and Climate Change; engaging with our strategic partners including provinces, territories and Indigenous peoples; monitoring; science-based research; policy and regulatory development; and, through the enforcement of environmental laws. The department's programs focus on minimizing threats to Canadians and their environment from pollution; equipping Canadians to make informed decisions on weather, water and climate conditions; and conserving and restoring Canada's natural environment.

The department's program focus reflects the interdependence between environmental sustainability and economic well-being.

Under the Department of the Environment Act, the powers, duties and functions of the Minister of Environment and Climate Change extend to matters such as:

  • The preservation and enhancement of the quality of the natural environment, including water, air and soil quality, and the coordination of the relevant policies and programs of the Government of Canada
  • Renewable resources, including migratory birds and other non-domestic flora and fauna
  • Meteorology; and
  • The enforcement of rules and regulations

The department delivers its mandate through other acts and regulations, such as the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999 (CEPA 1999), the pollution prevention provisions of the Fisheries Act, the Federal Sustainable Development Act, the Species at Risk Act, the Migratory Birds Convention Act, 1994, the Canada Wildlife Act, and the Wild Animal and Plant Protection and Regulation of International and Interprovincial Trade Act.

The department works closely with the Canadian Environmental Assessment Agency and Parks Canada – its ministerial portfolio partners – to achieve many common goals. In addition, the Minister of Environment and Climate Change has secondary or shared responsibility for delivering on other federal departments’ mandates, including the Arctic Waters Pollution Prevention Act (Transport Canada, Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada, and Natural Resources Canada), the Canada Oil and Gas Operations Act (Natural Resources Canada), and the Emergency Management Act (Public Safety Canada).

Please visit our website at: https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. The successful candidate will be working with many different departments at Honda in conjunction with the IT department to ensure we are all working towards the same goal. In addition, there will be opportunity to connect with peers from other Honda sites around North America to understand and foster work relationships that will assist in building technology and implementation standards for IT engineering. The Business Intelligence Intern will focus on data analytics, business intelligence, and database administration. All of these elements play an important role in our push to develop SmartFactory and Industry 4.0 solutions.

Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build and deploy BI solutions (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.) into 2 large frame plants based on departmental requirements
  • Reviewing, supporting, and developing in concert with existing Application teams, and Business teams, appropriate database architecture and queries and transform them into visual leading indicators.
  • Developing in concert with existing Data Services, and Business teams, appropriate data analytics solutions to facilitate business units to improve efficiency through evaluation of their operational data.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term. (Currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree.)
  • Currently enrolled in an Information Technology related degree (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, etc.)
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and A LOT of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience designing, building, or deploying business intelligence (BI) solutions (particularly Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.)
  • Database architecture and device experience (particularly familiar with Microsoft SQL Server & IBM DB2)
  • Data Analytics and experience with delivering data solutions for business consumption
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
  • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
Student_Testimonials_2024-_HTS_Engineering.pdf

Short Company Profile: HTS Engineering Ltd. is the largest independent commercial HVAC manufacturers’ rep in North America. Many of the 700+ employees across the 16 offices in the US and Canada interned as co-op students at HTS, and many are graduates of well-known Ontario Universities. HTS has recently launched a vibrant new look and brand promise -- one that reflects our companywide commitment to ensure the individual success of all those involved in a project’s HVAC system selection, design, purchase, installation and maintenance.

Job Description :
HTS offers a variety of co-op placements throughout Ontario. There are an array of different responsibilities and depending on your placement you will be designing simple and complex HVAC systems, making engineering selections of HVAC equipment, creating reports, creating pricing and quotation for jobs, and analyzing mechanical blueprints. There will be opportunities to attend site visits, design sessions, job closings, equipment seminars, customer entertainment and more.
Our management style allows for student to grow and gain knowledge during their work term. After a successful work term, your following work placements will provide you with the opportunity to rotate through the different divisions of HTS and have the opportunity of  becoming a  full-time employee after graduation. As a company that has hired co-ops since our foundation, we know how to make your term at HTS a success.

HTS is looking for individuals who:
-Manage their time, prioritize and work independently
-Take pride in their work and can provide high quality work in a fast-paced environment
-Can communicate efficiently and effectively with employees in other departments
-Enjoy building new relationships, interacting with suppliers, customers and co-workers
-Are eager to further develop their project management skills
-Have an entrepreneurial drive and desire to succeed
-Have the ability to learn new desktop-based software quickly
-Have an interest in HVAC equipment system design
-Are looking to expand their technical knowledge in the fields of Heat & Mass Transfer, Thermodynamics and Fluid Mechanics

Note: On your resume, do not be afraid to go beyond your technical skills to include details that let your personality, interests, and experiences shine through, whether you deem them relevant to this position or not. We want to know what kind of a person you are.

HTS Offers

  • An independent work environment in a small team comprised of experienced engineers
  • Work on large name projects, such as UWaterloo QNC & E5, Pearson Airport, TD and Amazon
  • Work with the newest and leading high-efficiency HVAC equipment
  • Insight into the design-build, bid, and procurement process in the construction industry
  • A genuine and co-operative sales approach
  • Understanding of the positions and responsibilities of owners, developers, project managers, architects, consulting engineers, general contractors, sub-contractors, manufacturer’s representatives and manufacturers in the construction process
  • Knowledge of LEED principles, and the barriers and opportunities for green HVAC technology
  • A co-op friendly atmosphere, where everyone is willing to answer your questions
  • A fun work term in a young and dynamic environment, surrounded by co-ops and recent grads
    Competitive wages and flexible work hours

Job Requirements:

We have many different departments and the job requirements vary.  Duties may include:

  • Reviewing and understanding plans and specs related to the bid tender process
  • Identifying equipment on schedules, counts, spec review, tender form review
  • Equipment pricing and selections together with our engineering team
  • Working in our software system TRAX to upload all information required
  • Interaction with contractors for information required on our equipment
    Daily monitoring for new and existing  job requests  along with addenda

Bi-Weekly meetings with our team to review up and coming job takeoffs and job closings

Project Management

  • Shop Drawing submittals process
  • Working with contractors to establish equipment releases
  • Ordering equipment
  • Site visits as required for any coordination, site measuring, etc (following COVID guidelines)
  • Site visits as required for startup or site issues (following COVID guidelines)
  • Coordinating startups/commissioning
  • Sending close out documentation required to contractors

jobDescription:
Company Info
ACCIONA, a globally recognized company, has been certified as a Top Employer in Canada for 2022 and 2023, emphasizing its dedication to prioritizing people management in its core strategy. With a workforce spanning across five continents and exceeding 45,000 employees, ACCIONA values diversity, prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer, and emphasizes creating highly skilled and diverse teams equipped for evolving environments. Committed to sustainable development, ACCIONA offers meaningful career opportunities, prioritizes employee professional growth, and places a strong emphasis on health and safety in the workplace.

Job Description

You will be involved in some of the largest and most complex transportation infrastructure and heavy civil construction projects in North America.

You will work with ACCIONA’s Infrastructure team, reporting directly to a Senior Engineer and working alongside our diverse team of professionals. You will be involved in a wide variety of activities, supporting our operations.

In this role, you will gain hands-on experience, learning how to apply the skills and knowledge you’ve acquired through your education in a professional setting. You will be exposed to and participate in a variety of functions depending on the role you are assigned, such as:

  • Technical/Design
  • RFQ/RFP preparation
  • Procurement
  • Commercial
  • Estimating & Quantity Takeoffs
  • Scheduling & Planning
  • Cost Control
  • Quality, Health, Safety & Environment
  • Construction Management
  • Other

Job Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in a civil engineering or related engineering program at an accredited college or university.
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others on teams.
  • Willingness to learn

jobDescription:
Co-op Student - Powersports Traction Process Improvement

ACS Powersports is a leading company in the snowmobile traction products industry, providing various accessories and parts for improving the performance and safety of snowmobiles. We are looking for a co-op student who is pursuing a degree in mechanical, electrical, or mechatronics engineering to join our team for a 12-month period.

Responsibilities

As a co-op student, you will:

  • Work closely with the CEO, Plant Engineering Manager, and General Manager to improve the current powersports traction processes by means of automation, optimal ergonomics, and efficiency with best logistics and work/product flow.
  • Act as a project manager for this endeavor, creating a budget, developing a process concept, benchmarking best-in-class processes, working with the buyer on purchasing materials, robots, and all necessary equipment, and deploying the project.
  • Apply your engineering knowledge and skills to solve problems, design solutions, and implement improvements.
  • Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, presenting your progress and results in a clear and professional manner.
  • Learn from experienced engineers and managers, gaining valuable industry insights and exposure.

Qualifications
To be eligible for this position, you must:

  • Be enrolled in the co-op program at the University of Toronto, pursuing a degree in mechanical, electrical, or mechatronics engineering.
  • Have completed at least two years of your engineering program, with a minimum GPA of 3.0.
  • Have a strong interest and passion for the powersports industry and process improvement.
  • Have excellent analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
  • Have proficient computer skills, including MS Office, CAD, and programming languages.
  • Have good oral and written communication skills, with the ability to work independently and in a team.
  • Have a valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle, as some travel may be required.

Benefits
As a co-op student, you will:

  • Receive a competitive salary and benefits package.

jobDescription:
About the Team
Production Scheduling is the process of arranging, controlling, and optimizing work and workloads in a production or manufacturing process.  Kinaxis Enterprise Scheduling unifies production planning and scheduling activities on a single, concurrent platform, allowing planners and schedulers to immediately see the impact of demand and supply changes, from forecast all the way down to the shopfloor schedule.

The Enterprise Scheduling team is focused on building an enterprise level scheduling application with the flexibility of a site-level scheduler and a focus on fast, scalable scheduling algorithms. The team has a passion for solving complex scheduling problems and building highly scalable, configurable, and extensible applications.

What you will do - Design and implement novel Production Scheduling models, heuristics, and meta-heuristics
- Translate real world Production Scheduling use cases and constraints into computational models
- Collaborate closely with our experienced developers, adhering to best practices including unit testing, and software craftmanship
- Engage actively in our scrum rituals, contribute to design discussions, and partake in code review sessions
- As a product-focused team, embrace a range of roles including tester, investigator, facilitator, and support
- May perform additional projects as requested

Technologies We Use - Java for core algorithm development
- IntelliJ, JIRA, Confluence, Git
- State of the art in-memory database and analytics technology
What we have to offer Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About the Role:
As a member of our Compiler team, you will work with leaders from industry and academia to develop entirely new solutions for the toughest problems in AI compute.
As deep neural network architectures evolve, they are becoming enormously parallel, and distributed. Compilers are needed to optimize the mappings of computation graphs to compute nodes. In this position, you will build the tools that generate distributed memory code from evolving intermediate representations.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and devise graph semantics, intermediate representations, and abstraction layers between high-level definitions (like MLIR) and low-level (LLVM IR) distributed code
  • Use state-of-the-art parallelization and partitioning techniques to automate generation of distributed kernels
  • Low-level optimization on a SIMD/tensor-aware architecture of compute nodes
  • Identify, design and implement novel program analysis and optimization techniques
  • Design and implement custom system tools (such as linkers) for architectures with massive number of compute nodes

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field and enrollment in University of Toronto’s PEY program.
  • High proficiency in programming using Python or C++
  • Solid understanding of fundamental concepts related to system design, such as data structures, algorithms, and operating systems.
  • Related experience or fundamental knowledge of compilers and distributed systems
  • Familiarity with high-level parallel program analysis and optimization

Preferred requirements:

  • LLVM compiler internals
  • Polyhedral models
  • Familiarity with HPC kernels and their optimization

jobDescription:
About Structura Biotechnology

Structura Biotechnology is a Toronto-based scientific software company with origins at UofT. We build CryoSPARC , the industry-leading software platform for cryo-electron microscopy (cryo-EM) image analysis. Cryo-EM is a powerful Nobel prize-winning structural biology technique that uses computer vision and machine learning algorithms to determine the 3D structure of biological molecules, including proteins, protein-drug complexes and viruses from 2D microscope data. It has revolutionized structural biology because it enables discovery of therapeutically important protein structures that could not be obtained before by other techniques.

Using our computational tools, scientists at pharmaceutical companies, biotechs and academic research labs are making breakthroughs in life science and drug discovery projects that were previously impossible. Just a few examples of the hundreds of new discoveries made using CryoSPARC: 3D structure of the insulin receptor , critical in understanding diabetes; first-ever 3D structure of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein in 2020, which was subsequently used for COVID vaccine development efforts; first structures of LRRK2 with possible drug candidates attached , a protein heavily implicated in Parkinson's disease.

Our foremost aim is to continuously build new algorithms, methods and workflow features that enable scientists using CryoSPARC to make groundbreaking discoveries using the revolutionary technology of cryo-EM. We engage in cutting-edge research, algorithm development, and software development for cryo-EM image data processing. We develop and apply novel machine learning, computer vision and large scale inference algorithms and research to solve the problem of reconstructing 3D structures of biological molecules from cryo-EM data.

In this role, you will develop and implement novel algorithms and computational techniques to advance the state of CryoSPARC and the global field of cryo-EM computational methods. Much of the work you will do is at the frontiers of the field, with incredible opportunities for research, learning, collaboration and experimentation. Your code will be deployed to thousands of scientists who will use it daily.  We have been hiring PEY students for several years and they have done excellent work and even gone on to be featured as UofT’s Grads to Watch .

What you will do:

  • Implement and validate computer vision and machine learning (large scale inference) algorithms
  • Write stable high performance numerical/scientific code for CPU and GPU
  • Perform thorough experiments on real protein data to validate algorithms
  • Contribute to advancing CryoSPARC’s capabilities and the state-of-the-art in structural biology and cryo-EM data processing
  • Learn about all aspects of what makes a scientific software company work
  • Learn best practices for software development in an advanced team
  • Our technology stack: Python, C, CUDA, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pytorch

Qualifications:

Structura is the right fit for you if you are a motivated individual who is excited about learning new things, thinking on your feet, and becoming an integral part of a team of talented peers working to create something meaningful. We don’t differentiate between undergrad, grad, etc. Everyone on the team is encouraged to speak up, take ownership of their work and take things to the next level with their contribution. The ideal candidate will be willing to learn, take initiative, and adapt well to changing circumstances.

Must have:
- Proficiency in Python and numerical computing, especially using numpy
- Experience with computer vision, signal processing, and/or image processing
- Solid understanding of mathematical concepts like Fourier transforms and interpolation, probability and statistics
- At least a basic knowledge of Unix-based systems, command-line interfaces
- Excellent time management and communication skills
- Diligence and persistence for research projects and experimentation

Nice to have:
- Experience in numerical computing using C, CUDA
- Experience with medical imaging, visualization, 3D imaging
- Knowledge of optimization methods and modern machine learning

- Hybrid Schedule: 2 fixed days in person and 3 days remotely

jobDescription:
We power Alberta. Our transmission lines deliver electricity to millions of Albertans 24 hours a day, seven days a week. When you’re on our team, you’re supporting our province’s homes, farms, businesses and industries by providing safe, reliable and cost-effective service. Whether working in the field or in the office, every AltaLinker contributes to keeping the lights on.

As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway Energy family, we are part of a global group of companies delivering sustainable electricity and utility services to customers worldwide. Our exceptional customer service, commitment to the environment, and world-class safety record makes us a leader in our industry.

Today, the transmission system is more important than ever. As we connect new sources of renewable energy to the grid and support Alberta’s energy transition to net-zero emissions, AltaLink’s transmission system is the backbone of the changing electricity system. With our head office in Calgary, and regional offices in Greater Edmonton, Red Deer and Lethbridge, we have central and southern Alberta covered.

We offer work with meaning, incredible opportunities for development, work life balance and opportunities to contribute to your community.  Join our team!

Job Description:

NOTE: The start date for this position is May 2025 for 16 months. Students with a graduation date of 2026 or later will be considered.

An opportunity currently exists for a Co-Op/Internship student on the Operational Engineering team within the Operations organization at AltaLink’s Calgary office. Reporting to the Manager, Operational Engineering, the successful candidate will be part of a multi-disciplinary engineering team responsible for supporting issues on AltaLink’s transmission facilities in Alberta, which range in voltage class from 69kV to 500kV. The successful candidate will be providing support in one or more of the technical sub-groups such as transmission lines, civil, substations, SCADA, protection and control (P&C), and compliance.

Responsibilities:

Sample responsibilities could include but are not limited to:

  • Liaise with internal and external customers to address issues and concerns.
  • Understand and communicate AltaLink’s requirements and standards with Third parties, especially those who are contemplating work which is in proximity of, crosses, or encroaches on AltaLink’s facilities.
  • Support root cause failure analysis (RCFA) investigation, analysis, trending, and reporting on equipment failures and saves.
  • Provide engineering support on requests related to AltaLink’s power system assets across the transmission line, civil, substation, protection & control, or SCADA disciplines. Requests come from internal engineering teams, field staff, other utilities, and customers.
  • Provide analysis of existing assists for system performance enhancements and recommended standards changes and upgrades.
  • Provide engineering design or study support on the emergency response to asset failures.
  • Support the gathering of evidence required to demonstrate compliance to internal and external compliance frameworks such as Alberta Reliability Standards and ISO 27001/19

Qualifications:

  • An Electrical Engineering student (ideally specializing in power systems) who has completed two or more years of study and is enrolled in a Co-Op/Internship program at a recognized University.
  • Knowledge of electrical transmission facilities (substations, civil, lines, P&C and SCADA) would be an asset.
  • Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office: TEAMS, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Dedicated team player with strong interpersonal and communications skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills, with the ability to manage a wide variety of issues simultaneously and meet strict deadlines.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills to interface with team members and customers to promote positive customer outcomes.
  • Proven track record of good attendance and job performance.

Candidates chosen for face-to-face interviews will be asked to upload their unofficial transcripts.

AltaLink employees should be aware that we may contact your manager during the selection process.  Some positions may require job specific assessments, regular criminal record checks, additional AltaLink training, medical assessments, annual drivers abstract, and drug tests.  Please contact the Hiring Manager or Recruiter for further clarification if required.

We thank all candidates for their interest in a career with AltaLink. Due to the high volume of applications, we will only be contacting candidates being considered for an interview. We sincerely appreciate all interest and invite all candidates to follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and/or X.

In proceeding with your application, you will be required to submit personal information to AltaLink through our applicant tracking service provider and this information will be accessible to AltaLink personnel involved in AltaLink’s hiring processes.  AltaLink also relies on third parties to assist in the hiring process and your information may be provided to them for this purpose. In the application process, AltaLink will require you to provide consent to the collection, use, and storage of your personal information for these purposes.

At AltaLink, we celebrate diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fair employment practices, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religious beliefs, colour, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, ancestry, place of origin, marital status, family status, source of income, sexual orientation or any other category protected by applicable provincial or federal law.

For eligible positions AltaLink offers optional hybrid work that provides flexibility between working from home and the office.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.


CurbIQ

Arcadis is proud of our curated selection of ground-breaking digital products. Created in response to specific client needs, we feel they are uniquely positioned to support our customers in this rapidly changing world. One of these products, is CurbIQ – an industry leading curbside and mobility management software, are part of the solution outlined in this proposal. CurbIQ can quickly and efficiency collect and digitize curb and parking inventories, display them on a map, keep the inventory up to date, analyze the inventory, and share the data with any interested party in a recognized data standard. CurbIQ can also integrate occupancy data from sources such as sensors, cameras, and parking apps, to show real time curb occupancy and other information on its platform. More information about CurbIQ can be found at our website https://www.curbiq.io/ .

Role Description

The way we get around on a daily basis is rapidly changing. With the growth of e-commerce, transportation network companies, and new mobility solutions there has never been greater demand for dedicated space in our cities. At Arcadis, we’re not sitting back and reacting to these changes, but leading the way and developing new tools and systems that will define the cities of tomorrow.

This posting is for a position with CurbIQ, a product that helps cities digitize, understand, and manage the curbside and all the mobility options surrounding it.

The work you’ll be doing is highly analytical, and you’ll be helping to solve problems that will change how cities work. You will help to develop and utilize new technologies, and diversify your skill set by having the opportunity to work and learn about transportation engineering, GIS, data analysis, automation, artificial intelligence, the full product development life cycle, and much more.

We’re looking for keen, motivated individuals, who are interested in exploring a career on the leading edge of transportation technology and operations.

Role Accountabilities:

  • Assist in development of a new Arcadis product (CurbIQ) related to transportation;
  • Actively support deployments of products for new clients, by performing data generation, configuration, and troubleshooting;
  • Conduct data analysis, interpretation, and manipulation;
  • Research and develop new technologies and facilitate their development and integration into the overall product workflow;
  • Design, create mockups, write specifications, oversee development, and test various new features for innovative products
  • Develop automations and process improvements to streamline workflows and increase overall efficiency;
  • Apply problem solving skills to help bring the product to market and grow adoption;
  • Lead multiple tasks, facilitate team meetings, and perform general team coordination duties;
  • Coordinate with multi-disciplinary teams across multiple Arcadis offices.

Qualifications & Experiences:

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal;
  • Excellent organization and time management;
  • Data analysis and manipulation skills are an asset;
  • Familiarity with GIS (e.g., QGIS, GeoPandas, ArcGIS Online) is an asset; and,
  • Programming/scripting experience is an asset, and familiarity with Python preferred;
  • SQL, AWS (EC2, S3, SageMaker, Lamba, API Gateway), and API development experience is not required, but is an asset;
  • Machine learning experience is not required, but is an asset;
  • Past transportation related experience is an asset but not required.

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.
