jobDescription:
COMPANY:

Select Equity Group (SEG) was founded in 1990 on the premise that rigorous, independent research and disciplined, long-term investing will generate superior returns for our clients. Today, the Firm has over $35 billion in assets across long-only and long/short strategies utilizing a team-based approach and centralized research effort. Our global client base includes endowments, foundations, public and private pensions, private banks, family offices and high-net-worth individuals. Our more than 200 employees possess diversity of thought, experiences and backgrounds and share a commitment to our Core Principles (below). Our employees thrive in a collaborative environment that empowers them to apply curiosity, creativity, and continuous improvement in pursuit of differentiated excellence for our clients.

Commitment to Giving Back: The Select Equity Group Foundation, established in 2000, makes a positive impact by actively engaging all employees in identifying and supporting charitable organizations of excellence.

Location: This position is based in the Firm’s Toronto office.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

The Data Engineer Intern will be part of the Firm’s Data & Analytics team and reports to one of the Data Engineers on the team. His/her primary responsibility is to develop innovative and scalable ways to ingest, process, and analyze data – generating deep and unconventional investment insights for companies of interest. The Data team operates in a vertically integrated model, with responsibilities spanning from data sourcing to processing and analytics.

The ideal candidate is an entrepreneurial self-starter who is passionate about continuous learning in a rapidly evolving data space.  Extreme technical competence (but not necessarily in Big Data), intellectual curiosity, and attention to detail are essential, as are flexibility and comfort working in a growing organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Sourcing data: supporting technical vendor due diligence (e.g., assessing data quality, systematic backtesting against fundamental metrics); developing bespoke in-house data acquisition programs; interfacing with vendors to ingest data into our cloud-based infrastructure
  • Featuring data: developing in-house algorithms to process data (e.g., sentiment analysis, product matching, SQL enrichment); delivering bespoke insights to investment analysts
  • Predictive analytics: collaborating with Data Insights Analysts to determine statistical significance and error ranges of findings for a wide variety of data sources and analyses; developing data-driven models to predict key company financial and operational metrics
  • Infrastructure development and maintenance: creating custom solutions to continuously monitor our data pipeline; maintaining our underlying cloud infrastructure and platforms; continuous due diligence of new technologies for introduction to the Firm
  • Application development: developing bespoke web-based applications to facilitate data adoption within investment research

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Currently in the 3rd year of an Engineering or Computer Science or Math degree with a minimum 3.6GPA
  • Prior programming experience
  • Proficient with concepts in statistics (e.g., regressions, predictive models, tests of significance)
  • Hands on experience with the following:
    • Cloud architecture (e.g., AWS, GCP)
    • Interacting with data at scale (e.g., Pandas, SQL)
    • Container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow)
    • Automated data acquisition (e.g., Scrapy)
    • Machine learning, NLP, and/or ML-ops
    • Contributions to the open source community
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Track record of continuous learning
  • Demonstrated passion for data, although past experience not required
  • Highest degree of integrity, professionalism and confidentiality
  • Fit with Select Equity’s Core Principles (below)

CORE PRINCIPLES:

  • Originality: We generate our own ideas and never deploy common practice without skepticism. We strive to avoid the herd.
  • Innate Curiosity: We ask dumb questions. We challenge universally accepted beliefs and seek new levels of understanding.
  • Continuous Improvement: We constantly reassess our investments, policies and processes. We embrace a culture of intellectual integrity, learning, mentorship, self-reflection, entrepreneurship and growth.
  • Charity: We actively participate in our communities and give back to society in meaningful and thoughtful ways.
  • Humility: We seek no acclaim individually or as a Firm other than to earn the respect of our clients.
  • Teamwork: We trust our colleagues and communicate with transparency and respect. We measure success as a team, not as individuals.

jobDescription:
The Role

Pason is seeking a Data Science Intern for a 16-month internship from May 2025 until August 2026. You will use your strong analytical and programming skills to extract meaningful insights from IoT-based sensor data. Your responsibilities will include developing data analytics, signal processing, machine learning, and control loop algorithms. You will work with a talented group of algorithm and control system designers in an applied research setting.

This is an opportunity to learn how data science works in a real-world industrial application.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Design algorithms which clean, aggregate, and analyze data from industrial process sensors for the purposes of performance analysis, event detection, and process optimization.
  • Design, test, and deploy standalone and web-based software applications for data analytics.
  • Design real-time signal processing and control loop algorithms and test their performance on historical sensor data as well as live field trials.
  • Learn state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and perform experiments to determine how they are best applied to petroleum oilfield data.
  • Work with Pason account managers to solve mathematical and statistical analysis problems for high-priority customers.
  • Learn and use the following technologies: Matlab, Python (ML and dashboarding libraries), Java, GIT, AWS, SQL databases, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, and web frameworks.
  • Participate in team technical discussions, research paper reviews, and propose novel ideas to solve challenging engineering problems.
  • Present product prototypes to sales, engineering, and/or management teams.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Programming languages such as Matlab, Python, Java, and SQL
  • Python dashboarding libraries such as Streamlit and Plotly Dash
  • Machine learning, signal processing, and control systems
  • Statistical analysis and data visualization
  • Database architecture, development, and management

Hybrid Work Environment

  • This position allows the opportunity for an employee to work in a hybrid environment where a portion of their role is in the office and the other portion remote.

Education

  • Currently enrolled in 3rd year studies in Electrical, Computer, Software or Geomatics Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields

Pre-employment Conditions

  • Completion of a satisfactory Criminal Record Check

jobDescription:
Birch Hill is recruiting Co-op Analysts to join Canada’s premier Private Equity Data Science & Strategy team. Our team is growing quickly, and we are looking for motivated, intelligent candidates who love data, strategy, and solving complex problems. We are highly analytical with diverse backgrounds in consulting, investment banking, engineering, and pure and applied math and science. We intensely focus on understanding and improving the inner workings of companies and processes to unlock value. For us, data is the means to an end, not simply the end.

About Birch Hill

Birch Hill is a Canadian mid-market private equity firm with a long history of driving growth in our portfolio companies and delivering returns to our investors. Based in Toronto, we currently have over $5 billion in capital under management. Since 1994, we have made over 71 investments, including MLSE, CCM Hockey, SleepCountry, Softchoice, and Constellation Software. Today, our 14 partner companies collectively represent one of Canada’s largest corporate entities with over $9 billion in total revenue and more than 30,000 employees.

About the Data Science & Strategy Team

The Data Science & Strategy Team focuses on creating value for our companies by enabling data-driven decision making through timely data and advanced analytics.  With appropriate information, systems and processes, our companies optimize their competitive positioning and profitably grow. We lead a wide array of project archetypes, all grounded by a foundational excellence in analytics and measuring success. Informed by Birch Hill’s investment premise, our projects support key components of the company’s competitive strategy.

We partner with portfolio companies as not only technical leaders, but also strategic leaders. We enthusiastically subscribe to the “Where to Play, How to Win, Measure Success” strategic framework. Past projects include, but are not limited to, market mapping, customer lifetime value, Five Forces analysis, sales enablement, digital marketing, constructing supply and demand curves, work- or process-flow studies, and logistics optimization . Our data infrastructure playbook uses best-in-class methods in data engineering, data modelling, and dashboard design to provide our portfolio companies and investment teams with timely and accurate information for measuring success.

We also support Birch Hill’s sourcing and due diligence efforts regarding potential investments including assessing and screening candidates using alternative data sources, optimizing information flow around our deal pipeline, and completing market mapping and customer analytics to inform the investment thesis.

The Co-op Analyst Role

Successful candidates will utilize a variety of tools and skill sets to solve structured and unstructured problems and to support the strategic objectives of Birch Hill’s portfolio companies. Co-op Analysts will work with the team to identify areas of improvement within processes and systems and use analytical skills to produce high-quality analysis. They will also support implementation of their analysis, including working directly with investment professionals and senior executives.

Qualifications

  • Enrolled in an undergraduate program in business, sciences, math, statistics and/or engineering
  • Ability to analytically approach and solve broad and challenging problems
  • Strong communications skills to articulate complex analyses clearly to a variety of stakeholders
  • Curiosity, a desire to be challenged, and the aspiration to continually learn
  • Proficiency in data manipulation languages like SQL, Python, or R
  • Relevant work experience in a data analytics, consulting, or finance role would be an asset

Previous experience with databases, business intelligence tools, ETL pipelines, and/or machine learning systems would be an asset.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply through the link provided by Wednesday, October 9, 2024 , with cover letter addressed to Mary-Helen Kistner, Recruiting Coordinator and include resume and transcripts.

jobDescription:
DECISION ANALYTICS ASSOCIATE - PEY INTERN

Decision Analytics Associate - Interns design and execute analyses to address business problems for our clients and project teams. In particular, Interns work on one or more project teams and may leverage their analytic skills to find data-driven insights that help our clients solve their most important business problems. At the end of the internship, interns are evaluated and considered for a full-time employment offer.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop and apply advanced statistical models that help clients understand dynamic business issues.
  • Leverage analytic techniques to use data to guide client and ZS team decision-making.
  • Use tools like R, Tableau, SAS, Visual Basic and Excel to investigate and inform client needs.
  • Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams.
  • Collaborate with client and ZS teams to implement solutions.
  • Take immediate responsibility for project deliverables.

What You’ll Bring

  • Candidates should be about to enter the final year of a bachelor's or master's degree in any discipline with strong academic performance in quantitative and analytic coursework such as operations research, applied mathematics, management science, data science, statistics, econometrics or engineering.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in a programming language or analytic tool such as R, SAS, Tableau, or VBA.
  • High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills (fluency in English).
  • Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence.
  • Strong attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset.
  • Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks.
  • Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams.

Perks & Benefits:

ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths and collaborative culture empowers you to thrive as an individual and global team member.â€¯

We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working.â€¯ A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and on-site presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.

Considering applying?

At ZS, we're building a diverse and inclusive company where people bring their passions to inspire life-changing impact in global healthcare and beyond. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and recognize the value that candidates with all backgrounds, including non-traditional ones, bring. If you are interested in joining us, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements listed above.

ZS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities without regard to any class protected by applicable law.

To Complete Your Application:

Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment.

An on-line application, including a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered.

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a DevOps I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for an intern to join our Commercial & Specialty SE team, here’s what you’ll do here:

  • Implement and test low to moderately complex code changes to fix identified defects in existing s/w products (e.g., identify and debug an application) or to moderately enhance new/future s/w releases.

  • Troubleshoots low to moderate defects within code (within own component) and provide input into and performs actions as designated in the remediation plan.

  • Contribute to the development of requirements with product management and architects; provides recommendations to enhance design to prevent recurring defects.

  • Provide additional support in solving software/systems monitoring issues and escalations which require moderate technical expertise to troubleshoot.  Complete low to medium configuration activities such as alerts, dashboards, etc.

  • Assisting in automation of deployment of solutions as code (working in a CICD space).

  • Ensure systems are optimal and meet quality standards by analyzing, providing creative suggestions to improve services and user experiences.

  • Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences.

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Strong team player ready to collaborate with different teams to solve complex problems

  • Experience in Java is preferred

  • Knowledge of CICD (Continuous Integration Continuous Delivery) is considered an asset

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 4. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

jobDescription:
Introduction:

Work with Cadence's semiconductor IP team, designing best in-class SerDes in the latest semiconductor processes using  leading industry tools and methodologies. We are seeking an exceptional intern to join our SerDes IP team in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates will be joining some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to develop products that make data faster.

Our Approach to Internships:

Make you an integral part of the team by providing training, mentorship, and encouraging your creative Talents. As part of a smaller, tight-knit design group, you will be given opportunities to work on various tasks that span the entire business-engineering cycle. Our goal is to equip students with practical work experience and a big picture view of how business is conducted in the semiconductor industry. You will only be limited by your desire to learn and ambition to assume more responsibilities. We understand that it is best to learn by doing. We will provide tasks that enable you to learn while also making meaningful technical contributions. We also consider interns as full-fledged team members and as your knowledge grows, so does the number of tasks and their complexities. The internship program is also an important step in our full-time post-graduation recruitment strategy, with many of our former interns returning as full-time employees.

Description:
The Digital ASIC Design / Verification Engineering Intern will be reporting to digital engineering director and is a Full-Time position. The team is working on the next generation PCIe SERDES Phy IP. The Intern will work with cutting edge technology and EDA tools to develop and validate Cadence’ designs pre silicon. The intern is expected to interact extensively with logic, verification, physical design, analog and system engineers in the team. By the end of internship, the intern will have full exposure to all aspects of digital ASIC development from RTL design & verification to tape-out.

Company Information:

Cadence is the global leader in software, hardware, and services that is driving the transformation of the electronic design automation (EDA) industry. This application-driven approach for creating, integrating, and optimizing designs helps customers realize Analog & Digital ICs ,  System-On-Chip devices, IP and complete systems at lower costs and with higher quality.

Cadence is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

Responsibilities:

  • RTL coding, simulation, and verification
  • Design and verification flow automation, improvements, and development
  • Compiling timing constraints and performing logic synthesis
  • Interface with application engineering team on design integration issues and technical customer support requests
  • Collaborating with experienced engineers on managing multiple projects, build flows, and design/verification environments.

Skills/Requirements:

  • Students who have completed third year engineering in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Engineering Science
  • Strong academic background, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and an ability to excel working in a team environment.
  • The successful candidate will be a proven self-starter with the ability to proactively identify problem situations and propose technically viable solutions.
  • Preferred candidate has experience in Verilog HDL and scripting with Python, Perl, or similar object-oriented languages.

Application Requirements:

  • Please include a cover letter, resume, and transcript with your application. Only complete applications will be reviewed.
  • Please indicate your preference for internship positions on your cover letter. If you are interested in more than one internship position, than please rank your preferences.

jobDescription:
Tenstorrent is leading the industry on cutting-edge AI technology, revolutionizing performance expectations, ease of use, and cost efficiency. With AI redefining the computing paradigm, solutions must evolve to unify innovations in software models, compilers, platforms, networking, and semiconductors. Our diverse team of technologists have developed a high performance RISC-V CPU from scratch, and share a passion for AI and a deep desire to build the best AI platform possible. We value collaboration, curiosity, and a commitment to solving hard problems. We are growing our team and looking for contributors of all seniorities.

At Tenstorrent, you will have the chance to accelerate your career by working on challenging engineering problems with a dedicated mentor and the opportunity to move between the digital design, verification, firmware, software and system engineering teams.

This role is on-site based in Toronto, Ontario.

Responsibilities:

  • Implementation of Tenstorrent IP and SOC RTL logic in Verilog
  • Architecture exploration and modeling
  • Occasional verification of Tenstorrent's IP and SOC logic, using advanced verification methodologies - UVM, FPGA prototyping, and emulation
  • Performance and power verification and validation of Tenstorrent's IP and SOC
  • Runtime firmware and low-level software implementation
  • Benchmark and  analyze performance optimizations for key machine learning algorithms across Tenstorrent hardware and software stack
  • Development of frameworks for automating post-silicon verification, data analysis and debug
  • Support board/system design and debug

Experience & Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of Hardware Description Languages (Verilog/VHDL)
  • Interest and knowledge of processor/computer architecture
  • Interest and knowledge of the full ASIC design flow, including design, verification, synthesis, P&R
  • C/C++ as well as scripting languages (C, C++, Python, Perl, tcl)
  • Strong Python scripting skills
  • Experience with high frequency logic design, scalar and vector processor architecture, GPU architecture and programming models, digital signal processing hardware, SoC architecture, memory sub system architecture, real time hardware/firmware systems and PCB design is very beneficial
  • Understanding of deep learning concepts and familiarity with popular machine learning frameworks and models
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

jobDescription:
The Opportunity


We're looking for the Wavemakers of tomorrow.

Alphawave Semi enables tomorrow’s future by accelerating the critical data communication at the heart of our digital world – from seamless video streaming to AI to the metaverse and much more. Our technology powers product innovation in the most data-demanding industries today, including data centers, networking, storage, artificial intelligence, 5G wireless infrastructure, and autonomous vehicles. Customers partner with us for mission-critical data communication, our innovative technologies, and our proven track record. Together, we enable the next generation of digital technology.

About Our Team
We value growth and collaboration in the Digital Design Verification team. We enjoy working together and take pride in supporting each other to deliver results. Our group is fun, dynamic, and social. Those who wish to pursue a career in semiconductors will find many opportunities on this team to learn new skills, be challenged, and take on real responsibilities.

  • Understand design implementation and develop testcases in SystemVerilog/UVM testbenches

jobDescription:
Seeking a highly motivated engineering student willing to learn Digital Design Verification, which is a critical step of the product development process. Design Verification aims to confirm that the design complies with the Protocol Standards and System Requirements before it is developed into a chip. Exhaustively verifying functionality in the design phase allows engineers to catch bugs early in the development cycle where they are cheaper and easier to fix. Designs have become more complex due to the decreased size of process node technology and to the increase in the number of logic blocks hence the high demand for Digital Design Verification Engineers.

The candidate will be involved in verifying current and next generation Backplane Ethernet, PCIe, USB 3/4, and/or MIPI CPHY/DPHY SERDES products. The position offers an excellent opportunity to work with digital and mixed signal design engineers accountable for delivering high-end mixed-signal designs. Starting in May 2025, this 16-month internship position will be with our Solutions Group in Mississauga. What you will learn:

  • Defining and tracking Verification Testplans
  • Designing and writing constrained-random SystemVerilog testbenches using a Verification Methodology such as UVM (Universal Verification Methodology)
  • Creating and examining Functional Coverage
  • Writing SystemVerilog assertions
  • Debugging RTL and gate-level simulation failures
  • Firmware Debug
  • Bug Tracking using Software Tools such as Jira
  • Code Coverage Analysis

Skill Requirements:

  • Experience writing scripts in languages such as Perl, Unix shell, or Python
  • Experience with any object-oriented programming language (C++, Java, Python, etc.)
  • Familiar with Verilog or SystemVerilog

Education Requirements:

  • Enrolled in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering program, or similar


Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are pledged to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com .

jobDescription:
Signal Integrity Products - Semtech Digital IC Design Engineering Intership

Job Summary:

This position is for a Digital Design Student Internship at Semtech Canada in the Signal Integrity Products group. The design site is located in Burlington, ON, near Appleby GO station.

The position contributes to a team working in the development, design, simulation, verification and post-fabrication characterization of next generation mixed signal integrated circuits for use in Semtech's optical data communication products for data center, 5G wireless and PON applications.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Interpret detailed design specifications to generate RTL or verification code in Verilog or System Verilog
  • Digital design implementation including Synthesis, DFT insertion and STA / timing closure
  • Constrained random verification (UVM) using System Verilog
  • Create scripts and/or methodologies to improve or automate design processes
  • Create technical, process or product documentation
  • Assist in bring-up, lab debug and analysis of ICs in a lab environment

Required Qualifications:

  • Completed at least 3 years of a bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering or similar
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Basic understanding of digital design and/or microelectronics; as evidenced through strong academic accomplishments in these areas

Preferred Skills:

  • Knowledge and familiarity with System Verilog, Verilog or VHDL
  • Knowledge and/or experience with programming and/or scripting languages: C/C++, Perl, Python, System Verilog, Bash
  • Knowledge of digital logic design and understanding of digital systems such as microcontrollers and communication protocols
  • Working knowledge of PC and Unix/Linux operating systems.

Interests:
The candidate should have an interest in the semiconductor industry and digital circuit design. The application of these circuits support system blocks that perform signal equalization, clock data recovery (CDR) and signal drivers.

Application:
In your cover letter, please tell us concisely in one or two sentences about the most impressive project that you have built or achieved. Exact start and end dates are flexible. Interviews can he held on campus or at the Semtech office (4281 Harvester Road, Burlington, ON).

jobDescription:
At The Six Semiconductor (TSS), our mission is to connect people and technology for a smarter world, by accelerating progress and bringing innovative ideas to life. As a semiconductor IP provider with a focus on System-on-Chip (SoC) memory sub-systems, we achieve this mission with our best-in-class mixed-signal designs combined with exceptional service. Our award-winning company is supported by a world-class engineering team with a long list of achievements and accomplishments in the semiconductor industry.

Job Summary

We are looking for a passionate and driven Digital Implementation Engineer Intern to join our engineering team. This internship offers a hands-on opportunity to work alongside experienced engineers, contributing to the digital design implementation process. You will gain valuable experience in digital circuit design, physical design, and the RTL-to-GDSII flow, as well as exposure to industry-standard EDA tools.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in Design Implementation: Support the digital design implementation process, including tasks such as synthesis, PnR, and timing analysis
  • Methodology Development: Develop and enhance design flows using scripting languages to streamline design processes and to improve product quality
  • EDA Tool Usage: Gain hands-on experience with EDA tools under the guidance of senior members of the team
  • Collaboration: Work closely with design and release engineering teams to understand the full design process and contribute to ongoing projects
  • Documentation: Assist in creating and maintaining design documentation and reports

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent field
  • Technical Skills:
    • Understanding of electrical circuits in both transistor and logic gate level
    • Basic understanding of RTL design principles and Verilog HDL language
    • Experience with scripting languages e.g. TCL, Perl, Python is an asset
    • Exposure to digital implementation EDA tools such as Cadence Genus, Innovus is an asset
  • Soft Skills:
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
    • Excellent communication skills
    • Ability to work well both independently and as a team
    • Willingness to learn

jobDescription:
Would you like to develop your skills as the next generation of leaders in the world of technology at one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for Young People (2024)?

We are currently hiring for 12-month or 8-month Digital Technologies (IT) paid internships/co-ops starting in January or May 2025 at our Toronto headquarters. If you are passionate about data and technology and wish to learn and grow continuously, a career at P&G is the right fit for you.

Learn more about our Digital Technologies Internships in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QHUY7AHOsOA

What can you expect?

You can expect meaningful work from Day 1 that creates real value for the company and our consumers. We will match you with a Technology role based on your skills and interests. Depending on your matched role, you could, lead projects that solve exciting supply chain problems, or drive digitization initiatives using the latest technology to optimize company's go to market strategy, or apply business analytics skills to improve brand building experiences, among other interesting opportunities.

THE TYPES OF ROLES YOU COULD TAKE INCLUDE:

  • Data Engineer
  • Software Developer
  • DevOps Manager
  • Technical Project Manager
  • Analytics and Insights Manager
  • Product Manager
  • Scrum Master

In any position you play, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Use data, technology and innovation to deliver results with measurable business value
  • Build relationships and collaborate with others
  • Work autonomously and in teams
  • Develop new technical and soft skills
  • Work with senior leaders to remove roadblocks as needed
  • Lead fast cycle projects for the Canadian business through our Innovation North program
  • Learn about P&G and the many Digital Technologies we use

WHAT SKILLS AND TRAITS ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • A Passion for data and technology
  • A proven track record of leadership and success
  • Ability to build relationships and work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams
  • Passion about continually improving your capabilities and learning new things
  • Superb communication, problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to handle multiple priorities under pressure

What we offer:

  • Responsibilities from Day1; you will have ownership for your work plan from the beginning and will have meaningful projects and responsibilities to deliver
  • A Corporate and Functional onboarding to accelerate your training and development
  • Integration into our Intern & Coop Network for socializing, mentorship and resources
  • Providing honest and constructive feedback on your performance, highlighting opportunities for improvement and growth
  • Competitive Salary

You may receive:

  • Domestic Relocation Benefits to support your home finding trip and moving of personal belongings
  • Work-from-Home Equipment Allowance to support a hybrid work approach

jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

The student will support the Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) team with technical discipline proficiencies. A key role includes the data collection, analysis reporting of effluent quality including eventual roll-up report to external regulators. The role also supports the Federal fenceline monitoring program, and performs unit monitoring reports as required.

JOB DUTIES:

  • Environmental (Water) technical support including: water effluent data analysis, compilation of water effluent regulatory reports monthly, quarterly, annually, QA&QC responsibility, support effluent sampling work/coordinate related activities with internal and external staff, and assist in sampling activities, if needed.
  • Support regular environmental inspection activities and supports the regulated fence line monitoring program including sampling and data analysis
  • Supports other on-going environmental programs, i.e. waste audit/waste reduction, composting program.
  • Data collection, trending and analysis of environmental metrics for internal and industry reporting.
  • Provides support for other safety or industrial hygiene projects assigned.
  • Assists with EH&S activities during non-routine operations including plant maintenance turnarounds.
  • Assist with maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment, as necessary.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Chemical Engineering program.
  • Advanced computer skills, particularly in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Motivated, self-starter who can work well independently or within a team environment
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task
  • The desire to increase technical knowledge
  • The ability to engage with internal clients in the plant as well as external service suppliers
  • A desire to learn about the petroleum industry and some of the day to day responsibilities of EH&S
  • Interest in the environmental/sustainability field

WORK CONDITIONS:
Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!
About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment.

jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Electrical Engineer Co-Op/Intern

An Electrical Engineer Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned routine electrical engineering-related duties, including projects and management. Our student opportunities allow you to learn from Professional Engineers, offer competitive pay, a relocation package and the opportunity to work with a global leader on exciting projects and much more

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Belle Plaine is a solution mine and refinery located 50 kilometers west of Regina on the Trans-Canada Highway. It is the world’s largest solution mine that is full of talented people and is home to over 500 dedicated employees.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

Full time Co-Op/Internship. 36-40 hours a week on site.

What will you do?

Day to day duties could include:

  • Electrical power system reliability improvement projects.

  • Participation in root cause failure analysis and execution of associated corrective actions.

  • Troubleshooting of electrical power systems related issues that may arise, such as power outages, electrical faults, and equipment failures.

  • Software based electrical power system modelling (including data collection, field verification, and model modifications).

  • Work on electrical power system relay network expansion.

  • Analysis of existing electrical preventative maintenance plans, and development and implementation of new plans.

  • Participation in inspection and maintenance of industrial electrical equipment including medium voltage switchgear, transformers, motor control centres, starters, variable frequency drives, and various digital protective devices and relays.

  • Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, engineers (of various disciplines), journeyman tradespersons both electricians and mechanics.

  • Participation in team meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment.

  • Adhering to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies.

  • Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering.

  • Basic knowledge of electrical theory to include AC distribution and transformation, AC/DC. motor control, power/analog/digital electronics and electromagnetic properties is required.

  • Basic computer skills required, and some computer programming experience preferred.

  • Experience with electrical power system modelling software would be an asset.

  • 72% Percentage or higher.

  • 1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is required

  • Previous internship or co-op experience is preferred

  • Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license - You will need to be able to travel to and from sites and/or office.

  • Basic computer skills are required

  • Experience working in a team environment is a must

  • Familiarity with an industrial environment is highly desirable

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Places
We work with our clients around the world to create, support, and enhance smart, safe and sustainable places where people live, work, learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities, or data and distribution centers. People and communities thrive when the spaces in which they live, work, move and play are designed and managed in a way that best meets their needs.

Role Description

Our Toronto West office (located at 175 Galaxy Blvd.) is searching for an Electrical Engineering PEY to join its growing team for 12-16 months. Arcadis electrical engineers have extensive experience in building electrical systems including power distribution, emergency power, lighting, fire alarm, PA, security, CCTV, data and communications, audio-visual and intelligent systems technology.  Our electrical engineers also complete designs for HV utility substations including power transformers, HV and LV switchgear and P & C systems (Protection and Control).

Job Accountabilities

  • Assist with the preparation of electrical designs and drawings of building facilities electrical systems noted above using computer-aided tools (e.g. EDSA analytical software, AutoCad, MicroStation and REVIT)
  • Develop functional requirements/specifications for the building electrical systems
  • Review electrical diagrams to verify compliance with industry standards and client requirements
  • Prepare designs using the appropriate building codes, electrical codes and CSA Standards
  • Liaise internally with project managers and other discipline personnel to obtain project information, to discuss specific design related problems and complete inter-discipline co-ordination of the building systems
  • Potential site visits to document and verify field conditions and complete field reviews

Qualifications and Experiences

• Currently enrolled in the Electrical Engineering program
• Completed 2-3 years of the program
• Strong communication skills both written and verbal
• Able to work effectively independently and on a team
• Previous work experience is an asset

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

We seek highly motivated hands-on engineering students for an electrical engineering position on the Manufacturing Test Engineering group as part of the “machine that builds the machine”. The group is focused on creating robust, beautiful, data-centric production testing equipment for Tesla’s power electronic components in vehicle, stationary storage, humanoid robot and charging products.

The ideal candidates take pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills, and attention to detail, and appreciate an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  The candidates look forward to learning an incredible amount on the job, are excited to immerse themselves in the role of electrical engineer, and do not shy away from tremendous levels of responsibility.

  • Experience designing schematics for machines, PCBAs, and/or wire harnesses

This role will span a wide range of fields: low-level C code that runs on embedded microprocessors, C/C++ verification and environment automation, using Python to develop tooling and tests to help support our core team. You will be working closely with Firmware, Digital Design, Design Verification, DevOps, and other Embedded Software team members.

jobDescription:
Posterity Group helps governments and utilities understand and reduce energy use and emissions. We provide end-use modeling and consulting services to support demand side management, integrated resource planning, and energy/carbon policy decision-making.

Posterity Group (PG) provides a rewarding and challenging consulting environment. We seek to offer a healthy work environment that is purposeful, motivating and gratifying. Our progressive management policies include a flexible approach to work location and work hours that respects staff time and work/life responsibilities.

We want to hear from talented people with a keen interest or experience in energy efficiency, energy policy, and carbon managements projects to join our team in a full-time Energy Systems Consultant Intern position.  You will work closely with our experienced consultants as a technical resource, and make meaningful contributions to PG’s project work to guide our clients to meet 2030 decarbonization targets. You'll work with colleagues who are experts in their fields and who are keen to collaborate with you.

We prefer candidates with experience (either through academic projects or previous work) conducting research and/or modelling that could:

  • Inform policy decisions in the areas of energy efficiency, distributed energy resources, demand response, and carbon reduction,
  • Support demand side management programs, or
  • Support utility integrated resource planning.

Experience in these areas will be considered assets:

  • Data analysis
  • Energy or scenario modelling
  • Energy or carbon policy
  • Energy efficiency and low-carbon fuels

Job Requirements

To thrive in this role, you should have these skills:

  • Communication: you are a competent writer and can communicate your technical understanding in plain language.
  • Data analysis and visualization: you are comfortable in MS Excel, can analyze data and present results in graphs and tables.
  • Problem-solving: you work hard to solve problems and can develop approaches to respond to open-ended questions.
  • Leadership: you have an open and active curiosity in learning about PG and the industry we serve, and actively seek guidance to improve your performance.
  • Accountability: you take responsibility for your work commitments.

You would also add value to our team if you:

  • Are an advanced user of Excel.
  • Have coding skills (Python, R, etc.)
  • Can speak and write well in French.

Posterity Group is an equal opportunity employer.  We offer a creative work environment, progressive management policies, and rewarding and complex consulting assignments. To help our staff lead balanced and fulfilling work and home lives, we offer a range of benefits including:

  • A flexible approach to work location and work hours that respects staff time and work/life balance
  • Competitive vacation and leave policy, including Fridays off during the summer months

Job Responsibilities

The Energy Systems Consultant Intern will have the following responsibilities, under the guidance of a senior PG staff member:

  • Conduct research and data analysis to inform policy decisions on energy efficiency, innovative technologies, demand response and carbon reduction.
  • Develop inputs and run models to analyze the impact of policies and economic drivers on energy consumption and GHG emissions.
  • Write project reports to summarize findings and provide recommendations to clients.
  • Other tasks depending on experience and interest.

If this position sounds exciting to you, we would love to hear from you. To apply:

  • Write us a 1-page letter showing:
    • How you meet the above criteria, (or if you don’t, why we should consider you anyway)
    • Why you want to work with us, and
    • What kind of projects you would be best suited for based on your interests and previous experience.
  • Attach this to your resume, including employment history and relevant project summary qualifications or courses (2-page limit)

Preferred Disciplines

U of T                 Engineering Science (Energy Systems)

jobDescription:
When it comes to forward-thinking homebuilding and thoughtfully planned communities, Canadians think of Mattamy Homes. And that success is centred on a foundation of great people, because our team is as solid as they come. At Mattamy, we are optimistic, hardworking and supportive. Together we learn and grow as we strive to create a positive impact in the homebuilding industry. Contributing to the Mattamy Way means being surrounded by caring people who encourage you to be exactly who you are. It means your opinion is invited and your contributions count. And it means a career filled with pride, knowing you're part of an environmentally-conscious, action-oriented organization with big plans for the future. The opportunity to bring the future of living to homeowners based on what Canadians value is exciting - and we're making it happen.

Learn more about what makes working at Mattamy special and our award-winning culture.

What we offer
Mattamy Homes is currently seeking dynamic individuals to join our Urban Team for an exciting opportunity to begin their career with an industry leader while completing your degree. This co-op opportunity will expose the student to a broad range of disciplines within the realm of Construction Management and Project Management. The student will work closely with members of our High-Rise Construction and Project Management team who are responsible for the planning, engineering, managing, and construction of fully integrated Urban communities.

What you'll do

  • Work alongside a project management team overseeing all aspects of high-rise and mid-rise planning and construction.
  • Assisting with budgeting and cost tracking at various stages during project duration.
  • Going through and understanding different construction drawings/specifications and being able to translate relevant aspects of these documents to create a scope of work for different trades necessary throughout the project's duration.
  • Understanding and distributing shop drawings to appropriate consultants.
  • Working with the design studio to ensure that upgrades to suites are both submitted on time and are constructible
  • Create comparisons of different bids to ensure that all bidders are including the entirety of the scope in their quotation.
  • Coordinating between all consultants to ensure constructability/practicality and harmonization in regard to their respective drawings and specifications.
  • Gaining practical experience through site visits throughout the term.

What you bring

  • Intermediate/Senior students in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical), Planning, and/or Business Real Estate Programs.
  • Excellent communication skills allowing you to communicate with outside trades/consultants as well as with other members of the Mattamy Urban team.
    Demonstrate analytical ability and problem-solving skills.
  • Motivated self-starter that works well independently and in team environments.
    Well-developed problem solving, decision-making, organization, planning and leadership skills.
  • Ability to establish credibility, trust and build relationships with people at all levels of the organization.
  • Ability and willingness to learn and grow professionally.
  • Ability to travel and relocate as required to various office and site locations.
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project & Outlook.
  • As the position may involve travel to construction sites and consultant offices, a vehicle and a class 'G' license is required.

Bonus points

  • Familiarity with construction practices.
  • We encourage applicants who meet most of the role requirements to hit that submit button and apply! It's okay if you don't have 100% of the requirements. If you're the right candidate, we'll help you learn and grow.

Who we are
Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across Canada and the United States. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

Be yourself. We want it that way.
At Mattamy, we're passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important to the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues, and communities. From how we build our teams to cultivating our leaders, we're on a journey toward a welcoming, barrier-free culture for everyone.

Mattamy Homes Canada is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

jobDescription:
Engineering Co-op Students, Mechanical, Electrical & Civil/Structural - 1076978

Job Description

Ready to build a rewarding career in an industry that is growing?

Who We Are

We are a global mining company dedicated to safely delivering nickel, copper, cobalt, and platinum group metals essential for the world’s energy transition.

Our mission is to improve lives and shape a better future together.

From utensils to cellphones to satellites, our operations simplify daily life and enhance connectivity. Our metals are integral to life-saving medical equipment and the electric vehicles driving the fight against climate change – our work truly matters.

Join our diverse team of 15,000 talented individuals committed to transforming critical minerals into prosperity and sustainable development in countries like Canada, Brazil, Indonesia, the United Kingdom, and Japan. We invite you to use your skills with us and contribute to something meaningful and enduring.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking Engineering Students to join our Engineering and Studies Department in Sudbury, ON .

The opportunities are fixed term co-op positions, 4-12 months in duration, beginning in either January or May of 2025 .

Note: when applying to the posting, please clearly state in your cover letter; the program you are currently enrolled in, year of study, location of preference, availability to start and duration of the term.

As an Engineering Coop student you will be provided with an opportunity that will allow you to gain valuable experience, knowledge and be a part of shaping our mining operations.

Additionally, in this position you will:

  • Follow Vale’s Safety Policies, Programs and Legislative Standards
  • Develop skills and abilities related to the provision of engineering in Ontario
  • Ensure compliance to the applicable laws, standards and guidelines
  • Provide technical support to enable safe and efficient operations in an industrial plant, mine or production laboratory.
  • Complete assigned projects safely and on time. Project work may include engineering document scanning, engineering standard editing, data analysis and reporting

About You

Education:

  • We are looking for students currently enrolled and in good standing in an Engineering University program.
  • Please include transcript(s) in the application.
  • Considering the following engineering disciplines:
  • Electrical
  • Mechanical
  • Civil/Structural

Skills:

  • Demonstrate good written and oral communication skills
  • Strong computer skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 products; Teams, Word, Excel, Outlook.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and work well with others in a team environment
  • Written and oral communication skills
  • Must be obsessed with safety and risk
  • Demonstrate open and transparent dialogue in all aspects of work
  • Maintain high level of professional conduct

What We Offer You

  • Competitive compensation
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion, and career growth
  • Online training and career development opportunities
  • Opportunities to build your network and lots of fun!
  • All Personal Protective Equipment is provided upon hire. Employees are given a safety boot allowance and receive a 100% reimbursement for prescription safety glasses

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in one of Honda’s many specialized departments (Welding, Paint, Assembly, Plastics, Forming, Die Cast, or Machining) and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility. Successful candidates will be assigned to a department following the acceptance of their offer. Don’t worry, we make sure to consider your preferences and where you will best fit!

Not sure what to expect while working as an Engineering Intern at HCM? As an Engineering Intern you will gain A LOT of project management experience – projects of all shapes and sizes, but nonetheless important. You will support our engineering, maintenance, reliability, and quality teams in improvements to our manufacturing process; support installation and construction projects; help identify and implement countermeasures for quality concerns; investigate equipment cycle time problems; as well as gain hands on work experience with Equipment Services and Production. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting engineering and project management activities with team members on small and large capital investment projects
  • Prepare and complete reports and documentation for downtime, root cause analysis, countermeasure activity, project status updates, and follow-up activities.
  • Supporting commissioning and installation/maintenance of new and existing equipment
  • Supporting department activities for ongoing improvements to Safety, Environmental, Quality, Cost and Delivery.
  • Supporting the production/assembly line when required (requirements vary by department)

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and A LOT of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools, power tools, field wiring, machine shop tools, or measurement equipment (e.g. Digital Multimeters, Oscilloscopes, Gauges, etc.)
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Experience in digital systems and programming (for electrical positions)
    • We use PLCs (Programmable Logic Controller) – want to learn more? We will teach you!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Demonstrated experience in or knowledge of automation equipment including hydraulics, pneumatics, robotics, vision systems, PLCs, HMI’s, VFD’s, conveyors, etc.
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates togrow in adiverse and inclusivework environmentwhile driving continuous improvementwith Passion,deliveringJoy andValue to ourCustomers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity:

Are you a student looking for an exciting opportunity that is full of meaningful, diverse, and ambitious assignments working alongside industry leading professionals? Join Canadian Natural where we strive to provide opportunities based on your abilities, helping you to contribute in a meaningful way and apply your academic experience to challenging and rewarding projects!

As a Civil/Structural Engineering Student for the Oil Sands Major Projects group, your focus will be to support the Engineering team with designing and constructing projects for either the Horizon or Albian Oil Sands sites. Take advantage of the opportunity to be a part of one of the world’s largest Oil Sands operations, work closely with seasoned engineers, and become familiar with the world of design and construction. At Canadian Natural, “developing people” and “creating value” are part of our mission statement.

  • Term length: 8 or 12 months
  • Term start: January or May 2025
  • Job location: Calgary, Alberta – Head Office. Please note, depending on business needs, the work location may change. This would require the successful candidate to work at one of our Oil Sands sites north of Fort McMurray, AB – flights and accommodations would be provided.
  • Shift schedule: Calgary: 5 x 2 – 8 hours (Monday to Friday) or Oil Sands: 4 x 3 – 10 hours (Monday to Thursday)
  • Safety sensitive position: Yes

Key Accountabilities:

  • Work with professional Structural/Civil Engineers and apply engineering principles in the design and construction of oil sands facilities
  • Complete design calculations and drawings
  • Create and analyze structural finite element models
  • Create bill of materials to support cost estimates
  • Write technical reports
  • Inspect construction work on site

What You Bring to The Role:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree Program in Civil Engineering or within one year of graduation. Specialization in structural is considered an asset
  • Previous engineering experience, Microsoft application, CAD, structural analysis tools (e.g. S-Frame), and proficiency in technical communication are all assets, but not required
  • Possess a valid Class 5 Alberta driver’s license or equivalent out of province license with a reasonably clean driver abstract

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Paid time off during Christmas week and summer Fridays in July and August (Calgary)
  • Quality camp facilities with multiple amenities available (Oil Sands)
  • Company Sponsored Fly-In/Fly-Out from Calgary or Edmonton, Alberta (Oil Sands)
  • Bus In/Bus Out to & from Fort McMurray (Oil Sands)
  • Students may be eligible for relocation assistance pursuant to Canadian Natural’s Student Relocation Policy. Students will be responsible for finding their own accommodations during the work term
  • Multiple volunteer opportunities within the community
  • Opportunities to partake in initiatives such as the Intern Social Committee

If you are interested in this exciting student work term opportunity, please include your resume, cover letter and unofficial transcripts as part of your online application.

jobDescription:
The Opportunity:

Join our team at one of our Oil Sands operations and dive into the world of Plant Reliability Engineering! As part of our plant operations reliability team, you'll work on critical assets like conveyor belts, pumps, and compressors, conducting failure analysis investigations and refining equipment strategies for long-term safety and performance. This hands-on role offers a chance to deepen your engineering knowledge, tackle design challenges, and contribute to our world-class mining operations.

If you are mechanically inclined, passionate about machinery, and ready to roll up your sleeves, this opportunity is for you! Get ready to grow your skills and make a real impact in a collaborative and innovative environment.

  • Term length: 8, 12 or 16 months
  • Term start: January, May or September 2025
  • Job location: Fort McMurray, AB – Albian Sands or Horizon Mine Operations
  • Shift schedule: 4 x 3 – 10 hours (Monday – Thursday)
  • Safety sensitive position: Yes

Key Accountabilities:

  • Collaborate with Bitumen Production and our Upgrading and Utilities Engineering Team in activities relating to operations, maintenance or construction support
  • Understand process plant operation and equipment
  • Collaborate with project and operations teams to ensure proper alignment with operations needs and requirements
  • Review assets and data to see where we can improve the frequency of maintenance and be able to improve our uptime on equipment
  • Participate in developing cost effective strategies for equipment that is problematic in the field
  • Assist engineers in producing maintenance work packages
  • Gather field measurements & data to assist engineers
  • Focus on safety, cost reduction and reliability
  • Assist engineers by calculating weekly and monthly reliability KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

What You Bring to The Role:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor or Master’s Degree Program in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering preferred. Other disciplines will be considered.
  • Good understanding of pressure vessels, pressure piping & valves
  • Strong work ethic and positive aptitude
  • Strong mechanical aptitude
  • Strong work ethic and positive aptitude
  • A pre-employment drug and alcohol test must successfully be complete

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Quality camp facilities with multiple amenities available
  • Company Sponsored Fly-In/Fly-Out from Calgary or Edmonton, Alberta
  • Multiple volunteer opportunities within the community
  • Students may be eligible for relocation assistance pursuant to Canadian Natural’s Student Relocation Policy. Students will be responsible for finding their own accommodations during the work term.
  • Opportunities to partake in initiatives such as the Intern Social Committee

If you are interested in this exciting student work term opportunity, please include your resume, cover letter (optional) and unofficial transcripts as part of your online application.
