jobDescription:
Who We Are

Smith + Andersen is a trusted, Canadian, multi-disciplinary engineering firm with 10 offices in five provinces and approximately 700 employees.

At Smith + Andersen our employees contribute to some of the most sustainable building design projects in Canada. The work we do has meaningful impact on the community by contributing to landmark projects such as hospitals, transit stations, parks, federal and provincial government buildings and post-secondary institutions.

Our values drive and define everything we do, demonstrating a deep commitment to sustainability, mentorship and quality work that spans nearly six decades in business. In addition, we are proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work® and one of Canada’s Best Workplaces™ for the highly collaborative culture we’ve built and for empowering employees to do great work!

Why Join Us?

Smith + Andersen is a leading engineering firm not only in Ontario, but across Canada. Established in 1965, Toronto was Smith + Andersen’s first office. In and around the Greater Toronto Area, our teams have worked on a wide range of projects that have quite literally shaped city skylines. The expertise and innovation of our office is evident in the work we deliver, which includes everything from geothermal solutions and radiant heating and cooling, to district energy. We take as much pride in our work on a tenant fit-up or building assessment as we do contributing to the city’s tallest towers. For us, work is about connecting, collaborating, and finding creative solutions to problems.

At Smith + Andersen, we are committed to empowering the next generation of engineers by offering practical work experiences that include designing new buildings or renovating existing buildings that shape our cities, and bridge the gap between academic knowledge and real-world application. If you have a passion for mechanical engineering and are eager to expand your skill set, this is opportunity for you. Join us and be part of team that values your contributions and invests in you!

What You’ll Gain:

  • Hands-on Experience: Work on real projects that make an impact.
  • Mentorship: Be guided by industry leaders who are eager to share their knowledge with you and help you build your career.
  • Skill Development: Enhance your technical skills and soft skills in a supportive, nurturing environment.
  • Career Growth: Our firm values training and skills development for promoting growth. Many of our full-time employees (including nearly a quarter of our leaders across the country) began their careers with us as co-op students at Smith + Andersen.
  • Contribute to sustainable building design and make a difference by helping Canada meet its 2025 targets for green-house gas emissions reductions.
  • Consulting Experience: Gain hands-on experience within an engineering consulting firm and learn about the ins and outs of the industry.

In addition to a co-op experience with meaningful work, we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible hours and half-day Fridays (all year round)
  • Transit Subsidy Program
  • Hands-on training with industry specific software such as AutoCAD and Revit.
  • Wide variety of community and social events including sports outings, potlucks, games nights, community clean up days, and much more! We also have a several recreational leagues including hockey and soccer.

Portfolio

Here are just a few examples of the wide range of projects we have worked on in the Toronto office.

Post secondary institutions:

  • University of Toronto Myhal Centre , University of Toronto Academic Wood Tower , University of Toronto Robarts Library
  • University of Waterloo Engineering 5 , University of Waterloo Engineering 7 Building
  • Queen's University Mitchell Hall
  • University of Guelph W.F. Mitchell Athletics Centre Renewal , University of Guelph Ontario Veterinary College Hill's Pet Nutrition Primary Healthcare Centre

Healthcare:

  • Bridgepoint Health
  • Humber River Hospital
  • CAMH Redevelopment

Sports + Recreation:

  • Aaniin Community Centre
  • Orillia Recreation Centre
  • Pan Am Sports Centre

Retail:

  • Eataly
  • Restoration Hardware

Commercial:

  • Googles new Toronto Office
  • EY Tower
  • TD Terrace

For more information about Smith + Andersen and our co-operative program, please visit our website: S+A Co-op Program.

What You’ll Do:

The Junior Designer is often a member of several project teams working under the guidance of experienced designers and project managers to assist in all aspects of the mechanical system design. The Junior Designer will gain relevant work experience towards their professional engineering license including; the design of heating, ventilation and air conditioning, fire protection and plumbing systems.

The successful candidate will gain experience designing building systems using 2D or 3D drafting software to create construction drawings and contract documents. Other activities include:

  • Calculating building HVAC and plumbing loads to size ductwork, gas, HVAC piping, plumbing and drainage piping and other related equipment.
  • Assist with construction administration tasks including construction site reviews, shop drawing reviews, design revisions and coordination with contractor.
  • Hands-on experience with building codes, industry standards, handbooks and regulations under the supervision of Professional Engineers and/Engineer-in-training.

Click HERE to watch a video on the typical day-in-the-life of a Co-op at Smith + Andersen.

Who You Are:

  • Ideally, completed 3rd year Mechanical Engineering with an interest in thermodynamics, fluids mechanics, heat and mass transfer and project management with a focus on energy and environment.
  • As a minimum, have standard computer and software knowledge (i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, etc.). Specific engineering software will be learned on the job, however experience with AutoCAD or Revit is an asset.
  • Previous co-op experience in a related industry is an asset.

Please note all applicants are required to submit an academic transcript.

Office Location

100 Sheppard Ave. East in Toronto, Ontario, is conveniently situated within walking distance to public transit, fitness facilities, restaurants, and retail amenities. The office building offers various amenities, including a tenant lounge, car and bicycle parking, and on-site electric vehicle charging.

Accommodation

Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Smith + Andersen’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended.

Diversity

Smith + Andersen is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, race, ethnicity, family status, religion, mental or physical status or veteran status.

jobDescription:
About Us:
Quantim Intelligence is a specialized Analytics and Management Consulting firm focused on helping commodities companies commercially optimize their assets (both physical and non-physical) using a deep understanding of physical markets, advanced analytics and quantamental models (combination of quantitative finance and market fundamentals modeling). We specialize in leveraging skillsets drawn from the world of commodities trading to both high-grade existing trading capabilities as well as extend those same capabilities to other parts of the value chain (producer, processor and marketer). We are currently focused on expanding our business in Oil & Gas, Power and Agriculture.

What You'll be Doing:
You will spend your time helping our customers make better commercial decisions using advanced analytics tools such as Python, R, SQL and Javascript. You will use these tools to help build market supply and demand models, integrating both free and paid alternative data sources as well as run stochastic simulations and option valuation models. You may also help Qi build out a software suite that helps our customers do the same in an automated fashion. You spend a part of your day, every day, reading market research and specialized price reporting agency reports across the global energy supply chain to develop an intuition on how such news impacts the commodities markets and its implications to our customer's commercial decisions.

Why Work with Us?
We are nerds who love learning every day. Whether it's reading the latest in market fundamentals research, learning about new products and markets, learning new technologies or trying to apply cutting edge research to everyday business problems, we will support you in your learning journey. If you come to work with Quantim Intelligence, you will learn directly from industry experts with decades of experience in analytics, trading, risk, finance, and the energy markets. You will gain hands-on experience using advanced analytics to help customers solve their most consequential problems, especially around the energy transition.
We are not a PowerPoint company. Our outputs are advanced mathematical models and strategic guidance on how to apply them. We want to apply your numerical modeling skills to actual business problems. As a member of the Qi team, you will tackle the most challenging commercial analytics problems facing the industry. No two projects will be same; you could be working on projects ranging from modelling market dynamics in the energy and commodities space to using advanced data science to providing commercial risk/reward valuation on a complex asset or deal structure using real option theory and quant models.

What you will need to succeed:

  • Have completed 3rd year Engineering Science in either the Energy Systems or Math, Stats & Finance specializations, by the start of the Co-op placement.
  • Passion and DRIVE for learning new skills, markets, models, and software.
  • Willingness to be relentlessly useful in helping our clients to growth and expand their commercial capabilities.
  • Ability to both think strategically around commercial opportunities but also get your hands dirty building models, coding them, and deploying them

jobDescription:
Memme Infrastructure Contractors is the name behind many of Southern Ontario’s most advanced and prestigious underground infrastructure projects. Memme was founded in 1967 as a small family company and has since expanded to be one of the leading underground infrastructure contractors in Ontario, that includes a staff of over 85 employees. Over its 55 years, Memme has excelled in tackling some of the most challenging and intricate underground servicing and road reconstruction projects in the province. Memme specializes in the reconstruction of storm sewer, sanitary sewer, watermain, and roads across various municipalities, as well as new underground servicing for private and commercial developments.

Due to our continued growth and expansion, Memme is currently looking to add an Junior Site Superintendent to our team. In this role, you will be reporting directly to our operations manager and will be responsible for overseeing multiple project sites across the GTA. You will be required to manage all on site activity including scheduling, material procurement, quantity takeoffs, and safety compliance.

Memme’s objective is to hire new talent that is open to learning and growing within their role and the company. Our long-term goal is to support young professionals in their career and provide opportunities to develop into management positions within the organization. Working at Memme will provide the opportunity to work alongside individuals with over 35 years of experience and have a wealth of knowledge in the underground infrastructure industry.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Crew and equipment scheduling
  • Liaison between site staff and project manager
  • Perform accurate quantity takeoffs
  • Procure site materials
  • Maintain and update site records
  • Manage and coordinate with subcontractors
  • Analyze project drawings, documents, specifications
  • Ensure compliance with all safety requirements
  • Maintain professional conduct and a good working relationship at all times with owners, consultants, trades, suppliers, and public agencies.

jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About The Role
As a Kernel Engineer on our team, you will work with leaders from industry and academia at the intersection of hardware and software to develop state-of-the-art solutions for emerging problems in AI and HPC.

Our team of developers is responsible for the design, implementation, validation, and performance tuning of deep learning operations on highly parallel custom processors. We are developing a library of parallel and distributed algorithms to maximize hardware utilization and accelerate the training of deep neural networks to unprecedented speeds.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop design specifications for new machine learning and linear algebra kernels and mapping to the Cerebras WSE System using various parallel programming algorithms
  • Develop and debug kernel library of highly optimized low level assembly instruction and C-like domain specific language routines to implement algorithms targeting the Cerebras hardware system
  • Using mathematical models and analysis to measure the software performance and inform design decisions
  • Develop and integrate unit and system testing methodologies to verify correct functionality and performance of kernel libraries
  • Study emerging trends in Machine Learning applications and help evolve Kernel library architecture to address computational challenges of the start-of-the-art Neural Networks
  • Interact with chip and system architects to optimize instruction sets, microarchitecture, and IO of next generation systems

Requirements:

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related discipline
  • Understanding of hardware architecture concepts — must be comfortable learning the details of a new hardware architecture
  • Skilled in C++ and Python programming languages
  • Good knowledge of library and/or API development best practices
  • Strong debugging skills and knowledge of debugging complex software stack

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience in kernel development and/or testing
  • Familiarity with parallel algorithms and distributed memory systems
  • Experience in programming accelerators such as GPUs and FPGAs
  • Familiarity with Machine Learning neural networks and frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  • Familiarity with HPC kernels and their optimization

Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About the Role:

As a Runtime Engineer, you will directly impact the performance at which deep learning models are trained on our “distributed systems” hardware and be responsible for enabling next-generation AI applications that require substantial computational capabilities. In this position, you will develop algorithms for execution, acceleration, partitioning, and routing of communication for dataflow graphs on a massively parallel, multi-core architecture.

Responsibilities:

  • Be able to understand the flow of data in a distributed system and how to characterize performance pain points
  • Develop algorithms for allocation of compute, communication, and memory resources
  • Measure, analyze, and improve execution of Runtime software (that is responsible for training large models with massive datasets)
  • Integrate successful optimizations into production software stack
  • Implement mathematical models in C++ or Python using discrete optimization techniques and standard libraries and packages

Requirements:

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related disciplines
  • Strong proficiency in C/C++
  • Familiarity with Python or other scripting language
  • The ability to operate at multiple levels of abstraction in the software stack


Preferred Requirements:

  • Knowledge about distributed systems, memory subsystem of modern computers, and networking solutions

jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Belle Plaine is a solution mine and refinery located 50 kilometers west of Regina on the Trans-Canada Highway. It is the world’s largest solution mine that is full of talented people and is home to over 500 dedicated employees.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

Maintenance Engineer Co-Op/Intern

A Maintenance Engineer Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned to special projects and will assist other engineers on major projects.  Projects will focus on improving equipment performance, and engineering support for maintenance personnel.

What will you do?

Day to day work assignments could include:

  • Technical drawing reviews, field tours with maintenance/operations personnel, and technical support during mechanical failures

  • Specific project assignments will be made by the supervisor; assignments could include:

  • Defining clear project scope and requests for capital work

  • Leading and implementing safety improvement projects

  • Technical drawing updates

  • Completing engineering requests from the operations and maintenance teams

  • Design/size/validate new or modification of existing equipment and piping

  • Provide technical support for equipment inspections

  • Obtain equipment specifications through drawings, manuals, and other relevant searches

  • Assist in completing management of change process for projects

  • Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, plant operators, engineers (of various disciplines), tradespersons, and contractors

  • Participate in department meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment

  • Adhere to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies

​ What do you need for this role?

  • Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Industrial Systems, Chemical or Electrical Engineering

  • Ability to function in an industrial chemical and mining environment

  • 1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is an asset

  • Reliable transportation to travel to and from site

  • Ability to work full time

  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and implement learned process, procedures or software

  • Strong verbal, written and listening communication skills, including presentation skills

  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with others

  • Ability to effectively work with employees at all levels within the organization and external customers, suppliers and vendors

  • Ability to maintain a clean work environment and comply with all safety and environmental policies

  • Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

  • Organizational skills and attention to detail

  • Selected candidates will be required to successfully complete the following: Post-offer/pre-placement drug and alcohol screening, background check, physical, functional capacity examination.

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Must be able to safely perform the essential functions of the job without posing a direct threat to the safety of his or her own self, or the safety of others.

  • Able to lift approximately 0-25 lbs. occasionally.

  • Able to climb stairs and work at various heights.

  • Able to distinguish varying or specific colors, patterns or materials.

  • Able to hear, with or without correction.

  • Able to read, write and understand basic English.

  • Able to see, with or without correction.

  • Able to use fine hand motor skills.

  • Able to wear a respirator.

  • Able to work rotating shifts and overtime as required.

  • Must be able to work a 12-hour shift.

  • Must be authorized to work in Canada.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. The successful candidate will be working with many different departments at Honda in conjunction with the IT department to ensure we are all working towards the same goal. In addition, there will be opportunity to connect with peers from other Honda sites around North America to understand and foster work relationships that will assist in building technology and implementation standards for IT engineering. The Manufacturing Applications Intern will focus on data Manufacturing Systems development and configurations.

Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code, ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
  • Test case & test management suite development & maintenance
  • Configuration management including investigation into alternative configurations in relation to business requirements
  • Communicates with technical, non-technical, and business staff
  • Adhere to, and comply with, established HCM standards

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term. (Currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree.)
  • Currently enrolled in an Information Technology related degree (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, etc.)
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and A LOT of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience designing, building, or deploying softwares
  • Database architecture and device experience (IBM DB2, Postgres )
  • Awareness of agile development methodologies and CICD patterns and tools
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates togrow in adiverse and inclusivework environmentwhile driving continuous improvementwith Passion,deliveringJoy andValue to ourCustomers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
Determined. Imaginative. Curious. If these are some of the ways you describe yourself — we want to learn more about you! At TC Energy, we are Energy Problem Solvers — passionate about transitioning North America to cleaner energy while meeting the energy demands of today and tomorrow. If that sounds like a challenge you want to help tackle, we want you to join our team!

Posting Close Date: December 31, 2024

The Opportunity

TC Energy is looking to add an #EnergyProblemSolver in various locations to support our efforts in Energy Problem Solving and our daily operations.

We are seeking students interested in gaining technical engineering or project engineering work experience and that are enrolled in Bachelor of Science with an Engineering focus, Bachelor of Engineering or related field.

We engage our Engineering students in the very core of our operations. As a valued member of the team, you’ll do exciting, challenging work, solve real engineering problems, and make a meaningful impact. You’ll learn about the business and build your professional network by working closely with other skilled people at TC Energy. Every day will enhance your knowledge, skills and passion for what you do.

Term lengths vary by 4-, 8- ,12- and 16 -month opportunities.


Roles are based in Calgary and various field locations across Canada, and responsibilities will depend on your team and work location.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Actively enrolled in an engineering degree program (Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical, Civil, Software Computer, or Energy Engineering), or equivalent, with at least one semester of education complete

  • Enrollment at an accredited university, and returning to school for at least one semester following your work term

  • Exhibit a safety mindset, in a professional and personal setting

  • Must exhibit the TC Energy corporate values and incorporate them into work activities and initiatives: safety, responsibility, integrity, innovation and collaboration

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong interpersonal and communicative skills to work efficiently in a collaborative team environment

  • Committed to building and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders

  • Ability to accurately analyze information and deal with ambiguity

  • Experience working in a dynamic and challenging environment, and adaptable to changing priorities

  • Ability to multi-task effectively, with strong organizational and time management skills

  • Reflective and committed to continuous improvement and personal development

To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico. #LI-Hybrid

Please apply with a Resume, Cover Letter and Transcript.

About our business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have three complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines, liquids (oil) pipelines, and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at www.TCEnergy.com/students and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.

* Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
* All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
* TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com .

jobDescription:
Job Title: Mechanical Design Engineering & Project Management Rotation Internship

The Role (What to Expect):

We seek highly motivated hands-on engineering students for a rotation position on the Manufacturing Test Engineering group as part of the “machine that builds the machine”. You will spend one half of your internship in the role of mechanical design engineering, and the next half in the role of technical project management. The group is focused on creating robust, beautiful, data-centric production testing equipment for Tesla’s power electronic components in vehicle, stationary storage, humanoid robot and charging products.

The ideal candidates take pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills, and attention to detail, and appreciate an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  The candidates look forward to learning an incredible amount on the job, excited to try themselves in the role of engineer and a technical project manager, and do not shy away from tremendous levels of responsibility.

Responsibilities (What’ll You’ll Do): (Note: This is 16 months in length and broken into 2 parts)

Mechanical Design Engineering role (8mo):

  • Produce detailed-level CAD models, pneumatic diagrams, create engineering drawings using GD&T practices
  • Verify designs using structural and thermal FEA and CFD, tolerance stack-up analysis
  • Propose innovative solutions for equipment design on part and assembly level
  • Support building, debugging, validation and equipment duplication efforts, and fine-tune equipment for release to production
  • Conduct detailed testing and validation of installed machinery to ensure robustness and quality
  • Perform on-site and off-site acceptance testing (SAT/FAT) of test equipment

Technical Project Management role (8mo):

  • Create schedule (Microsoft Project) to design and deploy test equipment
  • Track project progress and report effectively on status, blockers, and changes to plan of record with effective communication channels to all stakeholders
  • Track resourcing of projects and drive resource balancing between different program priorities
  • Identify creative and timely solutions to key program challenges
  • Drive action with internal and cross functional teams to successfully complete projects within time, budget, and resource constraints
  • Complete appropriate documentation and ensure accuracy of data across Tesla systems (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft SharePoint, Polarion, SolidWorks PDM)

Requirements (What You’ll Bring):

  • Majoring in Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Science, Mechatronics
  • Hands-on skills with tools, instruments, and measurement techniques
  • Versed in SolidWorks, or similar 3D CAD software
  • Familiarity with various part fabrication techniques (machining, welding, sheet metal fabrication, laser cutting, 3D printing)
  • Preference for candidates with a portfolio showcasing various professional and personal projects (FSAE, BAJA, robotic competitions, and similar)
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Previous engineering or project management internship experience is a plus

jobDescription:
Want to DESIGN?  Looking for a dynamic term with an innovative approach?

Evertz has been recognized as one of the 50 best managed and top100 fastest growing high-tech companies in Canada.   Located within an hour of the Waterloo area (Burlington), we are a worldwide leader in the design and manufacture of leading edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry.

As a leader and innovator in HDTV and IPTV, Evertz has been known for high caliber products without compromise, with features second to none in the industry.  Our innovative approach combines our in house state of the art manufacturing facility and short design cycle time to realize exceptional products sold to our worldwide client base including CBC, ABC, NBC, CBS, HBO, and the BBC.   We are currently seeking a MECHANICAL DESIGN (CO-OP) to join our Research & Development team.

Scope:

As part of a project driven unit, you will be challenged with the design, prototype and test of precision mechanical devices for film transport and high frequency digital and analog electronic sub assembly enclosures. You will also be responsible for the carry through of the designs to production.  Participate in a wide range of engineering projects and principles including Mechanical Design Process, Mechanical Drafting using Solidworks, thermal Solutions for Electronics, Machining of metal, sheetmetal work, Properties of Materials, some electrical/computer engineering exposure.

Responsibilities:

  • Research, plan and design electro-mechanical enclosures using a 3D Parametric Solid Modeling CAD packages such as Solid Edge
  • Interact and communicate with engineers to gather all necessary information to develop a final design
  • Design fixtures, test jigs, tool and gauges as required, manage, control and document design changes
  • Coordinate prototype and production sample builds
  • Assist production personnel to interpret drawings and solve manufacturing problems

Qualifications:
• Be results-oriented, self motivated and a team player
• Ideal for an intermediate or senior level student
• Skilled in the use of 3D software as Solid Edge and AutoCAD,
• Familiar with sheet metal products, machined parts extrusions, welding and wiring techniques and BOM generation,
• Experience in Electro-Mechanical packaging techniques (mounting of printed circuit boards, cabling, connectors, switches, etc) would be an asset.

jobDescription:
New School Foods is a startup producing vegan seafood. We are looking for a creative thinker who loves to work with their hands to build novel devices and who thrives in a machine shop environment. The Prototype Designer/Developer will design and fabricate bench scale prototypes to test various processing mechanisms. This role is instrumental to the development of our unique plant-based fish manufacturing process and will help transition our production from lab scale to commercial scale.

The successful candidate will spend time liaising with food scientists/production techs to understand their infrastructure needs for running tests. The successful candidate will also undertake experiments and documentation relating to the experiments.

Preference will be given to candidates that apply with a portfolio of their mechanical design work. Concatenating a portfolio to the end of your resume is preferred but not strictly required.

  • Create 2D and 3D CAD models of prototype designs from hand drawings
  • Construct prototypes using various fabrication equipment
  • Design, perform, and assist in experimentation
  • Coordinate with the CEO, Process Engineer, and Research Scientists to ensure that design criteria are met
  • Source materials and tools required for prototyping
  • Complete tasks accurately and in a timely manner without supervision

Skills:

  • Hands-on practical experience building prototypes
  • Highly experienced working with 3D CAD software (e.g. SolidWorks, Inventor)
  • Ability to properly and safely use 3D printers, laser cutters, lathes, CNC mills, and other equipment commonly found in a machine shop
  • Strong knowledge of manufacturing/fabrication techniques
  • Nice to haves:
    • Understanding of biochemistry and/or food processing
    • Strong knowledge of fluid systems and CFD
    • Strong knowledge of thermodynamics

Interviews will begin before application deadline. There is no guarantee the job won't be filled by the application deadline so students are encouraged to apply as soon as they can.


Important Note: Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women, gender nonconforming, and racialized people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At New School Foods, we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the person we're looking for!

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Places
We work with our clients around the world to create, support, and enhance smart, safe and sustainable places where people live, work, learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities, or data and distribution centers. People and communities thrive when the spaces in which they live, work, move and play are designed and managed in a way that best meets their needs.

Job Accountabilities

  • Assist with the preparation of mechanical designs and drawings of building facilities mechanical systems noted above using computer-aided tools (e.g. HAP analytical software for analysis of heating and cooling loads, AutoCad, MicroStation and REVIT)
  • Develop functional requirements/specifications for the building mechanical systems
  • Review mechanical diagrams to verify compliance with industry standards and client requirements
  • Prepare designs using the appropriate building codes, ASHRAE, NFPA and CSA Standards
  • Liaise internally with project managers and other discipline personnel to obtain project information, to discuss specific design related problems and complete inter-discipline co-ordination of the building systems
  • Potential site visits to document and verify field conditions and complete field reviews

Qualifications and Experiences

• Currently enrolled in the Mechanical Engineering program
• Completed 2-3 years of the program
• Strong communication skills both written and verbal
• Able to work effectively independently and on a team
• Previous work experience is an asset

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.

You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Esterhazy is an underground potash mine located 90 kilometers south of Yorkton. It’s split between three mine sites - K1, K2 and K3 which will be the largest, and one of the world’s most competitive underground potash mines in the world.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

Mechanical Integrity Engineer Co-Op/Intern

An MI Engineering Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned to projects focused on improving plant stationary assets and assessing and documenting condition of existing assets.

What will you do?

Day to day work assignments could include:

  • Investigating failures to determine root causes and developing corrective actions

  • Inspecting condition of structures as well as bins, piping and tanks. Inspections could lead into design assessment using computer modeling or hand calculations.

  • Specific project assignments will be made by the supervisor; assignments could include:

    • Troubleshooting-Using problem-solving techniques such as RCA’s, 8-step and/or 5 Why

    • Evaluating equipment comparative to design or similar processes

    • Design/size/validate new or modification of existing equipment

    • Utilize root cause analysis to review significant failures, identify corrective action to prevent re-occurrence and refine asset strategy to sustain improvement

    • Identify deficiencies in maintenance processes and develop sustainable improvements

    • Mine data to identify historic design methods and drawings to assist with ongoing asset integrity decisions

  • Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, plant operators, engineers (of various disciplines), tradespersons, and contractors

  • Participation in department meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment

  • Adhering to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies

What do you need for this role?

  • Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Civil, or Industrial Systems Engineering

  • 72% Percentage or higher

  • Ability to function in an industrial  mining environment

  • 1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is preferred

  • Previous internship or co-op experience is preferred

  • Reliable transportation - You will need to be able to travel to and from sites.

  • Ability to work full time

  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and implement learned process, procedures or software

  • Strong verbal, written and listening communication skills, including presentation skills

  • Ability to effectively work with employees at all levels within the organization and external customers, suppliers and vendors

  • Ability to maintain a clean work environment and comply with all safety and environmental policies

  • Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

  • Miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

  • Selected candidates will be required to successfully complete the following: Post-offer/pre-placement drug and alcohol screening, background check, physical, functional capacity examination.

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Must be able to safely perform the essential functions of the job without posing a direct threat to the safety of his or her own self, or the safety of others.

jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.

Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About The Role:
As a Machine Developer - Software Automation & Developer Infrastructure Engineer, you will use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote proper engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, testability, scalability, and other advanced quality concepts. The position will play a huge role in the quality of Cerebras software. We are looking for engineers that have a broad set of technical skills and who are ready to tackle the biggest at-scale problems in HW-based deep learning accelerators.

Responsibilities:

  • Write scripts to automate testing and create tools to allow easy development of software regression tests
  • Help identify weak spots and potential customer pain points and drive the software organization towards customer focused quality metrics
  • Implement creative ways to break software and identify potential problems
  • Contribute to developing requirements specifications with a focus on developing verification tests

Requirements:

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related discipline
  • Experience in developing automated tests for compute/machine learning or networking systems within a large-scale enterprise environment
  • Ability to take responsibility for monitoring product development and usage at all levels with an end goal toward improving product quality
  • Strong knowledge of software system design, C++ and Python

Preferred requirements:

  • Strong software testing experience with a proven track record in scaling highly technical teams
  • Knowledge of UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
  • Knowledge of neural network architecture and ML/AI deep learning principles
  • Prior experience in designing and developing test automation for HW systems involving ASICs or FPGAs
  • Prior experience working with live hardware systems and debug tools operating in a real time environment such as networking devices or live computing systems

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an opportunity as a New Model Quality Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2025. The successful candidate will become a team member in HCM’s Purchasing New Model (PN) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

The Purchasing New Model (PN) department is responsible for both supplied parts quality, and final vehicle quality during the development of our New Model vehicles from design development input, to supplier process development, and preparation for Mass Production launch. PN supports in responding to New Model concerns from the manufacturing departments regarding quality issues, contains part quality concerns from installation onto the vehicle, develops temporary/permanent countermeasures, and assesses/audits countermeasure effectiveness throughout New Model development.  PN ensures that suppliers are prepared and able to provide a quality product on a consistent basis at the required quantity to meet out production requirements for the life cycle of our vehicles.

Not sure what to expect while working as a New Model Quality Intern at HCM? You will be responsible for performing part inspections during event receiving inspection, as well as mechanical and functional verification of parts and design, ensuring parts meet both the drawing and HCM’s quality standards. You will effectively develop and lead cross-functional process improvements within the department, investigate the root causes of failures, and implement improvements within your assigned suppliers to prevent reoccurrence at future New Model events and future Mass Production. You will also collect and review supplier New Model documentation including PFMEA’s, Control plans, Product Validation (PV) Testing plans and PV Testing reports to ensure suppliers meet all Honda’s drawing and quality requirements. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP) . What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • New Model Part Development
  • Support New Model Problem Solving involving HCM, Design, and our supply base
  • Global Direct Pass (GDP) and Rejections Per Unit (RPU) follow up and investigation
  • Purchasing Completed Body Unit (CBU) investigations, countermeasure implementation, and repairs
  • Managing New Model Supplier relationships using NARS (North American Reporting System)
  • Part or CBU Outflow Prevention support including initial containment, yard / in- house expanded checks, inspection and/or repair support
  • Support trials at suppliers or HCM for New Model Tooling, Equipment and Manufacturing Process maturation
  • Support New Model launch activities at Suppliers or in the Factory
  • Communicating quality issues and related PN/Supplier activities internally and externally
  • Support Mass Production (MP) 2nd shift line calls and problem investigation

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates). You are required to provide lineside support, repair activities, checking of finished vehicles and similar functions as required.
  • Must be willing to travel domestically (sometimes internationally)
    • That’s right! You may travel to our Canadian suppliers or even our friends over the border. Valid Canadian Passport or B1 Visa is required for international travel)
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this.
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC)! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application

jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

As an Operational Excellence Engineering Student, and part of the Plant Operations Team, you will work closely with a senior engineer and interface with various departments such as Engineering, Maintenance, Business Optimization and EH&S. As an Op Ex Engineering Co-op, you will:

  • Have a unique opportunity, onsite, at the Mississauga Lubricants Plant, to provide analytical and advanced technical support the Operation Leadership Teams and their staff.
  • Prepare, validate and communicate monthly KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) for Operations and Training and Performance Department metrics / scorecards to drive performance improvement and effectiveness.
  • Monitor weekly / monthly Operations & Process Safety performance to identify and analyze emerging issues identifies improvement opportunities
  • Identify technical and financial status by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts.
  • Improve operational, technical, safety and financial status by analyzing results; monitoring variances; identifying trends; recommending actions to management.
  • Increase efficiency and drive process improvements by implementing and developing automated reporting and forecasting advanced tools.
  • Complete additional assignments of more complex projects with emphasis on development and implementation of solutions to effectively reduce risk.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Chemical Engineering discipline. Other disciplines will be considered based on experience or applicable courses.
  • Strong teamwork/interpersonal skills with ability to communicate ideas effectively
  • Motivated self-starter who can work well independently
  • Manage competing priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Familiar with process engineering principles and have process aptitude
  • Knowledge of Microsoft products such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

WORK CONDITIONS:

Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of engineering assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!

About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment.

jobDescription:
Operational Excellence

Student Placement

Arla Foods, Canada

Do you have a passion for Continuous Improvement? This is your chance! Join the Operations Excellence Team in our Continuous Improvement Student Placement! This exciting role will be the perfect opportunity for you to be part of an exciting team and a dynamic, world-class Consumer Packaged Goods and Dairy Manufacturing company.

Working in our Continuous Improvement team, you will support the manufacturing and processing of specialty cheese products by tracking, analyzing and correcting  technical issues through continuous improvement (CI) work, assisting in troubleshooting and coaching and enabling Operators to meet and exceed daily production, packaging, quality, warehousing and safety objectives.

About the role

Reporting to the Lean & Excellence Team, you will:

  • Collect data on KPIs of production and packaging lines as well as present corresponding action plans to achieve targets
  • Proactively look for CI related opportunities carry out work to optimize work on the lines and ensure maximum uptime
  • Inform and interact with all line staff, to keep supervisors up to date on CI related activities
  • Champion the Lean philosophy and support the development of the Lean culture within the departments to drive Continuous Improvement
  • Perform a broad range of work duties that include assisting with troubleshooting, and basic operator asset care
  • Work closely with the other members of the Line Centric Organization (LCO) Continuous Improvement team and openly share knowledge and ideas on an ongoing basis
  • Support major optimization work and efforts on lines
  • Hold and chair weekly meetings relating to key KPIs as reported in the OEE system, while acting in accordance with the PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act) process and carry out relevant processing confirmations
  • Review and check SOPs to ensure they are in place and being utilized
  • Train core team and Operators according to required standards and on CI related processes
  • Coach the line and operational team to ensure that performance meets the required standards with a focus on planned downtime and speed
  • Assist in ensuring results of downtime and technical stops are tracked continuously and transparently
  • Optimize existing processes by running regular Kaizen workshops, SMED analysis and process confirmations
  • Lead and participate in relevant A3 and Root Cause Analysis activities
  • Support LEAN implementation and actively engage in Lean activities within departments, including leading board meetings, assisting in Lean improvements events

Who are you?

You are outgoing, curious, openminded, self-motivated, proactive and independent problem solver who can effectively communicate and interpret a wide variety of information to key stakeholders. With your Engineering education and mindset, you will have a keen eye for continuous improvement, supporting our Lean programs by engaging in and helping to lead Continuous Improvement activities.

What do we offer?

We offer a opportunity to develop yourself in data analytics, creative thinking and trouble shooting, contractor management, people interactions such as mentoring, training follow ups and to gain experience in managing multilaterally within the organization.

In pursuing this exciting opportunity, the selected individuals will be awarded with a competitive compensation package.

At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create the future of dairy. We push each other to keep our cooperative at the forefront of the dairy industry, so we can create Good Growth and bring health and inspiration to the world, naturally.

We do so much more than make some of the world’s favorite dairy products. We give babies the best start in life, make the family dinner unforgettable and mornings worth getting up for.  Every single one of us plays an important role and together we build and help establish our position as one of the largest dairy companies in the world.

Application and contact

Interested and qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume.  Arla foods is committed to providing equal opportunities for all applicants and employees regardless of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences (for which a pardon has been granted), disability, marital or family status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us at the email address above to provide your contact information. While we appreciate all resume submissions, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity to work as an Operational Technology Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in HCM’s Operational Technology department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility. During Operational Technology (OT) internship you will be implementing and maintaining various systems and tools that support the production departments as they work towards improving delivery and lowering operating cost. Operating technologies include but are not limited to MES, ECM, CMMS (Maximo), IIoT networks, IIoT security, Data Management and Analytics.

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps! Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting Operational Technology activity in the process automation, mechatronics, and smart factory disciplines including: assignments / projects of varying degrees of complexity, working with team members on capital investment projects, equipment system integration and value stream mapping to support the introduction of New Models and improving current equipment conditions
  • Supporting commissioning and installation / improving integration of equipment / delivery analysis / system integrations / data governance
  • Supporting department activities for ongoing improvements in the areas Safety, Environmental, Quality, Cost and Delivery
  • Ideal candidate is enrolled in Automation, Mechatronics or similar Electrical, Electronics Engineering programs or relevant automation exposure.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Ideal candidate is enrolled in Automation, Mechatronics or similar Electrical, Electronics Engineering programs or relevant automation exposure.
  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.
  • Experience in digital systems and programming (for electrical positions)
    • We use PLCs (Programmable Logic Controller) – want to learn more? We will teach you!
  • Demonstrate knowledge of Industrial Control System (ICS) networking (MELSEC-NET, CC-IE, Controller Link) via experience or school projects
  • Knowledge of Industrial Cyber Security principles (Fire Walls, IP addressing management)
  • Graphical designs for visual management (e.g., Microsoft Visio)
  • Data extraction using structure queries language (SQL) and visualization of data.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.
