jobDescription:
Operations Analyst CO-OP (Starting May 2025 – 12 to 16 months)

If you are interested in an advanced technology company that provides world class technology for clean air, you may find this position of interest. Safety Power is a provider of environmental control equipment for large scale diesel and natural gas engines used for emergency generators in data centers, banks, hospitals, universities, colleges, government facilities and life safety systems for large office buildings. We are a cleantech company that provides equipment that dramatically reduces air emissions. We are a Canadian company that designs and develops our own environmental systems in our Mississauga office. Our customers include well known names such as Harvard University, Microsoft, Google and Amazon. We are looking for someone who is excited about being a part of a dynamic, and rapidly growing team.

Responsibilities

You will work under the direction of an engineer in the following areas:

(1)  Analyze and monitor supply chain performance.

(2)  Assist in calculating manufacturing capacity and maintaining forecasting models.(3)  Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs).

(4)  Support process improvement initiatives.

(5)  Assist in data collection and trend analysis.

You will work on interesting projects which will require the ability to work independently. This job offers the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of a complex project and to see the result of your work in the finished product.

Qualifications

  • Third year engineering student.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently on complex problems.
  • Highly proficient in compiling and analyzing complex data, including building reports.
  • Time management/organization skills.

We offer a dynamic opportunity with a rapidly growing company in the environmental sector.

jobDescription:
Fast-growing and venture-backed AI startup seeks talented operations interns to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Top-notch written and verbal communication skills are essential. A strong sense of ownership is a prerequisite. Expect to work on projects involving voice AI and LLMs with intense, motivated, and competent peers.

What you'll do:

  • Support the execution of strategic initiatives; includes tracking metrics and milestones
  • Analyze data and information to provide insights and recommendations
  • Manage grant applications, job postings and relationships with external parties when needed
  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives
  • Complete complex and diverse tasks within given rules/limits

What you have:

  • Top-notch verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong eye for details
  • Problem solving skills

Innovation in a fast-changing environment requires team members to learn fast and pay extra attention to details while being highly adaptive and flexible. Candidates with the drive to learn and excel are encouraged to apply.

Please apply only if you're a 2024 Graduate OR student willing to commit to the role for at least 8 months starting in the Fall.

Picovoice offers local LLM and on-device voice AI platforms, enabling developers to build voice AI agents that are fast (no network latency), compliant (user data is not processed in 3rd party remote servers) and cost-effective. Here's an example of voice-enabled LLM-powered AI agents locally on consumer CPU: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uV0GlXDFSPw

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Applicants must apply on Wellfound.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Role Description:

Our Toronto office is recruiting for the next PEY work term. Our office is located at 55 St. Clair West in Toronto (near St. Clair TTC station). However, we are currently in a hybrid work environment. Our Intelligence Group out of Arcadis IBI Group’s Toronto Headquarters is recruiting for the next PEY work term.

This student position is open to University of Toronto students who have completed at least 3 years of their program. This student will work on various types of projects under the Operations Management Team (e.g. Operational Control Centres, Event Planning and Management, Environment and Sustainability Initiatives, etc.). Candidates will be part of projects related to the application of technology and operational planning in the transportation industry.

Join us if you are interested in working with Canadian, US and international (Europe, Asia and South Africa) clients. Join us if you’re interested in designing and building Smart Cities through the application of technology to create smart infrastructure. Join us if you’re interested in a chance to work with agencies like the Ministry of Transportation Ontario (MTO), Metrolinx, various US Department of Transportation agencies, South Africa National Roads Authority Limited (SANRAL), and the Bahamas Bridge Authority. Join us if you’re interested in a mix of small, short term projects, as well as large, complex P3 projects.

Role Accountabilities:

  • Research technology solutions for Smart Cities, communication systems, intelligent roadway or transit systems, including technology strategic plans development
  • Develop functional requirements/specifications and procurement process documents
  • Develop physical, operational, and technological recommendations and strategies
  • Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Support business development and proposal initiatives
  • Prepare schedules and cost estimates
  • Document and evaluate on-site conditions
  • Potential travel to client sites (if applicable)

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Candidates must be enrolled in Engineering program – preference for individuals looking for careers in systems and technology
  • Candidates must have demonstrable above average oral and written communications skills
  • Able to work effectively independently and on a team
  • Strong time management skills
  • Eagerness to learn various types of project work across different practices
  • Critical and analytical thinking
  • Familiarity with the Microsoft Office Applications
  • Valid Ontario Driver's license
  • Preferred candidates would have interest in a career in application of technology within the transportation industry

** Experience working with GIS and Microsoft Visio is considered an asset

Why Arcadis?

We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.

You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information

As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver’s license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. HCM has an exciting opportunity as a Parts Quality Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026.  The successful candidate will become a team member in HCM’s Parts Quality (PQ) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

The Parts Quality department is responsible for both supplied parts quality, and final vehicle quality throughout the vehicle life cycle – from design development input, through to mass production and field quality. PQ supports in responding to concerns from the manufacturing line regarding quality issues, contains part quality concerns from installation onto the vehicle, develops temporary/permanent countermeasures, and accesses and audits countermeasure effectiveness.

Not sure what to expect while working as a Parts Quality Intern at HCM? You will be responsible for performing visual inspections, as well as mechanical and functional verification of parts and design to align with HCM quality standards. You will effectively develop and lead cross-functional process improvements within the department, and investigate the root causes of failures and implement improvements to prevent recurrence. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP) . What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Lead/Support complex themes involving manufacturing, design and our supply base.
  • Offer technical viewpoint – drawing/specification interpretation and application to parts.
  • Support department business plan initiatives and daily management.
  • Monitor quality trends; identify root cause; implement cost effective corrective actions.
  • Factory struggle follow up and investigation.
  • Line Support (part verification); judging part quality acceptance levels, while maintaining Honda Quality Systems: Occurrence, Containment, Corrective Action.
  • Outflow prevention support including - yard containment, inspection, part repair and QAV’s at supplier
  • Managing supplier relationships – NARS (North American Reporting System) communicate results to management.
  • Review and approve supplier PQCTs, FMEAs and other quality documents.
  • Support trials of new model tooling, equipment, and manufacturing.
  • Support the part development process by reviewing and approving drawings, manufacturing equipment, inspection fixture and document review.

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication skills.
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?

    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates). You are required to provide lineside support, repair activities, checking of finished vehicles and similar functions as required.
  • Must be willing to travel domestically (sometimes internationally)
    • That’s right! You may travel to our Canadian suppliers or even our friends over the border. Valid Canadian Passport or B1 Visa is required for international travel)
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this.
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

jobDescription:
Cerebras has developed a radically new chip and system to dramatically accelerate deep learning applications. Our system runs training and inference workloads orders of magnitude faster than contemporary machines, fundamentally changing the way ML researchers work and pursue AI innovation.

We are innovating at every level of the stack – from chip, to microcode, to power delivery and cooling, to new algorithms and network architectures at the cutting edge of ML research. Our fully-integrated system delivers unprecedented performance because it is built from the ground up for deep learning workloads.


Cerebras is building a team of exceptional people to work together on big problems. Join us!

About The Role

As a member of our Performance team, you will work with leaders from industry and academia at the intersection of hardware and software, to develop state-of-the-art solutions for emerging problems in AI compute. We’re looking for a performance engineer to estimate and optimize end-to-end performance for the hardware, software stack, and workload of Cerebras’ new AI-optimized system.

Responsibilities

  • Develop models for the hardware, software stack, and workload to estimate end-to-end performance
  • Develop tools to analyze performance and identify bottlenecks and optimization opportunities
  • Work with the hardware and software design teams to analyze and optimize workload performance
  • Work with design teams to implement optimizations and tune overall performance

Requirements

  • Enrolled within University of Toronto's PEY program with a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any other related disciplines
  • Experience with performance analysis on CPUs, GPUs, and parallel architectures
  • Experience with end-to-end workload analysis from low level assembly instruction code to high level distributed algorithms
  • Programming/scripting experience in C/C++ and Python

jobDescription:
Job Description:

The Prime Brokerage team sits within the Equities Business in Capital Markets and works closely with Hedge Funds, Pension Plans and other financial entities to serve clients and generate revenue for the dealer. The Prime Brokerage area is one of the fastest growing within TD Securities and is looking to add an PEY Analyst to help accelerate that growth.

The analyst's responsibilities would include:

  • The successful candidate will work closely with Prime Brokerage in day to day trading and settlement operations including Secured Funding/Securities lending which include:
  • Manage the day to day trading, booking, P&L and maintenance of the Equity Finance book
  • Build client relationships to source liquidity and funding for TD from other market participants
  • Operate effectively within the defined regulatory control framework and ensure inherent risks are timely reported, escalated and mitigated.
  • Develop strong relationships with Front Office, Risk Management, Technology and Operations, while promoting an excellent client experience.
  • The candidate will also work with team members in development of technology solutions involving:
  • Creating, developing and leading their own projects in automation, software, data and optimization.

jobDescription:
Physical Design Engineer

Alphawave Semi builds industry-leading wired connectivity solutions that enable data to travel faster, more reliably, and with higher performance at lower power. Our technology is embedded in leading-edge semiconductors built to power global network and computer systems. It is an essential part of the core infrastructure enabling next generation services in data centres, artificial intelligence, 5G wireless infrastructure, data networking, autonomous vehicles, and solid-state storage.

What You’ll Do:

  • Exposure to the backend process through the entire implementation flow
  • Assist in the flow scripting and benchmark trial runs
  • Physical synthesis with special focus on power and area optimization trials
  • Clock Tree Synthesis / Optimization trials
  • Static timing verification and timing closure
  • Perform physical verification (DRC,ANT,LVS,ERC,…)
  • Perform EM/IR analysis to reduce power integrity issues and improve the IC design

What you’ll Need:

  • Enrolled in Electrical or Computer Engineering University program
  • Knowledge of industry standard IC design tools (synthesis, simulation, equivalence checking, static timing analysis) is an asset
  • Experience with scripting, Linux/Unix environment
  • Tools/Languages:   Verilog, TCL, Python, Perl, C/C++, GNU Make
  • Some understanding of ASIC/IC design flow

Diversity & Inclusivity

Alphawave Semi is based out of one of the most diverse countries in the world. This includes differences related to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability and socioeconomic status. To us, diversity is one our strongest assets to our organization. We commit ourselves to promoting the recognition and appreciation of our diverse and rich culture. We believe that it is critical to our success to promote freedom of thought and opinion in a respectful environment. The decisions we make are rooted by respectfully considering each other’s thoughts and opinions and by working towards a greater common goal.

jobDescription:
NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. NVIDIA is a “learning machine” that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to solve, that only we can take on, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work - to amplify human creativity and intelligence.

We are now looking for a Physical Design Intern: We are looking for a Physical Design Intern who will be responsible for all aspects of physical design and implementation of Graphics processors, integrated chipsets, and other ASICs targeted at the desktop, laptop, workstation, set-top box and home networking markets.

What you will be doing:

  • As a member of the team, you will participate in the efforts in establishing CAD and physical design methodologies (flow and tools development) as well as implementation.
  • Your day to day will include developing chip floor plan, power/clock distribution, chip assembly and P&R, timing closure, power and noise analysis and back-end verification across multiple projects.
  • This position requires you to work with EDA vendor (Synopsys, Cadence, Magma, Mentor, etc.) tool suites such as: ICC2,PrimeTime, dc_shell, Innovus, SeaHawk.
  • You will interact with a diverse team engineers.

What we need to see:

  • You are currently enrolled in BSEE, MSEE or PhD.
  • Deep understanding of VLSI and Physical Design related basics & concepts.
  • You should possess a deep understanding of static timing analysis, clock/power distribution and analysis, RC extraction and correlation, place and route, circuit design and analysis.
  • You have scripting and programming experience using several of the following: Perl, C, C++, TCL, Scheme, Skill and Make.

Do you have previous experience in physical design implementation like any Physical Design Internships or Physical Design projects or Physical Design experience in companies? We'd love to hear from you!

With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, we are widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our best-in-class engineering teams are rapidly growing. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a passion for technology, we want to hear from you!

jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

Plant Engineering collaborates with the Maintenance and Operations departments to develop engineered solutions for piping and equipment repairs, replacements, and changes. As the Plant Engineering Co-op, you will:

  • Scope, design and engineer construction work packages, applying both company practices and industry codes & standards
  • Collaborate with designers to issue engineering documentation such as Process & Instrument Diagrams (P&ID’s), piping isometrics, and mechanical detail drawings
  • Work with a multi-disciplinary team to support mechanical, instrumentation, automation, and electrical replacements and upgrades
  • Manage and drive safety mindset through participation in site programs including field level risk assessments (FLRA) and safety peer observations (PPP)
  • Lead one or more special projects with emphasis on development and implementation of solutions to improve safety, reliability or compliance

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Mechanical Engineering discipline. Other disciplines will be considered based on experience or applicable courses.
  • Strong teamwork/interpersonal skills with ability to communicate ideas effectively
  • Motivated self-starter who can work well independently
  • Multitask competing priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • 3D spatial visualization skills and mechanical aptitude
  • Experience with using engineering software such as AutoCAD is preferred
  • Knowledge of Microsoft products such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

WORK CONDITIONS:

Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of engineering assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!

About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment

jobDescription:
A peek into your purpose

In our Process Engineering Department, our Engineers focus on the design, development and optimization of cutting-edge manufacturing processes and technologies to produce high-tech devices used in medical procedures. Our Process Engineers are directly involved with providing product design and manufacturability input during concept and commercialization phases as well as actively participating in continuous improvement initiatives when scaling up existing manufacturing processes.

Role commitments

  • You will support the development and optimization of innovative manufacturing processes and equipment including generating ideas, drafting 3D prototypes in SolidWorks, coordinating testing, and researching and providing input to the team as needed.
  • You will work on equipment to improve the manufacturing process. This includes; the design and development of new tools and fixtures, automating simple motions or changes to improve existing equipment
  • You will build and test prototype devices to ensure they meet requirements
  • You will assist with the development of validation and test plans by supporting Engineers with the execution of process characterization and testing of devices
  • You will take on LEAN initiatives to make improvements to the manufacturing process
  • You will aid in the development and provision of technical documentation by preparing drawings, writing work instructions, and providing training for new tools and equipment
  • You will participate in testing of manufacturing processes and equipment. You will design test methods or follow standard protocols to ensure the device meets the patients needs.
  • You will be responsible for monitoring safety practices and ensuring ISO 13485 and FDA compliance while collaborating with cross functional teams to meet product timelines.

What we expect

  • Actively working towards a Degree in Engineering; Do not apply if you are not currently enrolled in the 2024/2025 school year.
  • Strong interest in biomedical technology
  • Motivated self-starter with a hands-on approach
  • Ability to work independently and with a diverse group of Engineers and Clinicians
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • Strong leadership and problem-solving skills
  • Positive attitude and enthusiasm

Stand-out skills

  • Six Sigma or LEAN knowledge
  • Experience with SolidWorks and Minitab

Experience in a highly regulated manufacturing environment

jobDescription:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Facilities & Services on the St. George campus is looking for a highly engaged engineering student interested in process improvement and redesign using Lean Six Sigma methodologies combined with automation of processes.

The Process Improvement & Automation Engineer Coop role will be focused on leveraging continuous improvement, user-centered design and institutional automation tools to transform processes, drive innovations and improvements for clients, and yield savings and efficiencies across Facilities & Services. They would support in redesigning processes, and design, code, test, and deploy high-quality flow solutions using applications such as Microsoft Power Platform, Python, and other scripting languages.

This role will work closely with the business improvement team, senior process engineer, process analyst, special projects officer, and other teams across the department including senior management, field personnel, and administrative staff. They will have the opportunity to learn and apply continuous improvement methodologies and cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world problems.

They would be responsible for the capture, documentation, and analysis of business and maintenance processes; identification of improvements and automation opportunities; and actively building, testing, and launching automated solutions using Microsoft Power Platform applications and a variety of programming languages.

They would also support knowledge transfer through the creation of high value, intuitive, and transferable artefacts to ensure the sustainability, maintainability, and longevity of their solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Conduct interviews and collect data to evaluate internal workflows and business processes.
  • Identify opportunities, gaps, wastes, and areas for efficiencies and automation.
  • Create process and information flow diagrams and visualizations to capture detailed processes and aid in problem solving and optimization.
  • Perform raw data analysis independently and in a team to identify and analyze opportunities to eliminate waste, reduce costs, and improve quality and customer service.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders, conduct meetings and site visits with different staff groups to gather data and information and advise stakeholders on Power Platform opportunities.
  • Document user requirement specifications, standard operating procedures, and standardized work.
  • Apply user-centered approaches in designing new workflows and applications, such as user stories and usability testing.
  • Design, create, build, and test automation solutions using Microsoft Power Platform Applications.
  • Research, evaluate, and implement emerging and best practices when working with the Microsoft Power Platform environment.
  • Integrate Microsoft Power Platform solutions with other Microsoft technologies to optimize the use of the university’s digital Microsoft ecosystem, information sharing, and reporting.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following established coding standards for transition to other owners after launch.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of software features and functionalities.
  • Anticipate and mitigate potential technical, data, and user-related issues.
  • Perform testing and troubleshoot software defects to maintain a robust and reliable codebase.
  • Contribute to the documentation of software design, coding, and testing activities.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and develop fixes to developed applications and automated workflows.
  • Perform general administration tasks such as organizing documents and files.
  • Create and present reports and progress.
  • Lead a key business problem solving project as a highlight activity.

What you will learn:

  • Automation techniques
  • Process improvement and design
  • Process and systems management
  • Stakeholder management and communication
  • Workflow building and deployment for business and administrative processes
  • User-centered design

jobDescription:
The Power of Dreams is alive and well at Honda of Canada Mfg. (HCM). Located in Alliston, Ontario on 750 acres and employing more than 4,500 Associates, HCM is a 45-minute drive north of Toronto and 25 minutes south of Barrie. HCM began production in 1986 leading the way as the first Japanese automobile manufacturer to establish a production facility in Canada. Today, HCM is one of Honda's premier manufacturing facilities in the world producing the Honda Civic and CRV vehicles, including hybrid production. HCM is excited for its new chapter and journey towards electrification, including the highly anticipated EV and battery production plants that are expected in the coming years!

HCM has an exciting opportunity as a Product Engineering Intern for a 16-month work term beginning May 2025 through August 2026. Successful candidates will become a team member in HCM’s Product Engineering (PE) department and will be exposed to the latest technology in a highly automated manufacturing facility.

Not sure what to expect while working as a Product Engineering Intern? The Product Engineering department is responsible for new model design confirmations (new technology and past problem review), product testing, and generating design changes to support ease of manufacturing. As the PE Intern, you will be supporting our various commodities, including Denso (Electrical) Group, Interior/Exterior Group, Chassis Group, and Complex Quality. You will have the opportunity to support New Model Vehicle Testing Setup, problem investigation, squeak/rattle/wind/vibration testing, and containment activities. Hear from our Interns by clicking this link: https://linktr.ee/HCMRecruitment

First time working in a professional work environment? Don't worry! All our Engineering Interns are assigned and will work alongside an experienced mentor in your department. You will also receive training and mentorship from the Intern you are replacing – a wonderful way to learn and set an example for the students that follow in your footsteps!

Following your internship, you will have a final report and presentation in order to be considered for a permanent (yes, permanent) position within our Engineering Development Program (EDP). What better way to return to school than knowing that you have a permanent position waiting for you following graduation?

Responsibilities:

  • Supporting engineering and project management activities with team members on small and large New Model Prototype development.
  • Support Vehicle Test Setup & data collection utilizing equipment and tools such as Digital Multimeters, Oscilloscopes, Collaborative Robot, Thermal Chambers etc.
  • Support investigations and implement countermeasures for Mass Production/New Model concerns surrounding squeaks & rattles, durability, corrosion, and noise/vibration.
  • Support Critical Control Point verification on vehicle development and manufacturing.
  • Supporting Production/Assembly Line when required

Requirements:

  • Must be within eight months of graduation at the completion of the internship term (currently in year three of a four-year degree, or year four of a five-year degree).
  • Must demonstrate self-motivation and initiative to learn, adapt, and execute projects
  • Must be willing to work hands on – don’t worry, we will provide the training! All skill levels are welcome, you just need to show the willingness!
  • Must have excellent time management and communication
  • Must be willing to work overtime (and a lot of it!)
    • Many roles will require weekend work, including holidays and our shutdowns (1 week in July, 1 week in December). We provide alternate days off throughout the week to compensate for this. Oh, and did we mention overtime is paid?
  • Must be willing to work on the production line (training provided)
    • We will have you work on the production line at the onset of your internship as part of your training. This ensures you are always trained to jump in and help, develop an appreciation for the manufacturing line, and help build a relationship with your customers (production associates).
  • Valid Full G Class Driver’s license with no restrictions is required
    • I’m sorry, there are no exceptions to this
  • Must be willing to work 2nd shift
    • You will occasionally be required to support our 2nd shift (4:30pm-1:00am). This will be for 1 week at a time (subject to change). It may not sound the most appealing, but we promise you learn a lot on 2nd shift!

Preferred Experience:

  • Microsoft Office Suite (brush up on your Excel skills!)
  • Demonstrated experience with CAD software’s for electrical or mechanical design, interpretation, and/or analysis (e.g. Catia, Solidworks, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentation skills) in order to communicate complex problems, schedule amongst team members, and/or coordinate with suppliers and vendors
    • We do a lot of presentations – you will be an expert by the end of this internship!
  • Demonstrated ability to work hands on with basic hand tools and measurement equipment including wrenches, screwdrivers, Digital Multimeters, Soldering iron, air tools…. etc.
    • Anything counts here! No experience? That’s okay! A pro at building Ikea furniture? Great! Show us you are willing to learn!
  • Large team project work or technical projects demonstrating ability to succeed in a team environment
  • Project management experience
    • Lean into your school or extra-curricular projects! We will teach you our Engineering Flow (E-Flow) including developing the project scope, schedule creation, status tracking, and coordinating and supervising contractors. You just need to show us you have the foundation to do so!
  • Working knowledge of vehicle mechanics, dynamics, and testing
    • Calling all car people! You will get to work very hands on with our vehicles through testing and analysis. If you love cars, this is the job for you!
  • Ability to work in an open concept environment and be extremely flexible
    • No days are the same at HCM. What makes a successful associate is someone who can pivot and adjust to our ever-changing environment. You may be asked to do something that is completely new to you – embrace it, welcome it, and take it as an opportunity to grow! Future you will thank you.

Additional Information:

HCM offers many activities for associates to get involved in! We have an on-site recreation center (free of charge) that offers a fully equipped fitness center, full size indoor ice rink, and outdoor and indoor courts. We have a (highly loved) hockey, baseball, and soccer league; we offer exercise classes, cross fit, and yoga; drop-in basketball and pickle ball. HCM hosts a spectacular annual Holiday Party and associates always love our Summer BBQ! HCM is also very involved in our community – we annually participate in the Honda Waterfront Run and the Barrie Dragon Boat Festival.

Become even more involved and join your fellow Intern community! They are always getting together for bowling, pizza nights, games and more!

Thought that was a lot? HCM also has five Business Resource Groups (BRG) you can get involved with (think extra-curricular club, but better):

  • Honda Young Professionals: “Enhance experiences and develop careers of Honda’s Young Professional by building community, improving engagement, and providing career resources and guidance.”
  • Women Powering Honda: “Empowering Women at Honda through impactful engagement, and enhancement opportunities in a safe and supportive work environment.”
  • BIPOC of Honda: “Work to foster professional growth and development and to advocate for pathways for these developmental opportunities for BIPOC individuals at HCM.”
  • EARTH (Environmental Actions Rewarding to Honda): “Cultivate Honda associate opportunities for environmental engagement at the facility and in the community.”

Are you someone that’s into cars (I’d sure hope so)? HCM also has a Velocity Motorsports Club (VMC) ! Join a talented group of HCM associates as they prepare for another exciting race season! Not so much into racing but your personal car needs some work? Students are also eligible to use the fully equipped on-site vehicle service center.

At HCM, Respect for the Individual is a fundamental belief. We recognize, respect and value individual differences in one another. We are committed to creating equal opportunity for all associates to grow in a diverse and inclusive work environment while driving continuous improvement with Passion, delivering Joy and Value to our Customers.

HCM is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request. The accommodation provided will consider the applicant’s

accessibility needs. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process or to successfully submit an application, please include that information in your application.

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a Production Support for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward. â€‹

We are looking for an intern to join our Sheild team, here’s what you’ll do here :

  • Provide proactive and reactive support for production systems to guarantee their functionality

  • Resolve Incidents, Defects and Problem tickets by finding creative solutions, solving complex problems, coding, testing, and debugging a wide variety of systems

  • Code in a mainstream enterprise stack such as Java, JDBC, Hibernate, Angular, etc.

  • Gain proficiency with IntelliJ / Eclipse and other development tools

  • Contribute to Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) application development using GitHub, Docker and OpenShift environments

  • Create applications using industry standard development methodologies, such as Agile/Scrum/Kanban

  • Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Strong team player ready to collaborate with different teams to solve complex problems

  • Experience in Java or SQL is preferred

  • Familiarity with the following is considered an asset:â€‹

    • Building server-side apps using Java 8+, JDBC, Hibernate, or

    • Creating web services or APIs using REST, Spring Boot, or Spring framework, or

    • Relational databases like Oracle or No-SQL databases such as MongoDB or ElasticSearch

  • A “can do” attitude, passion for problem solving, and the ability to take initiative

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 4. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact or belairdirect, please apply for this role on Contact People.

jobDescription:
Quantitative Analyst Co-Op: Natural Gas Trading

Castleton Commodities International is an independent global commodities merchant. As a trader, CCI deploys capital on a proprietary basis in the physical and financial commodity markets, providing the Company with market insights and access. As a strategic investor and developer, CCI leverages its market expertise, operations capabilities, and industry knowledge to invest in, and develop, select commodity infrastructure assets. CCI focuses its activities on the markets it understands best, while constantly striving to expand its knowledge base and network of relationships in order to participate in new markets.

CCI’s natural gas activities include the ownership of physical reserves, physical and financial trading, leasing of storage and transport capacity, and transacting with producers and consumers. CCI’s U.S. Natural Gas business consistently ranks among the top marketers of natural gas in the U.S. transacting on approximately 100 pipelines and over 60 storage facilities to create a geographically diverse portfolio of natural gas assets. CCI’s natural gas storage leases comprise one of the largest independent storage portfolios in North America.

Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, CCI conducts business from offices located around the world including Calgary, Canada; Houston, Texas; New York, New York; Geneva, Switzerland; London, United Kingdom; and Singapore. The Company has more than 500 employees across the globe.

Co-Op Overview:
This is a 12 to 16 month co-op working closely with the Calgary based Natural Gas trading team primarily focused on in-depth analysis of the North American energy markets.  The role will provide the applicant, the opportunity to learn about natural gas market fundamentals and the structure of the natural gas physical and financial market.  The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who has the ability to work under pressure in an independent manner.  The candidate must have a strong programming, mathematical and statistical background with an interest to learn about a career in the commodity trading industry. This is an ideal opportunity to learn about the commodity markets and more specifically the data impacts that go into the analysis that drives trading decisions.

Daily/Weekly Responsibilities:

  • Develop and increase knowledge of the natural gas market
  • Design and develop visualizations to analyze fundamental and market data
  • Perform natural gas market research and analysis directly supporting trading activities
  • Improve existing visualizations to facilitate efficient viewing of data analytics
  • Analyze large data sets and build statistical models to identify and forecast patterns
  • Partner with traders and analysts to improve trading decisions and research process
  • Identify market pricing trends and discontinuity
  • Participate in regular meetings throughout the week with traders and analysts

Example Projects:

The natural gas market has a number of factors which directly affect the supply and demand balance. These all fluctuate on a daily basis and can result in price changes across the futures curve. Using our fundamental and price data warehouse, build visualization tools to process data and view relationships in supply and demand data.  Interact with traders to determine which relationships have significant market impacts.

Weather is a large driver of price fluctuations in the natural gas market.  It can have an effect on both supply and demand components.  The historical data sets associated with weather are also very large.  Analyze historical weather data and their relationships to natural gas fundamentals across time and regions.  Build visualization tools to view those relationships.

One key feature in the natural gas market is the existence of seasonality in the term structure of the futures curve.  As a result, many seasonal relationships occur in trading patterns.  Analyze historical relationships between storage and market pricing to find correlations in market activity.

Electricity markets are becoming an important driver of demand for natural gas markets. Forecasting electricity demand from natural gas is becoming increasingly challenging with the proliferation of renewable generation sources (wind, solar) in combination with traditional weather volatility. Additionally, fuel substitution potential exists between natural gas and coal at different price levels in various regions. Using proprietary information explore various forecasting techniques to improve electricity demand forecasting.
jobTitle: Quantitative Trading Analyst Co-Op: Natural Gas Trading

jobDescription:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.

At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!

Reliability Engineer Co-Op/Intern

A Reliability Engineer Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned to special projects and will assist other engineers on major projects.  Projects will focus on improving asset reliability and plant availability, plant stationary assets and assessing and documenting condition of existing assets.

Where will you work:

Mosaic Potash Esterhazy is an underground potash mine located 90 kilometers south of Yorkton. It’s split between three mine sites - K1, K2 and K3 which will be the largest, and one of the world’s most competitive underground potash mines in the world.

Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.

Term

May 12 - August 22, 2025

What will you do?

Day to day work assignments could include:

  • Investigating failures to determine root causes and developing corrective actions. Inspections could lead into design assessment using computer modeling or hand calculations.

  • Specific project assignments will be made by the supervisor; assignments could include:

    • Troubleshooting-Using problem-solving techniques such as RCA’s, 8-step and/or 5 Why

    • Evaluating equipment/process performance comparative to design or similar processes

    • Design/size/validate new or modification of existing equipment.

    • Preventative maintenance and job plan improvements incorporating precision maintenance practices.

    • Utilize root cause analysis to review significant failures, identify corrective action to prevent re-occurrence and refine asset strategy to sustain improvement.

    • Mine data to identify reliability improvement opportunities and develop corrective actions focused on delivering OEE improvements and cost reduction.

    • Identify deficiencies in maintenance processes and develop sustainable improvements.

    • Mine data to identify historic design methods and drawings to assist with ongoing asset integrity decisions.

  • Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, plant operators, engineers (of various disciplines), tradespersons, and contractors.

  • Participation in department meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment.

  • Adhering to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies.

What do you need for this role?

  • Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Industrial Systems.

  • Ability to function in an industrial chemical and mining environment.

  • 1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is preferred.

  • Previous internship or co-op experience is preferred.

  • Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license - You will need to be able to travel to and from sites and/or office.

  • Basic computer skills are required.

  • Experience working in a team environment is a must.

  • Familiarity with an industrial environment is highly desirable.

  • Effective verbal communication skills is a plus.

  • Physical work environment is occasionally outdoors with exposure to varying degrees of hot and cold environments.

  • Selected candidates will be required to successfully complete the following: Post-offer/pre-placement drug and alcohol screening, background check, physical, functional capacity examination.

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

jobDescription:
Being a part of the TUM Learning Systems and Robotics Lab (www.learnsyslab.org), led by Prof. Angela Schoellig, you will have the chance to engage in cutting-edge research at the intersection of robotics, machine learning, and system control. Our research is motivated by the vision of a seamless interaction of robotic systems with the physical world. In particular, our research interests are centred around the challenges associated with robots operating in increasingly unstructured, uncertain and changing environments and over long periods of time. These situations challenge current robot designs, which rely on knowing the specifics of the environment and tasks ahead of time in order to operate safely and efficiently.

As a research intern, you will work in collaboration with graduate students and senior researchers within the lab and develop innovative solutions to push the boundaries of state-of-the-art robot perception and decision-making algorithms. We offer opportunities for you to sharpen both soft and technical skills through the course of the internship.
* Technical areas: Control theory, reinforcement learning, robot simulation, and real-world robotics experimentation
* Software toolboxes: Python, C++, Robot Operating System (ROS), CasADI, OpenAI Gym, PyTorch, and PyBullet
* Transferrable skills: Conduct thorough literature reviews to understand the current state of research in a specific domain, effectively convey complex technical concepts, write a scientific paper, and deliver engaging presentations tailored for both academic and general audiences

Typical tasks of the internship include
* Implementing cutting-edge robot perception and decision-making algorithms (e.g., reinforcement learning, learning-based control, semantic SLAM)
* Contributing to the benchmark software (e.g., safe-control-gym) and maintaining the repository
* Conducting real-world robot experiments (e.g., flying vehicles, mobile manipulators)
* Collaborating with graduate students and senior researchers to develop and verify theoretical findings
* Documenting findings in scientific writing and presenting them to internal and external research groups

Salary: Compensation details, tailored to the candidate's qualifications, experience, and work location, will be shared during the interview.

jobDescription:
Overview

Safran Landing Systems is the world leader in aircraft landing and braking systems. The company has partnerships with 25 airframers in civil, regional, commercial and military transport, and supports 32,000 aircraft that operate around 80,000 landings daily.

At the Safran Landing System’s Toronto site in Ajax, the engineering team develops and supports the Boeing 787 program, Bombardier programs, several military programs, as well as Advanced Projects and Research & Technology.

SLS engineering is looking for energetic, proactive aerospace inquisitive individuals that can contribute to the engineering team. We are looking for you to learn and return within several areas of engineering.

Application Process:

There are multiple positions that are being offered:

•       Methods & Tools Interns

•       Program Chief Engineers Office Interns

•       Landing Gear Performance Analysis and Methods Development Intern

•       Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern

•       Design & Analysis Engineering Interns

•       Systems Design & Integration Intern

•       Advanced Projects Interns

You may apply to your preferred roles within engineering within ONE application. Based on the applicants, you may be selected to participate in a panel interview, where focals from all areas of engineering will be present. The best fit for the candidates in each area of engineering will be selected. Further, to suit growth of your internship experience, we may move you into alternate areas of engineering to provide you a well rounded experience at Safran Landing Systems.

General Candidate Skills and Requirements

  • 3rd or 4th year university student in Mechanical/Aeronautical Engineering or related discipline.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Microsoft Office in general
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment as well as independently
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Interest in the aeronautical industry

Methods & Tools Intern

Job description

Within Safran Landing Systems, there is a stress analysis software development project (“StressApps”) that requires a supporting engineering student resource. This project is an excellent opportunity for any engineering student looking for exposure to traditional static and fatigue analysis theory as applied in landing gear analysis. The student will mainly be involved with the testing and validation of the software.

General duties include:

  • Understand static and fatigue theory that is being programmed
  • Contribute to software definition (GUI mock-up, outputs, presentation of theory to the programmers (external company))
  • Test software for correctness / compare verse hand-calculations

At any given time, there are about several .NET applications being programmed by an external sub-contractor. Each program is a type of static or fatigue analysis, or a utility to helps manipulate data. The student will help at various stages in the development process according to ability and experience.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Understanding of the fundamental principles of Solid Mechanics and Fatigue.
  • Visual Basic or other coding experience is an asset

Program Chief Engineers Office Intern

Job description

An Engineering student position is available within the Program Chief Engineers (PCE) Office for both development and sustaining programs. This position may also involve engagement with other functions of the engineering team.

Under the responsibility of the Program Chief Engineer and/or Deputy, the successful candidate will provide support in the following capacity:

  • Assist in the tracking of actions assigned to the PCE office
  • Assist in the preparation and/or update of engineering deliverables, including technical reports
  • Assist in the preparation of various presentations, both internal and external
  • Provide engineering support on technical issues and investigations
  • Provide engineering support to Design and Analysis, Systems, Test and Performance Engineering functions as required
  • Prepare, schedule and participate in internal meetings or with customer, and follow up on status with various internal departments and the customer to provide regular updates

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Project management and leadership skills
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills

Landing Gear Performance Analysis and Methods Development Intern

Job description

The intern will be working in the Performance and Methods & Tools Team to perform landing gear performance analysis and to assist harmonized methods development. The project will focus on the landing gear system modeling, simulation and harmonized methods development related with some or all of the following subjects:

  • Landing gear shimmy modelling and analysis
  • Landing and ground handling loads analysis
  • Extension/retraction analysis
  • Shock absorber modelling and dynamics
  • Nose wheel steering performance
  • Steering runaway failure analysis
  • Virtual system/test rig modeling and simulation
  • Harmonized methods & tools development

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • The intern will have a good sense for the design of mechanical and hydraulic equipment and a capability to validate and optimize the design by analysis (including simulation).
  • Some knowledge of aircraft systems would be of an advantage.
  • Knowledge of MatLab Simulink, ADAMS, Easy5, AMESIM, VBA, or Python would be an asset

Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern

Overview

The Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern supports activities related to the development of landing gear system specifications and novel architecture definitions. This work involves capturing customer and stakeholder needs, flowing them down to the product design (needs validation), and finally, ensuring that the designed product satisfies them (needs verification). The Systems Architecture and Integration (SAI) team is spread across three offices, Ajax (Toronto), Vélizy (Paris) and Gloucester (England), with frequent collaboration between them. This position is unique in that it gives an excellent overview of the Engineering department’s activities since SAI works with several other teams.

Job description

The main objective of the Systems Architecture process is to capture stakeholder needs for all operating conditions over the entire product lifecycle by:

  • Ensuring the operational needs and constraints are complete and understood.
    • Activities: Describing operational contexts, use cases, and scenarios based on direct interactions with the customer and SafranLS’s prior knowledge
  • Structuring the product design process.
    • Activities: Reviewing and writing requirements, identifying candidate architectures and relevant trade-offs, allocating functions and linking requirements to sub-systems and equipment
  • Completing trade-offs to assess the different architectures and choose the optimal technical solution (with support of all the Engineering functions involved).
  • Reviewing technical coherence of the proposed product.
  • Identifying risks and opportunities within the project (e.g. weight, performance, cost).
  • Leading and documenting collaborative workshops with customers and/or internally.
  • Recording and applying external and internal design best practices and lessons learned.

MBSE Management

As the Systems Architecture tasks are realized within a Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) framework, the Systems Architecture & MBSE Intern will also be involved in some of the following MBSE Management activities:

  • Create and manage MBSE artifacts in the IBM Jazz platform, under the Requirements, Architecture and Configuration domains. This includes modeling at the operational, functional, logical and technical level, and writing or reviewing specification documents.
  • Engage with customers to build collaborative MBSE frameworks.
  • Train and support project teams in following the MBSE process using the methods and tools in the IBM Jazz platform.
  • Capture and document MBSE best practices for the Systems Architecture community.
  • Review MBSE resources to learn and share new skills and ideas related to methods, languages and tools.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Independent learner who naturally questions unproven assertions and is motivated to study both practical and abstract topics.
  • Big picture thinker that can also pay attention to detail when required.
  • Takes initiative, and able to work both autonomously and in a team.
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English; French is an asset.
  • Has knowledge of Systems Engineering theory and its application on complex embedded systems. An interest in developing this knowledge is sufficient, but a prior understanding of engineering requirements, engineering technical documents, verification and validation is an asset.
  • Familiarity with UML/SysML, MBSE tools, and requirements management tools is an asset.
  • Familiar with modeling and simulation environments in Matlab/Simulink or similar modeling tools.
  • Experience creating and/or reading hydraulic and electrical schematics is an asset.

Design & Analysis Engineering Interns

Design Job description

  • Reporting to the Integrated Product Team - Engineering Group Leader.
  • Design of landing gear components and associated systems using CATIA V5 in support of more senior level Designers.
  • Working with the IPT, responsible for ensuring the design of the equipment meets the applicable specification requirements including CAR, FAR and CS.
  • 3D modelling, drawing creation, dimensioning and annotation of components.
  • 2D and 3D tolerance stack ups of assemblies of parts.
  • Clearance analysis in a 3D, kinematic context.
  • Application, evaluation and development of Design methods and tools.
  • Create and update documents using Product Data Management system.
  • Participate in Concurrent Engineering with various company functions including Stress, Dynamics, Systems, Quality, Product Support, Manufacturing, etc.
  • Ensure that lessons learned are applied to new designs.
  • Ensure that a common design approach is followed using harmonized company standards.
  • Support in-service aircraft for production repair, in-service repair, investigations and associated Material Review Board activities if required.
  • Possible move to a different functional role as required by the business (eg. Stress, etc.).
  • Other company/Engineering related activities as required.

Analysis Job description

  • Responsible for the structural integrity of Landing Gears and Landing Gear Systems in support of more senior level Analysts/Engineers.
  • Strength, Fatigue, Endurance Analysis.
  • Classical and 3D Finite Element Analysis.
  • Weight Optimization of components.
  • Definition and evolution of raw material requirements.
  • Coordination of development test activities.
  • Support to qualification test activities.
  • Application, evaluation and development of Stress methods and tools.
  • Prepare and review structural reports for compliance to airworthiness specifications and customer requirements.
  • Provide support and justification in the disposition of non-conformances and structural repairs.
  • Possible move to a different functional role as required by the business (eg. Design, etc.).
  • Other company/Engineering related activities as required.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.
  • Good understanding of the fundamental principles of Solid Mechanics and Fatigue.
  • Ability to perform both classical strength and fatigue analyses.
  • Experience with PATRAN, NASTRAN, Abaqus/CAE and ABAQUS are a definite asset.
  • Proficiency in computer programs such as Mathcad is an asset.
  • Capability in the use of CATIA V5 or similar 3D modeling software is an asset
  • Intermediate proficiency with MS Office required.
  • Strong verbal, written and presentation skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Knowledge and experience with CAR/FAR/CS 23/25 specifications are an asset.
  • Detail and results oriented with a well-developed problem-solving ability.
  • Bilingual (French/English) is an asset.

Systems Design & Integration Intern

Job description

Within this frame, and under the responsibility of the Systems Manager or his delegate, the student will be working within an integrated product team. The student will be part of an systems integration group tasked with design and support for all programs both new and sustaining covering electrical, mechanical and avionics equipment. Duties could include a mixture of the following;

  • Participate on engineering teams (including design, analysis, systems, test, manufacturing, quality and other disciplines) to define landing gear system requirements and design architecture.
  • Collect and document Verification data for the LGS components.
  • Create landing gear actuation and steering system hydraulic simulation models using computerized tools.
  • Prepare or review systems performance analyses.
  • Review Test results and correlate to analysis.
  • Prepare test requirements for development, acceptance and qualification tests.
  • Participate in the preparation of failure analyses.
  • Review failure analyses for adequacy and completeness.
  • Prepare/review drawings and specifications for the electrical/hydraulic system.
  • Prepare system hydraulic and electrical schematics, interconnection diagrams and aircraft wiring diagrams.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • University courses should include: Control Systems, Circuit Theory, Numerical Techniques.
  • Knowledge of aircraft performance or aircraft stability and control an asset.
  • Knowledge of one of the aerospace simulation packages a definite asset.

Advanced Projects Intern

Overview

Within the Research and Technology, Innovation and Eco-Design group at Safran Landing Systems, you will work in a dynamic and innovative team created to support customer engagement and develop innovative new products quickly and efficiently. As part of the team, you will be tackling a variety of diverse and technically challenging subjects, such as the development of new landing system products for the latest innovations in transportation. Current and previous projects include novel aircraft braking solutions, more electric landing systems, and advanced concept development for future aircraft from the world’s leading airframers. You will have the opportunity to work through the rapid development of new products from theory to design to hardware tests in our world class test facility.

Job description

Within the Advanced Projects team you will be responsible for assisting in various aspects of the technical design, analysis, modeling, and simulation of landing gear systems and associated components, ensuring compliance with applicable requirements throughout the development. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of complex and innovative systems, developing parts and assemblies from conception to fabrication, and developing multi-physics engineering models and associated system control architectures to meet the evolving needs of the various projects.

Throughout this process, you will gain and utilize a wide variety of skills such as design, analysis, modeling, and simulation to successfully execute the product development in support of key customer accounts. You will be responsible for proposing and developing innovative solutions to meet demanding performance and operational requirements, ultimately participating in model correlation based on real-world test results.

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop new landing gear system components; create sketches and 3D models using CATIA V5
  • Establish the feasibility of the design solution, accounting for both mechanical (strength, fatigue, performance) and practical (machinability, assembly process and integration) considerations
  • Resolve engineering problems through analysis and test
  • Create custom dynamic simulations from first principles to drive engineering decisions
  • Develop technical drawings of parts and assemblies for the manufacture of prototypes
  • Work with manufacturers to reduce complexity, costs, and production times while optimizing the concept
  • Drive model fidelity and improvements by planning and executing test campaigns
  • Establish robust control laws that meet the criteria for using the system defined by the end applications

The successful intern will use their technical knowledge and outside of the box thinking to propose cost effective solutions, perform analyses to support design solution validation, and will participate in ongoing design activities. They will be a member of an international team within the Safran organization.

Specific Candidate skills & requirements

  • Experience with one or more of the following engineering software packages through academic and/or professional projects:

- CAD - CATIA V5

- FEA - ABAQUS, Nastran/Patran, ANSYS

- Simulation - Matlab Simulink, ADAMS, AMESIM

  • 1+ years of experience in one of the following domains (previous internship and student design team experience qualifies):

- Mechanical design and analysis

- Hydromechanical/electromechanical design and analysis

- System simulation and modeling

- Thermal modeling and analysis

  • Experience writing technical documentation
  • Strong knowledge of the principles of static and dynamic mechanics
  • Ability to understand and produce engineering drawings

- Familiarization with GD&T principles is a plus

  • Landing gear knowledge is considered an asset

jobDescription:
Software / Computer Engineer Co-op

Employer: Royal Canadian Mounted Police

Branch Name: Technical Investigative Services (TIS) - REVR Term: 4-12 months

Program: Software Engineering or Computer Engineering (2)

Note: The successful applicant must be a Canadian Citizen and will be required to be security cleared at the Top-Secret level prior to being hired. The clearance process is comprised of a full filed investigation dating back 10 years and includes criminal background checks and the interviews of friends, neighbors, employers, and the applicant himself/herself. Some people have done things during their life that they are not proud of or have used poor judgement. We recognize that learning from one’s mistakes is an important part of life. The successful candidates are those who embody the RCMP’s core values of integrity, honesty, professionalism, compassion, accountability and respect.

Work Environment

Participate in multi-disciplinary teams composed of engineers, technologists, programmers, and technical investigators in the research, design, development, evaluation and application of  highly specialized technical tools to aid in on-going and future investigations.

All work is done in our Ottawa office with no possibility of remote work.

Skills

  • Embedded systems knowledge


Salary
