jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join the Applied Science Applications - Prediction Section in several roles. Each role requires a distinct skill set and your interest and abilities for each of these will be discussed during the interview.

You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process - students are treated no differently than full-time employees. Assigned tasks may include design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation. All development follows a certified ISO9000 process for which you will receive training. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are required.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation - Multiple Roles The NinJo forecaster workstation project is an international collaboration between Canada, Germany, Denmark, and Switzerland to develop a meteorological visualization and production system to support weather forecasting. NinJo is a mission critical software application, supported 24/7 in forecast offices across Canada and worldwide. The software is written primarily in Java, and is highly configurable using XML.

The NinJo interface uses layer-based visualization of different data types to provide meteorologists with a complete picture of atmospheric conditions. Canada is responsible for several layers including Radar, Lightning, Warning, Hurricane, Satellite and Interactive Graphical Editing (IGE). These components, along with many others, allow meteorologists to create and publish graphical forecast products and text bulletins.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation – NinJo consortium Software Developer A NinJo software developer will work on the development and maintenance of forecasting and production tools written in Java, primarily on the NinJo client. This will involve working with real users to enhance the NinJo software, either through bug fixes or implementing new features. The NinJo project uses various development tools such as Perforce, Maven, Jenkins, TestLink, and VisualVM to name a few. It also uses various commercial project-tracking tools such as Atlassian Confluence and JIRA.

NinJo Forecaster Workstation – Aviation (TAF) Software Developer A Software Developer will work on the TAF Editor and related components that support the production of Aviation Forecast for the purpose of flight planning and airport traffic management. This component is built on top of the NinJo platform and relies on the same technologies and processes as other NinJo components like Java, Perforce, Maven, Jenkins, etc. The development process will involve interacting with users for requirement analysis, developing prototypes, testing, and releasing software into production grade environments.

Warning Project Renewal - Multiple Roles Have an impact on the lives and safety of all Canadians. Be part of a small team that develops ground breaking changes to Canada's weather warning system. This project introduces new interactive tools for the forecasters to create and manage weather warning data, as well as new automated processing of that data to generate corresponding public alerts that are distributed to Canadians through various forms of media. Gain experience in Java and Linux while working on interactive features or on back end data processing.

Warning Project Renewal – NinJo Weather Event Layer Software Developer Become a full member of the project’s client side team. Develop interactive editing and production features for a specialized GIS workstation software. The team has an agile process and uses a series of tools for task tracking, code versioning, code reviews, automated builds, and automated testing. Interact closely with our users (forecasters) and with our international partners.

Warning Project Renewal – DMS backend (MWAS connection) Software Developer Become a full member of the project's backend team supporting the Meteorological Service of Canada (MSC) Weather Alerting System (MWAS). Develop for a complex backend network of individual Java applications that augment, aggregate and disseminate life saving weather related information to the Canadian public in real time. Information issued from Meteorologists on the client side is reconciled into individual products and disseminated to various clients. Become a part of maintaining and supporting a mission critical system with real world impacts, including the dissemination of tornado and severe thunderstorm warnings.

Education Requirements

Positions are available for students that have completed their 3rd year in a relevant discipline such as these preferred disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Asset skills and qualifications:

  • Experience with OOP (Java, C/C++, Python, etc.)
  • Experience building GUIs (JavaFX or similar)
  • Experience in a UNIX / Linux environment, including shell scripting
  • Experience with version control (Git, Perforce)
  • Experience working with virtualization (Docker)
  • Ability to effectively analyze, evaluate and solve problems
  • Ability to communicate effectively and work in a team environment
  • Ability to work independently
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies (Iterative, Agile, etc.)
  • Knowledge of object-oriented design patterns and principles (Factory, Builder, Single Responsibility Principle, Liskov Substitution principle)

Further Information

will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (S.C. 2003, c. 22, ss. 12, 13). If selected for an interview, Canadian citizens must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian citizens must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

The positions are available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2025 to September 2026. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

This role is hybrid 2 days a week on-site in Toronto (4905 Dufferin St.) starting in May and 3 days a week on site starting in September.

Preference may be given to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews which will be conducted remotely or in-office.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working where employees will work in the office at least one day per week.

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobDescription:
YuJa Canada is a premiere software/hardware and AI based Ed-Tech tools and technologies provider located at Toronto, Ontario in Canada and at San Jose, California in United States of America. The company's technology is focused in the areas of application of artificial intelligence in cloud based online education in universities/colleges and corporate training. We use our state-of-the-art proprietary Digital Learning Platform that incorporates audio, video, smart-board and ample amounts of artificial intelligence technologies into products such as automated and real-time software/hardware-based lecture capture, automated remote proctoring, tools to assist persons with disabilities with accessibility needs, interactive polling/quizzing, automated video captioning and adaptive streaming technologies and very large scale digital assets' management software. For more information, visit our product web sites: www.Yuja.com

YuJa Canada is hiring talented Software Developers for our Toronto office to design and implement our latest product suite that includes Multimedia Digital Assets Management System (EVP), Hardware and Software Lecture Capture, Learning and productivity tools for individuals with disabilities (Panorama and EqualGround), Remote Exam Proctoring (Verity), platform for interactive polling/quizzing (Engage), and many other tools for enhancing quality and productivity in Education. YuJa aims to alter the way lectures are delivered in universities and colleges allowing simultaneous delivery of lectures to the in-class and over the internet and OTT (Over The Top) television audiences using our proprietary and patent pending technologies. Lectures are captured and uploaded to the cloud in real-time. Our Digital Learning Platform is used by corporations for training and general team collaboration and also by university Professors and TAs during lectures, tutorials and office hours. Users independently access the tools for working collaboratively on their assignments and projects from their respective homes, offices or any place with internet connectivity.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Design and development of EVP - YuJa hardware/software lecture capture and multimedia management system
  • Design and development of Panorama and EqualGround - Suite of YuJa tools that makes internet and web accessible to people with disabilities
  • Design and development of Verity - YuJa remote proctoring system
  • Development of native Android and iOS based apps
  • Design and development of a very large multimedia digital asset management system (EVP)
  • Design and development of Engage - platform for interactive polling/quizzing

Required Skills:

  • Strong software design and development skills
  • Ability to recognize software problems and develop creative solutions within a fast-paced environment
  • Strong programming experience with one or more of the following stacks: (a) Java (J2EE), (b) Objective-C/Swift , (c) C# and .Net.
  • Expertise with one or more of the following operating systems: (a) Windows (b) MacOS (c) Android (d) iOS
  • HTML5, CSS, Javascript, React, WebRTC
  • Relevant experience with mobile software development including iOS and Android platforms
  • MySQL database experience including Java connectivity through JDBC
  • Experience in designing web-based portals using H TML, HTML5, Javascript, XML, CSS, React, WebRTC technologies, and other Web 2.0 tools.
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills

Other Desirable Skills:

  • Building distributed software systems including some experience with network protocols - HTTP, HTTPS, and TCP-IP
  • Industry or project experience with audio/video streaming technologies, e.g., HLS, RTMP, SIP
  • Experience working with both Windows Server and Linux-based server systems

Career Development and Training:
Senior R & D staff will provide guidance.

jobDescription:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your tech career at Intact means joining a diverse team of more than 3,000 Digital, Data and Tech experts working at the intersection of what exists and what’s possible. Here, you’ll be supported by forward-thinking leaders who celebrate shared success, and you’ll help push the industry forward with digital solutions that go beyond insurance to offer everyday value to millions of people. You’ll grow personally and professionally with access to cutting-edge technology-driven learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you’ll discover how exciting the “real world” can be.

Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a Software Developer I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for interns to join 2 of our specialized teams: Commercial & Specialty SE and Commercial Lines SE 6. Depending on your team assignment, here’s what you’ll do here:

  • Innovate and develop on our internal dashboard to meet needs from users and fellow co-workers

  • Contribute to Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) application development using GitHub, Docker and OpenShift environments

  • Create applications using industry standard development methodologies, such as Agile/Scrum/Kanban

  • Resolve Incidents, Defects and Problem tickets by finding creative solutions, solving complex problems, coding, testing, and debugging a wide variety of systems

  • Provide deployment support for production systems to guarantee their functionality.

  • Ensure systems are optimal and meet quality standards by analyzing, providing creative suggestions to improve services and user experiences.

  • Be creative and come up with ideas to improve our services and user experiences.

What you bring to the table:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering

  • Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term for 16 months (May 2025 to August 2026)

  • Must be returning to school in Fall 2026 following your internship

  • Past internship experience is considered an asset

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).

  • Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment

  • Experience in Java is preferred

  • Experience in SQL, Mongo, or any Frontend experience (React, Angular) considered an asset

Your career starts here.  Apply today!

We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your resume and University/College transcript. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)!

We’re accepting applications now through October 4. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact or belairdirect, please apply for this role on Contact People.

jobDescription:
Software Developer – Canadian Ice Service

Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our Canadian Ice Service development team in the role of Software Developer.

You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process. Assigned tasks may include design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are required.

Geospatial Applications This team at the Canadian Ice Service is responsible for development of mission critical applications and tools in support of the Canadian Ice Service operations. These are complex and highly scalable client/server software systems with Oracle Database and various scientific algorithms developed in a combination of C/C#/C++, VB.NET, and Python languages. These systems are based on GIS and Remote Sensing technologies and are deployed in a mix of Linux and Windows environment. The successful candidate will work in a team of software developers of scientific applications and will be involved in any or all of the following: design, coding and testing of new or existing applications in support of the Canadian Ice Service to meet defined user requirements and established government standards.

Students are treated as full team members and participate in all developer roles including specification, design, development, testing, and reviews at all stages. Developers must be able to work effectively in teams and independently. Strong communication skills are necessary and are a key factor to success.

This position is most suitable for a student who enjoys and thrives in a challenging environment and wants to gain experience in enterprise development and constructing large-scale scientific processing systems.

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Software Engineering
  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Geospatial Applications (Location: Ottawa or Toronto)

  • Experience in application programming in at least two (2) programming languages.
  • Being able to work at the office of Environment and Climate Change Canada – Canadian Ice Service, 719 Heron Road location in Ottawa OR at the Toronto location 4905 Dufferin Street
  • Assets: (desirable but non-essential qualifications for the position)
    • Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio IDE and build environment
    • Experience with Remote Sensing and GIS technologies, including ESRI ArcGIS or Open Source GDAL/QGIS
    • Experience with C++/C#/VB.NET
    • Experience with Python

Further Information

The positions are available for 12 to 16-month work terms from May 2023 to August 2024 for students that have completed their 3rd year of a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer) degree. Please indicate on your cover letter your work term preference.

Preference may be given to students with higher academic standing. Students to whom an offer is made will be required to pass a check for Enhanced Security Clearance.

If selected for an interview, Canadian students must provide proof of citizenship and non-Canadian students must provide proof of permanent residence. Students must also provide proof of address.

Students must be prepared for technical and behavioral interviews which will be conducted remotely.

We provide a flexible/hybrid work environment combining in-office collaboration and remote working where employees will work in the office at least one two (May 2025) and then three (Sept 2025) days in the office. The candidate will be able to choose between Toronto’s Downsview office and Ottawa’s 719 Heron Road location.

About Environment and Climate Change Canada

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, engineering, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobDescription:
Environment and Climate Change Canada is looking for students to join our Data Management System (DMS) development team in the role of Component Developer or Web Developer.

As a DMS Developer, you will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the development process and work on complex scientific weather applications. While many organizations assign students to highly restricted roles, we expect students to grow into a role in which they participate fully in the development process as a part of a larger team. Students will gain experience in a large variety of areas, including design, coding, testing, performance analysis, debugging, system installation/configuration, code reviews, and documentation.

Over the course of their placement, our students are expected to participate in all developer roles, as well as join in reviews of their own and other projects. Students should be able to work effectively in teams and independently. To contribute effectively to our dynamic, team-based approach to software development, strong communication skills are necessary and are a key factor to success. This position is most suitable for students who are seeking to gain real-world software development experience and make a meaningful impact on the lives of millions of Canadians.

About the DMS: The Data Management System (DMS) is a mature data management project designed to modernize IT systems supporting the Meteorological Service of Canada. DMS is a high-performance computing platform that acquires, scientifically processes, quality assesses, archives, and provides access mechanisms to extremely large volumes of meteorological data collected from thousands of stations across the country in a 24/7 mission critical environment. Clients of the DMS include meteorologists, climate researchers, forest fire prevention services, the Canadian Coast Guard and the aviation industry – not to mention the Canadian public.

Data Management System - Component Development

DMS is built on a multi-node cluster running Ubuntu. It incorporates industry leading technology, such as databases, search engines, queueing systems and managers. Most programs are written using Java, though knowledge of C++, SQL and other scripting languages is always welcome. New technologies and ideas are always being incorporated where applicable, and contributions from past students have gone on to become a large part of a system which underlies climate-related activity across Canada.

Data Management System - Web Development

Web application developers on the DMS team are tasked with building a suite of applications to create a user-friendly bridge for our clients to interact with our weather data. Students will be working with the Angular framework and Redux-like libraries to build complex features for these applications. Development emphasizes scalable architecture, reactive design and reusable solutions.

Applicants may specify which of the development streams they prefer, but developers may be expected to work in either development stream if circumstances arise.

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering
  • Computer Science
  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

Skills and experience required:

  • Experience in object-oriented programming (Java, C++, JavaScipt)
  • Experience in a UNIX / Linux environment
  • Experience working in a team environment
  • Ability to analyze, evaluate, and troubleshoot
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle methodologies
  • Knowledge of object oriented-design and UML

Assets:

  • Experience with Web technologies (JavaScript, PHP, HTML, CSS)
  • Experience with Web frameworks is preferred (Angular, React, Vue)
  • Experience with GIT and package managers (npm, Maven)
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Knowledge of Agile software methodologies, including scrum

Further Information

jobDescription:
At EPSON we have a passion to innovate. Our engineers develop and advance EPSON's leading-edge technologies through indispensable product lines ranging from printers, scanners, and projectors, to integrated circuits, robots, and wearable devices. We are constantly looking to push the boundaries of possibility, and our products are world-renowned for being precise, functional, energy efficient, and of superior quality.

Our R&D team at EPSON Canada researches and develops cutting-edge computer vision & robotic technologies and converts conceptual research outcomes into tangible customer applications. Technologies developed at EPSON Canada have a global reach.

In your role, you will be assigned to work as part of a team that focuses on researching AI technologies as Large Language-Vision Models and their applicability to various fields. You will work closely with researchers to develop, integrate, evaluate, and produce state-of-art technologies for the next generation of EPSON products.

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate state-of-art technologies to solve machine learning, computer vision and robot related challenges.
  • Research, develop and implement Machine Learning/Deep Learning algorithms under the supervision of researchers.
  • Collect evaluation data, evaluate algorithms, and analyze results.
  • Implement and maintain evaluation processes for learning-based technologies.

Qualifications:

  • Strong proficiency in Python & C/C++.
  • Good understanding of machine learning and deep learning concepts.
  • Some experience with Pytorch or TensorFlow or some other DL frameworks.
  • Ability to quickly investigate and learn new technologies.
  • Strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Computer Vision, Large Language Models, simulations are an asset.

Environment:

  • Teams of ~10 researchers and developers
  • Flextime work hour (40 hours / week)
  • In person and work from home balance

Perks:

  • Candidates are encouraged and are provided with opportunities to start contributing to research.
  • Exposure to the latest technologies and challenges in the fields of Computer Vision and Large Language Models
  • Great people
  • Fast learning curve

At Environment and Climate Change Canada, our business is protecting the environment, conserving the country's natural heritage, and providing weather and meteorological information to keep Canadians informed and safe.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is building on its accomplishments with the environment through credible science, effective regulations and legislation, successful partnerships, and high-quality service delivery to Canadians.

We support sound environmental decisions. We work to repair the damage of the past, collect and pass on knowledge, and develop, implement and enforce policies to prevent future issues. We also work to ensure that Canadians have a safe, clean, and sustainable environment today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

Our workforce is made up of knowledgeable and dedicated employees from diverse backgrounds that are proud of the contribution they make to the environment. We have over 7000 employees from a broad range of fields including biology, chemistry, meteorology, climatology, engineering, commerce, communications, law enforcement, environmental sciences, hydrology, informatics, law, library science, policy, and more.

Environment and Climate Change Canada’s mandate is to:

Preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air, soil, flora and, fauna; Conserve Canada's renewable resources; Conserve and protect Canada's water resources; Forecast daily weather conditions and warnings, and provide detailed meteorological information to all of Canada; Enforce rules relating to boundary waters; and Coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government.

Please visit our website at: [ https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change.html ]
Download the WeatherCAN app at the Google play store or Apple store.

jobDescription:
Software Engineer (Co-op)

Mission

Tetra Trust was founded in 2019 and is Canada’s first and currently only registered trust company custodian for digital assets. As a trust company, Tetra is the first to offer a custody solution with the asset protection and the financial controls institutional entities need to operate within the digital asset market. To do so we have partnered with some of the technology leaders in the space and remain committed to stay on the cutting edge of digital asset custody.

We are now looking for a co-op student for a 12- or 16-month term starting May 2025.

What will you do

  • Make meaningful technical contributions to our institutional digital asset custody product by delivering secure, resilient, highly available, and supportable software
  • Work through the phases of discovery, requirements, design, implementation, and deployment on projects
  • Collaborate across the company to build products that have visibility, transparency, and tracking for agreed upon timelines
  • Participate in determining task priorities and deadlines as well as providing feedback on other projects and team milestones
  • Shape the foundation of the product and business that you work on

Why choose Tetra

  • Gain experience with cryptocurrency, cryptography, and cybersecurity
  • Solve interesting, challenging, and unique problems in the ever evolving field of digital asset custody
  • Deliver a high-quality system that will have a growing number of customers
  • Work on a collaborative team that strives to learn and grow
  • Learn to create quality software with well-defined specifications in a supported environment

What we are looking for

  • Working towards a degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Commitment and accountability for quality, technical excellence, and results
  • Curiosity and enthusiasm to learn, experiment, and deliver innovative solutions
  • Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English

Highly desired past experience/future interest

  • Experience designing and implementing high security, mission-critical systems
  • Experience shipping production code with full instrumentation: deployment, logging, monitoring, and documentation
  • Experience creating web services and evolving REST APIs
  • Experience delivering software in a highly regulated environment
  • Familiarity with constructing managed and automated infrastructure
  • Experience with frontend development (e.g. HTML, CSS, React.js)
  • Experience with AWS
  • Knowledge of serverless
  • Strong understanding of blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies including projects outside of professional environments

Tetra’s tech stack currently consists of Node.js, TypeScript, and React.js. However, there are no requirements to be proficient in these technologies. Tetra’s expectation is that the successful candidate can quickly become productive with any existing or new technologies as required for the role—you have the ability and eagerness to learn.

We know diverse teams make strong teams. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. If you require accommodation during the application process, simply let us know and we’ll ensure it’s a positive experience for you.

jobDescription:
About Briza

Briza is the leading developer platform for commercial insurance. We make it easy for developers to embed insurance experiences into their platforms. By writing once to the Briza API, developers can access the many products and carriers required to create great customer experiences for small commercial insurance. Briza enables developers to quote and bind policies over API. Based in Toronto Canada, with a team that spans the US, Brazil and Europe, Briza places a heavy emphasis on working with and developing the best talent in our industry.

Your Opportunity

Product engineering teams at Briza strive to make interacting with commercial insurance products not only better but delightful. There is a large and growing constituent of developers that need API access to insurance carriers but want a single integration, not 100's; this is the value we’re creating at Briza. The way we do this is by making access to the insurance ecosystem simple for developers, and in doing so help developers bring unique value to consumers and businesses.

Briza is a Series A funded venture, with our HQ in Toronto, but with distributed team members across the globe. You can work from our modern office in Toronto, fully remote, or a combination of both.

Who you are:
You have strong foundations and an interest in building software applications, infrastructure/rails, API products or developer platforms
You have some experience or transferable skills to program in Node.js and TypeScript
You are hungry to learn: you’re comfortable with taking constructive feedback (and able to give it!), actively seeking it out to help drive your own growth
You understand the value of automated tests (unit, integration) as a means to ship quickly with confidence


What you’ll be doing:

  • Design, build, maintain and evolve an API product and developer platform with fellow engineers, designers and product managers
  • Get close to customers in order to understand their use cases
  • Debug issues across services and multiple levels of the stack
  • Improve our engineering standards, processes, monitoring and tooling

Qualifications:

  • Backend software development using Node.js and/or TypeScript



Building a Diverse, Inclusive, Distributed Team

At Briza, we believe diversity breeds excellence. We have a global workforce with team members on, or recruited from, 6 continents. At Briza, people live wherever they work best. We have an office in downtown Toronto (steps from Union Station) for those that do want to work onsite.

We also believe in four core values:
Ownership. We make durable decisions that consider the interests of Brizans, customers and shareholders
Ambition. We're rewriting an industry, so that buying business insurance is easy.
Teamwork. It takes a village.  We lean on each other's strengths to grow and succeed.
Honesty. Say what you mean and mean what you say.  We're comfortable receiving and delivering feedback.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates around the world, including indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities. Diversity breeds excellence.

We love working with talented and ambitious students - please apply now!

Join us at PolicyMe! We're modernizing insurance and we'd like your help. The Canadian insurance landscape has remained largely unchanged for decades and we are in the process of changing that. We're a remote-first, Toronto-based startup with big ambitions.

jobDescription:
The Microchip FPGA Software Engineering team delivers a comprehensive software suite for designing Microchip’s FPGAs and managing the entire design flow from entry to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation.  In this role you will join Physical Design group. Within the Software organization, the Physical and Logical Design group is responsible for developing high-performance place, route, and synthesis software.  Our placement and routing tools are distributed commercially to a wide range of customers and are used internally for the exploration of new FPGA architectures.

We research and implement sophisticated approaches for solving gigantic problems -- like finding high-quality placements for millions of movable modules, or routing circuits whose graph representations contain hundreds of millions of edges.  To do this, we draw from a variety of computer science domains, including: numerical optimization, linear programming, machine learning, Boolean satisfiability, stochastic search, graph theory, traffic routing.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2025. Internships at Microchip technology aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience with research and development.

In this role you will:

  • Participate in developing state-of-the-art FPGA CAD algorithms to improve circuit performance, power, and tool runtime
  • Execute methodical, scientific experiments to validate the extent of algorithmic improvements
  • Study literature in the CAD industry and contribute to research discussions

Minimum Qualifications:


• Currently pursuing a Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical discipline.
• Solid programming skills, proficient in C/C++ or Python. Familiarity with basic data structure and algorithms.
• Good analytical thinking capability.
Preferred qualification any of the following:
• Exposure to advanced graph algorithms: Dijkstra algorithm, A*, clustering, partitioning, coloring etc.
• Exposure to parallel programming techniques: pthreads, openMP, TBB, CUDA
• Experience with source code management systems (Git, SVN etc.)
• Experience with FPGA, Verilog, static timing analysis
• Familiarity with Linux/Windows development environment.
• Familiarity with artificial intelligence (PyTorch, TensorFlow etc.), linear and non-linear optimization, sparse linear algebra.

jobDescription:
About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To date, more than one billion people have played our games across the Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.

Our Teams

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.

Job Responsibilities

The Analytics Application Platform Engineering team builds systems and solutions for analytics applications and business intelligence. Our business intelligence system enables game teams to discover and gather players insights to make data-driven decisions. Working closely with data scientists/analysts, you will be building high-performance & large-scale systems that bridge big data / machine learning technologies to analyze and optimize within our games. Our systems are built on a variety of tech stacks, including Java (Spring), Python, Node.js, TypeScript, Kubernetes, Docker, React, and various AWS technologies.

Job Requirements:

WHO YOU ARE

  • You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
  • You love solving difficult problems, and not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about! + You love coding, and passionate about making things more robust!
  • You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • Working towards a Bachelor in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
  • Experience in Java, Python, Web framework/library (e.g. React)
  • Knowledge of Docker, database technologies (relational, NoSQL ) + AWS isn't required but is an asset

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

  • Daily lunches, tons of snacks and beverages
  • Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
  • Flexible working hours on many teams
  • Casual dress every single day
  • Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
  • Work with cool people and impact millions of daily players

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!

Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To date, more than one billion people have played our games across the Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.

Our Teams

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games; they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between frontend, backend, and architecture roles.

Job Responsibilities

The Analytics Data Ingestion team builds near real-time ingestion pipelines to collect and process data for our analytics systems and platforms that power reporting, business intelligence, player engagement, machine learning and user acquisition.

Join us as we solve challenges developing and operating products at scale, impacting millions of players daily and supporting our games to achieve the highest levels of success through expertly crafted software. And you will be doing it with a seasoned team of professionals, pushing the capabilities and quality of our products and technology. No gaming experience is needed for the right candidate.

Who You Are

  • You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
  • You love solving difficult problems, and are not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about!
  • You love coding, and are passionate about making things more robust!
  • You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

What We Are Looking For

  • Working towards a Bachelor in Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline (or equivalent)
  • Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
  • Experience in Java, Go, C/C++, JavaScript, or Python
  • Knowledge of Unity, C# or native coding isn't required but is an asset

What We Offer You

  • Daily lunches, tons of snacks and beverages
  • Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
  • Flexible working hours on many teams
  • Casual dress every single day
  • Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
  • Work with cool people and impact millions of daily players

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!

Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at AccommodationRequest@zynga.com to request an accommodation associated with your application for an open position.

Zynga does not  engage in financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process. We do not conduct job interviews over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp or others. We will never ask you for your personal or financial information over unofficial chat channels. Our in-house recruitment team only contacts individuals via official company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com or naturalmotion.com email domain).

If you believe you have been the victim of a scam, you may wish to contact the authorities. In the United States, you may file a complaint with the FBI. More information is available here: https://www.ic3.gov .

jobDescription:
About Us

We believe AI will fundamentally transform how people live and work. CentML's mission is to massively reduce the cost of developing and deploying ML models so we can enable anyone to harness the power of AI and everyone to benefit from its potential.


Our founding team is made up of experts in AI, compilers, and ML hardware and has led efforts at companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft Research, Nvidia, Intel, Qualcomm, and IBM. Our co-founder and CEO, Gennady Pekhimenko, is a world-renowned expert in ML systems who holds multiple academic and industry research awards from Google, Amazon, Facebook, and VMware.


Overview:

Do you want to help drive the development of high-performance, power-efficient datacenter solutions for Deep Learning? Do you have an interest in how system architecture across GPU, networking, CPU and IO relate to brand new generative AI capabilities? Come join our team, and bring your experience and interests to help us optimize our next generation of inference and training frameworks/frameworks and to redefine the deep learning industry once again.

This hybrid opportunity is based in CentML’s Downtown Toronto office, with a minimum of 3 days in the office. Business requirements may require office attendance for 5 days/week in the office for extended periods.

Responsibilities:

    • Communicate with our product teams and profile ML/DL workloads to acquire an in-depth understanding of the problems (e.g., slow kernels).
    • Figure out where the bottleneck of the slow GPU kernels with profilers
    • Optimize the GPU kernels.
    • Write tests and benchmarks to validate and evaluate our solutions.

Who you are:

    • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team.
    • Strong coding skills (in at least one of Python and C++).
    • Solid fundamentals in other computer science and computer engineering topics: algorithms and data structures, operating systems, computer architecture, etc.
    • Experience in developing ML or traditional compilers is a plus

jobDescription:
Microchip’s FPGA software engineering team develops the Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software used by our customers to program Microchip FPGAs. Customers perform their entire FPGA design flow using our software: from design entry, to synthesis, through place-and-route, timing, power analysis, and simulation.

The PolarFire System software engineering team is developing the next generation system-level design software for Microchip’s RISC-V based SoC FPGAs. This involves the development of a range of tools, from Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) to software libraries to compilers. We are completely redesigning our software development IDE to build on top of the new Theia framework (https://theia-ide.org/), which looks and feels like VSCode. The new PolarFire System IDE drives a comprehensive platform that enables designers to easily navigate the complex landscape of FPGA-based SoC designs, from software specification to hardware implementation. The IDE streamlines the design process by offering an intuitive graphical interface for compiling, verifying, and integrating SoC designs.

As a software engineer in the PolarFire System team, you will be joining an agile fast-paced engineering team, where you will solve highly challenging problems. You will have ownership over meaningful new software projects from inception to development, testing, writing user documentation, and releasing to Microchip FPGA customers. The PolarFire System IDE is a high priority project that will go into production in 2025. Our previous interns have worked on critical parts of the IDE and some have filed patents on their work.

The software engineering team is based in Toronto. The Microchip office is in the downtown financial core at 67 Yonge Street, only a 10-minute walk from Union Station.

Interns will work in-person from our office 5 days a week.

Responsibilities:

· Develop Theia extensions in object-oriented Typescript

· Perform dependency injection with InversifyJS

· Perform UI/UX design using the React framework and CSS

· Write automated frontend-user tests using Playwright

Minimum Qualifications:

· Excellent programming and debugging skills. Experienced in Typescript/Javascript, React, and HTML/CSS

· Strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and object-oriented programming.

Preferred Qualifications:

· Experience working with VSCode/Theia plugins/extensions and UI/UX design are a definite plus.

· Experience with Git source code version control.

· Experience with shell scripting languages (Python, Perl, Bash, TCL).

· Knowledge of digital design and FPGAs.

· Comfortable with large-scale software development in both Linux and Windows environments.

jobDescription:
Software Infrastructure Intern

Alphawave Semi is looking for a highly motivated, excellent student to join its software infrastructure team. This is a cross functional software role where you will work with other teams to develop and maintain tools that help our software teams develop firmware, system, and application level software. You will be working closely with Firmware, Design Verification, DevOps, and other Software Infrastructure team members.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Define, develop and maintain performance testing for Alphawave Semi’s HW and SW platforms
  • Working closely with team members to troubleshoot and triage issues related with new SW updates
  • Building automated regression and visualization tools (we build tools in traditional web technologies like MongoDB, React, NextJS, Node, Python, Javascript)
  • Analyzing data and results of tests to help define additional metrics to improve our testing coverage

What we need to see:

  • Student of B.Sc. or equivalent experience in Computer Science / SW / Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Communication Engineering
  • Experience with Python and C
  • Knowledge in Linux
  • Creative, motivated and value driven person

It’d be great if you had:

  • Experience with multi platform systems, both in HW/FW/SW
  • Knowledge of Verilog/SystemVerilog
  • Experience building responsive and reactive web apps
  • Background with Networking applications and protocols
  • Experience with CI tools and methodology (Git, Github Actions, Gitlab, Jenkins etc.)

About Arcadis

Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Places

We work with our clients around the world to create, support, and enhance smart, safe and sustainable places where people live, work, learn and thrive. Places impact on the quality of people's lives. Whether new homes, shops, workplaces, schools and hospitals, manufacturing, research and development facilities, or data and distribution centers. People and communities thrive when the spaces in which they live, work, move and play are designed and managed in a way that best meets their needs.

Role Description

Our Structural Team at Toronto West (175 Galaxy Blvd.) provides full-service structural engineering services including the analysis and design of buildings, foundations, and special structures. We work with architects, contractors, construction managers, and owners on a wide range of projects across many different regions and market sectors.

Role accountabilities

  • Analysis and design of various structures and in the preparation of construction drawings and specifications
  • Work with a full service design team on the design of buildings
    Conduct periodic site reviews to ensure construction complies with design intent, codes and standards
  • Document and verify field conditions
  • Support of business development and proposal initiatives

Qualifications & Experience

  • Currently enrolled in the Civil or Structural Engineering program
  • Completed 2-3 years of the program
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal
  • Able to work effectively independently and on a team
  • Previous internship work experience is an asset

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
Looking for an internship with great learning opportunities and meaningful work?
Join our Research & Development team - https://youtu.be/8wmfn9B07F0

Evertz has been recognized as one of Canada’s 50 best managed and top 100 fastest growing high-tech companies.  Evertz is a worldwide leader in design and manufacture of cutting edge multimedia products for the film & television broadcast industry.

As a leader and innovator of HDTV and IPTV, Evertz is renowned for high caliber products with features second to none in the industry.  Our innovative approach combines our in-house state-of-the-art manufacturing facility with short cycle time design to realize exceptional products sold to our worldwide client base (including CBC, ABC, NBC, CBS, HBO, and the BBC).

Scope:

As a valued team member, you will be working hands-on with all aspects of custom board development, including:

  • Simulating, designing and verifying analog and digital circuits
  • Designing high-speed printed circuit boards through:
    • Schematic design and capture
    • High frequency and high power PCB layout
  • Resolving board-level power supply and distribution issues
  • Characterizing high-speed transmission lines
  • Supporting other engineers in hands-on debug

You will be doing real work solving real problems.

You will be working with a world-class team of experienced designers.

You will learn a lot about hardware design.

You will receive tons of feedback and guidance.

Qualifications:

• Possess a foundation in electronic theory.
• Self-motivated to find root causes when debugging.
• Eager to learn and accept feedback.
• Understand the fundamentals of RF design.

jobDescription:
Do you love wicked problems? Do you think learning new skills is fun? Do you get fulfilled by team success? Do you want to accelerate meaningful climate action? So do we! Join Purpose Building and let’s go Farther Faster, together!

WHO WE ARE

Purpose Building is an employee-owned company established to accelerate new and existing real estate to planet-positive pathways. We do this by creating:

  • Inspiring Careers for a diverse team aligned by a drive to excel at delivering healthy, circular, low carbon buildings and communities.
  • Leading-edge Solutions by combining technical excellence with a passion for solving wicked problems.
  • Confident Teams willing and able to deliver outcomes well beyond what they thought possible.

OUR CORE VALUES

All members of the Purpose team are committed to:

  • Team Success – we enable great lives for each other by continually improving the team’s capabilities and processes
  • Collaboration Excellence – we sustain highly effective knowledge-building, partnerships and communication
  • Social Responsibility – we contribute to the success of the communities we live and work in
  • Honesty – we match words and actions, seek different perspectives, share credit, and own our errors

WHAT YOU CAN DO

As a Student Sustainability Analyst, you will help in developing high performance solutions on projects and maintaining the firm’s best-in-class knowledge in community and building performance. To achieve this, you will:

  • Research principles of energy/carbon/material flows in buildings, human comfort and business performance to contribute to leading edge design  solutions for new and existing developments
  • Prepare content for reports and presentations
  • Contribute to the development of new ideas, workflows and tools for the Company
  • Engage in continual learning to understand the systems needed for a healthy, circular, low-carbon economy

WHO YOU ARE

We build our team with individuals who take initiative, enjoy solving difficult problems, listen very well and express themselves clearly, bring passion to their work, are fun to be with, are adaptable and are invested in personal betterment.

The attributes/skills you bring include:

  • Proficiency in written and oral communication, using Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Two or three years of success in undergraduate studies in Architecture, Architectural Science/Technology, Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineering, Planning, Construction or Building Science
  • Valuable experience would include experience/exposure to some or all the following:
    • Data management and visualization with large data sets including tools such as MS Access, SQL, API connectivity, Skyspark, Switch Automation, Coppertree, Rhino, SketchUp, Revit, AutoCAD, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, eQuest, IES, Energyplus, Sefaira, Wufi, PHPP, Radiance, DIVA, OpenFoam, Fluent, Python, Ruby, Grasshopper, Ladybug, etc.
    • Sustainability rating systems and certification programs such as LEED, Energy Star, Zero Carbon Building, Passive House, GRESB, WELL, Fitwel, or others.

jobDescription:
Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You’ll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way.

Job Description:

Length of term: 1 year, May 2025 - May 2026


The role is part of the central Digital Analytics Team, which is the enterprise hub for the digital measurement practice, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, and Tealium iQ administration. The role reports to the Manager, Digital Analytics.

What will you do?

Initial/Ongoing Responsibilities

  • Understand and learn about the role of digital analytics within the company, including how to use Adobe Analytics, one of the world’s leading digital analytics tools.

  • Maintain and update key statistical reports about the company’s web sites.

  • Respond to ad hoc reporting requests from the internal global marketing community and assist in acquiring and analyzing digital marketing data.

  • Effectively identify gaps relating to the reporting infrastructure and training content.

Mid to Long Term Responsibilities

  • Implement new reporting infrastructure, for example Excel scorecards, Adobe Analytics reports and data exports.

  • Assist in the Tealium iQ/Adobe Analytics tag implementation and data collection process. This includes tool configuration and data validation.

  • Support the management of Adobe Target as an optimization and personalization tool.

  • Provide marketers with actionable recommendations on how to improve their web sites and digital marketing campaigns.

  • Support the design of Adobe Analytics tagging frameworks and tag quality assurance.

  • Primary user management lead for tools managed within the team. This includes Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target and Tealium iQ.

  • Education of business partners in the areas of digital analytics and Adobe Analytics.

  • Subject matter expert in the use of Adobe Analytics.

  • Ad hoc projects which could include comprehensive site reviews and internal search optimization, ETL enablement for various tools and data sources, using Tableau as a data visualization tool.

What do you need to succeed?

* Ideal candidate is available for a 12-month co-op term

Preferred Disciplines:

  • Computer Engineering

  • Computer Science

  • Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)

  • Engineering Science (Math, Stats & Finance)

  • Industrial Engineering

  • Math & Stats

  • Data Science

Technical

  • Understanding of web publishing and usability design

  • Commanding knowledge of MS Excel or other related software

  • Experience with Web/Digital Analytics software an asset (for example, Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)

  • Experience with programming in JavaScript or Python an asset

  • Understanding of digital marketing (e.g. SEO or social) an asset

  • Understanding of SQL is helpful, but not required

Analytical

  • Be comfortable working with large sets of data

  • Able to synthesize data into conclusive findings that can be used to optimize a site’s performance

  • Strong attention to detail

Soft Skills

  • Passionate about developing digital marketing, consulting and data analysis skills

  • Strong communications and relationship building skills

  • Self-driven, resourceful individual with an ability to work under little supervision

  • Able to meet deadlines and be responsible for all projects assigned

  • Comfortable to network and approach colleagues within the business to gather data and complete projects

What is in it for you?

  • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture where you’re an innovator and trusted partner

  • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

  • We’re honoured to be recognized as a 2022 Best Workplaces in Canada by Great Place to Work® Canada & 2022 Best Workplaces for Inclusion by Great Place to Work® Canada

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted for.  The Base Pay which you will be considered for will vary depending on the Campus program you are selected for.

Eligible Sun Life employees for various Campus Graduate programs will also participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com .

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobDescription:
Company Background:

Xpan Inc. is an FDA-approved medical device startup based in Vaughan and is part of the University of Toronto Startup community. Xpan’s goal is to develop products that aim to improve the safety, efficiency and economic outcomes of surgeries. We do so by iterating rapidly & working closely with world-class surgeons in Canada and USA. Currently, we are developing expandable surgical ports that aim to solve critical unmet needs in minimally invasive surgery.

We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about the Medtech industry to join our team. We pride ourselves in providing meaningful and impactful work opportunities and providing high quality tailored training to our team members that goes beyond the work term. We treat our student interns as core team members.

Position Description:

Xpan is recruiting for an R&D engineering co-op position. The candidate will work closely with the development team on tackling design, manufacturing and regulatory related tasks as we work on commercializing our trocar technology. The position will also involve designing, performing bench experiments, collecting & analyzing data and iterating based on results. The candidate will also be involved in leading R&D and creative design efforts of pipeline products, which may involve interacting with end-user clinicians.

**Please Note: The co-op will be expected to work in-person at our Vaughan office location (57 Corstate Ave). A hybrid working environment can be expected after onboarding activities are complete.

Candidates with the following experiences are highly encouraged to apply:

  • Experience in research/lab setting
  • Experience in writing academic manuscripts and publishing
  • Experience in IP development (e.g. writing claims & technical descriptions, technical drawings, prior art searches, etc.)
  • Prior understanding of regulatory pathways & procedures in Medtech
  • Prior leadership positions/experience
  • Prior business development/marketing/sales background
  • Proven excellence & experience in product design and development
  • Experience working in a medical device company or ISO13485 environment

Candidate requirements:

  • Experience in using hand & powered tools & comfortable with machine shop equipment
  • Experience in designing & modeling of parts & assemblies in CAD/SolidWorks
  • Experience in developing parts through rapid prototyping methods such as 3D printing
  • Experience in implementing scientific methods and iterative approaches in design and testing
  • Experience in developing benchtop testing procedures and testing apparatus, performing tests and analyzing data using statistical methods
  • Strong verbal and written communication, organizational and documentation skills
  • Strong attention to human factors & aesthetics
  • Extremely attentive to details and is resourceful
  • Proactive in identifying technical problems, risks and identifying solutions
  • Ability to conduct literature and/or intellectual research and summarize results in succinct and organized methods
  • Able to self-manage (setting high level objectives and granular tasks) especially under aggressive timelines

Educational & Other Requirements:

  • Canadian citizenship, permanent residents, or persons who have been granted refugee status in Canada
  • Aged 30 or under at the beginning of the internship
  • Be enrolled as a full-time secondary or post-secondary student in a recognized institution and recognized as having “full-time student status” by that academic institution prior to the end of the internship .

jobDescription:
AMD Markham SoC team is hiring for its Markham location in Canada for the next-generation chip development project!

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible.  We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Our SoC applications cover a wide spectrum from the state-of-the-art products empowering the current technological innovations in Machine/Deep learning, Virtual/Augmented Reality, and 3D Gaming.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results.  It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world.   If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

AMD is an innovative technology company dedicated to collaborating with customers and partners to ignite the next generation of computing and graphics solutions. AMD designs and develops cutting-edge computer and graphics processing technology that is used throughout the world in business, enterprise, and consumer markets.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

We are currently looking for a System-on-Chip Performance Verification Co-Op who will be part of a team working on next generation of a complex SOC design for AI/ML applications. The successful candidate will play a key role in SOC verification performing the following duties for functional and performance aspects with RTL simulation and hardware emulation environment.

A truly multidisciplinary function, working in close collaboration with architects and front-end designers on the various SOC verification efforts, interacting with a wide variety of internal and external design verification/development teams, Design Verification methodology, and Silicon IP and tool vendors. Work with SOC and IP architects, Design and Design Verification teams to define, develop and execute SOC performance verification plan.


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
• The candidate should have completed 3rd year Computer, Electrical or Engineering Science programs.
• Good C/C++ software skills and Verilog

• Strong knowledge of scripting languages: Python/Perl
• Good understanding for digital system and computer architecture
• Should be a confident coder and be comfortable debugging general hardware/software problems.
• Must communicate well both written and orally
• Must be organized and multitask well

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
You will gain valuable experience in different aspects of ASIC design/performance verification. Depends on the time you join the team, you may be able to experience the full project cycle – from project planning to implementation to tapeout.
This team is essential to the success of AMD as a growing company. It is a very exciting environment and you will be working with the very best in our technology. You will be working on some of the most exciting projects the industry has to offer

jobDescription:
Tenstorrent is leading the industry on cutting-edge AI technology, revolutionizing performance expectations, ease of use, and cost efficiency. With AI redefining the computing paradigm, solutions must evolve to unify innovations in software models, compilers, platforms, networking, and semiconductors. Our diverse team of technologists have developed a high performance RISC-V CPU from scratch, and share a passion for AI and a deep desire to build the best AI platform possible. We value collaboration, curiosity, and a commitment to solving hard problems. We are growing our team and looking for contributors of all seniorities.

Tenstorrent is looking for engineering intern to join our dynamic team. We know junior engineers want to explore different areas and expand their skill sets. At Tenstorrent you will have the chance to accelerate your career by working on challenging engineering problems with a dedicated mentor and the potential to move between the system engineering, digital design, verification, firmware, and software teams.

This role is, based out of Toronto.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize and maintain system firmware and BIOS.
  • Performance and power verification and validation of Tenstorrent's IP and SOC
  • Participate in the design, development, and validation of system software.
  • Handle pre and post-silicon bring-up activities.
  • Benchmark and analyze performance optimizations for key machine learning algorithms across Tenstorrent hardware and software stack
  • Architecture and development of frameworks for automating post-silicon verification, data analysis and debug
  • Support board/system design and debug

Experience & Qualifications:

  • Interest and knowledge of processor/computer architecture
  • Interest and knowledge of the full ASIC design flow, including design, verification, validation, product definition, production
  • Excellent programming/scripting skills (Python, C, C++)
  • Understanding of deep learning concepts and familiarity with popular machine learning frameworks and models
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

This role is on-site, based out of Toronto.

  • Create design specs, liase with vendors and order supporting equipment and supplies.
  • Participate in design reviews, providing valuable input from your area of expertise and beyond.
