jobDescription:
JOB RESPONSBILITIES:

This role works with every department in the plant to support, troubleshoot and optimize our operation and processes. As an intern on our team, you will:

  • Complete field measurements to conduct heat exchanger performance analysis
  • Perform daily assessments of the site's environmental compliance and troubleshoot deviations to ensure best in class environmental performance
  • Assist with the site’s energy reporting and performancing
  • Lead one or more special project with emphasis on development and implementation of solutions to improve safety, reliability and environmental compliance

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Full-time students currently enrolled in a Chemical Engineering program.
  • Strong teamwork/interpersonal skills with ability to communicate ideas effectively
  • Motivated self-starter who can work well independently
  • Multitask competing priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft products such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

WORK CONDITIONS:

Mix of office and field visits in an industrial manufacturing environment (outdoor) to complete assigned work. This may at times include twisting, crouching, kneeling, making visual inspections, climbing stairs/ladders, and pushing/pulling objects. Safety is our #1 Priority – all required training and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be provided as part of on-boarding.

Please note, this is a Safety Sensitive position in which a Drug & Alcohol test must be completed along with a pre-placement health assessment prior to a start date.


Reasons to Work at Petro-Canada Lubricants

1. The Culture – home to a tight knit community of talented engineers, most of whom began their careers on-site as new grads or former co-ops themselves!

2. Mentorship – one on one mentorship, opportunity to learn from Subject Matter Experts, and participate in any on-site training offered during the co-op term.

3. Opportunities – wide variety of engineering assignments, opportunities to propose continuous improvement ideas and follow them through to implementation. You’ll rarely see the same thing twice!

4. Experience – apply your academic skills and knowledge in an industrial setting and further develop your understanding of engineering principles.

5. The Fun Side – Social Club and Engineering events such as BBQs, auctions, golf tournaments, volunteer opportunities and more!

About Us

PCLI refines and produces world-class advanced lubricants, specialty fluids, and greases. The base oil refinery is one of the largest in the world and offers a unique employment opportunity within the GTA! The site supports five key production units, including base oil production, support utilities and waste water treatment.

jobDescription:
Why you’ll love working here:

  • high-performance, people-focused culture

  • our commitment that equity, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves

  • learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth

  • virtual fitness, yoga and meditation classes, nutritional consultations and wellness seminars

  • flexible hybrid work model that embraces remote work

  • the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers

Application deadline: October 6, 2024

Application requirements: Resume, transcript and optional cover letter

*please note, this is a required 12-month internship starting in May 2025

Job Summary

About the Team

Created in 2020, the Total Portfolio Group (TPG) is tasked with stewarding the composition of the Fund’s overall investment portfolio to ensure that HOOPP can deliver on its pension promise over the long term. TPG acts as the brain trust of the Chief Investment Officer on all issues related to the total fund and is a central part of the Front Office in the Investment Management Division. TPG has several core functions: Macro-economic commentaries and how they impact the total portfolio, Portfolio construction and asset allocation, portfolio analytics, and total portfolio management including liquidity and currency management policies.

TPG advises the CIO and CEO on matters of strategic importance to the total Fund including recommendations on how to best orient the Policy portfolio. TPG provides additional research and analytical capabilities for internal cross-departmental initiatives relating to Value-Added platforms, risk management, investment technology, policies and procedures, benchmarks, and performance. The team accomplishes this by leading research initiatives as well as developing and implementing solutions collaboratively across the firm.

TPG is led by the Senior Managing Director, Total Portfolio, who has many years of experience in portfolio construction, asset allocation and risk modelling. He publishes multiple articles in leading international peer-reviewed journal articles in Finance and Engineering including leading-edge portfolio allocation research. The TPG management team includes a Managing Director, Total Portfolio, who is a seasoned investor and has a wide array of knowledge from portfolio strategy and asset allocation. The TPG management team also include access to a full-time Professor of Finance located in Toronto. He oversees TPG’s research projects and ensures they are backed by rigorous research and analysis. He not only has strong academic background but brings extensive industry experience from large pension funds and financial institutions.

About the Role

The candidate will be working with a high-caliber team with backgrounds in Investments, Finance, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis and Data Science. The candidate will participate in regular meetings within TPG and with the Senior Managing Director, TPG as well as the Chief Investment Officer at HOOPP. This role is ideal for students who would like to gain relevant fundamental knowledge in top-down strategic asset allocation, investment analytics, and cross-asset risk management and would like to build a career in the asset management and investing businesses. The candidate will be able to gain knowledge from experts on a regular basis while working in a small, collaborative team which operates in a flat organizational structure. The candidate will have rare access to a Professor of Finance on-site, ideal for students who wish to proceed in a higher education in Finance, or are passionate about continuous learning.

This role will assist in the design, development, and automation of existing and new portfolio management & risk analytics and reports suited to both top-down portfolio construction decision-making as well as securities-level bottom-up investing by public & private investment teams (e.g., Public Equities, Fixed Income, Credit, Real Estate, etc.). This is done by leveraging the Blackrock Aladdin system that HOOPP has recently brought online and other internally-built tools. This role will also aim to support TPG as well as other investment departments in other fund wide projects of strategic importance to HOOPP. The successful candidate’s contributions will be visible to the senior management team and the Chief Investment Officer (CIO) of HOOPP. The ideal candidate will be skilled in computer science / software engineering and potentially data science , and have a keen interest for financial markets and a strong desire to develop a career in Finance . This is an excellent opportunity to interact and learn from experienced investment professionals and contribute to real-world investment decision making.

What you will do:

  • Assist in designing and building reporting tools related to various risk exposures, including the design of specific reports for front office use

  • Help running daily front office reports and be able to independently troubleshoot issues

  • Assist in streamlining existing investment system processes, as required

  • Take on and automate daily reconciliation and error checking process for key reports on P&L (profit and loss), risk, and liquidity

  • Develop analysis and what-if tools to be used in total fund decision making, including various impacts of asset mix shifts

  • Support the Total Portfolio Group with portfolio analysis and financial modeling around private and public asset classes as well as emerging portfolio problems, as required

  • Collaborate with HOOPP’s technology team on internal technology initiatives

  • Assist in the preparation of oral and written materials for the Total Portfolio Group

  • Perform ad-hoc research on markets and/or model methodologies, as required

  • Participate in ad-hoc total fund projects, as required

What you bring:

  • Enrolled in a university program in Mathematics, Science, Engineering, Finance, or other quantitative discipline.

  • Proficiency in architecting and designing scalable software in Python.

  • Experience in software development using OOP language is desirable, but not required.

  • Strong Excel skills, especially working with large datasets and data manipulation.

  • Strong numeracy is critical.

  • Excellent work ethic, time management, organizational skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

  • Strong ability to deliver effective, sensible analyses in an environment of informational uncertainty.

  • Exceptional attention to detail with highly developed interpersonal and communication skills.

  • Progress towards CFA designation is an asset.

  • Passion and curiosity for financial markets and investing, intellectual curiosity, and willingness and ability to learn new concepts.

jobDescription:
Job Summary

At Left Turn Right Turn (LTRT), our mission (and yours, should you choose to accept it!) is to get people out of cars and onto transit. We work with transit agencies to understand their service and plan, design, and implement improvements to the customer experience and operations. Transit Explorers support a wide range of projects and get full exposure to the glamorous life (or so we tell each other) of a consultant as part of a fun and dynamic team working with Canada's largest and smallest transit agencies.

Projects delivered in the past year include:

  • Undertaking a medium-term master transit plan for a regional transit agency
  • Developing a technology roadmap and organizational plan
  • Undertaking operational and business process reviews of transit scheduling and dispatch
  • Assessing on-demand transit opportunities for low-density geographic areas
  • Analyzing and preparing a capital infrastructure plan including fleet plan

Our DNA

The LTRT team is creative, collaborative, and balanced - it is in our DNA.

Creative: We look for new ideas and methods to inject at the start of each project. This keeps things fresh and relevant for the client, and exciting and interesting for us. We innovate in the work that we do because one can, and one should, always strive to improve.

Collaborative: We communicate effectively, whether in-person, in writing, or by carrier pigeon. We mix working meetings and workshops regularly into our projects to keep us in sync internally as well as with clients. Most importantly, we’ll support each other during crunches so no one bears the load alone.

Balanced: We value a balanced approach to work and life. We’ll crack a joke when the time is right and crack down when it’s not. We’ll follow up that long work week with necessary recovery time off (with some food, drinks, and the occasional board game to accelerate the process!).

Job Responsibilities

Transit Explorers will support and learn through a wide variety of projects, applying their smarts, experience, and creativity at a culture-focused firm. Your responsibilities could include:

  • Researching, reviewing, and summarizing key findings from documents such as Official Plans and Transit Master Plans to assist with report writing.
  • Analyzing operational, financial, horoscope, and other data to derive insights.
  • Evaluating software systems, from the perspective of contract compliance, system accessibility, or the ‘cool-factor’.
  • Writing technical and non-technical reports that bring a (figurative) tear to the reader’s eye.
  • Crafting and designing breath-taking, head-turning PowerPoint presentations and workshop materials.
  • Developing jaw-dropping, project-winning proposals. Researching and documenting cutting-edge industry best practices through the beauty of the interweb, phone, or in-person interviews with vendors and agencies.

Qualifications

  • An interest in public transit issues (bonus points if you have a model railroad collection).
  • A superb eye for detail and accuracy (like, seriously, ok).
  • Excellent writing and communication skills, with a knack for translating technical concepts to a non-technical audience (consulting = smart report writing, it’s true).
  • Experience in analyzing data using Excel.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving, time management, and decision-making skills.
  • Ability to work independently as well as in team environments.
  • Bonus gold stars if you have graphic communication skills (infographics, charts, and graphs), and/knowledge in GIS analysis.
  • Student in good standing at the University of Toronto (Engineering)

Term of Contract

15-month work term: May 2025 – July 2026, our current PEY student is with us until August 1, 2025 so we want to try and make sure you have some crossover. (Exact start and end dates are flexible – we want to make an effort to provide a break between the end of your contract with us and the return to your program in September 2026, so we have built in a month long break. You deserve a vacation!! If you require a small break after school is done in April 2025, we are happy to build in a few days for you before you start your contract with us. Balance is a part of our DNA and rest is important!)

Salary Details

Compensation:  $28.50 / hour

Hours: 37.5 hr / week

Location : Primarily work from home, within the GTHA (Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area). There will be some in-person time at coworking spaces in downtown Toronto.

Application Procedure : Please apply online via U of T Co-op portal and include your cover letter and resume.

Reporting to the Program Manager, Systems & Infrastructure, this position is responsible for assisting Transit Management Systems (TMS) staff with day-to-day Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) maintenance, customer support and documentation activities and for assisting in providing functional program and operational support for York Region Transit (YRT) fleet, terminal and stations.

Benefits to Student:

  • Gain valuable work experience in their field of study.
  • Enhance their interpersonal and teamwork skills with professionals in the field.
  • Gain direct experience in the public sector environment.
  • Learn about process, policies, and procedures within a large corporate Information Technology group in a Transit Environment.
  • Learn essential and hands-on technical skills required for a successful IT and ITS career.
  • Learn essential 3D printing skills and gain hand-on experience with electrical board soldering.
  • Learn essential customer service skills in dealing with Regional and public sector

Major Responsibilities:

  1. Administrative Activities:
  • Creates technical standard operating procedures and job aids for standard tasks performed by the TMS group to help automate operations and support.
  • Assists TMS staff in the creation of software and hardware support processes and procedures.

  • Create, execute, and document test plans to support new technology introductions.
  • Create training materials, FAQ, job aids and deliver training to support new system business transformation.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Role Description & Accountabilities:

In this role you will work in multi-disciplinary project teams across North America. Sample technology systems that you will help plan, design, and deploy include:

•Fare collection (such as open payment, smart cards, and mobile apps)

•Fleet tracking and operations management (getting buses, streetcars, and trains in-service and keeping them on schedule)

•Customer information (from trip planners to arrival predictions)

•On-Demand Shared Mobility (multimodal trip integration and microtransit)

•Business intelligence (data integration, warehouses, and analytics)

•Security (onboard and in-facilities) Responsibilities:

•Research on transit technology and data solutions;

•Transit technology and data strategic planning;

•Support project management tasks;

•Transit data cleaning, manipulation, and visualization;

•Attend stakeholder workshops, conduct needs and gaps assessment;

•Develop functional requirements/specifications and procurement process documents;

•Evaluate vendor proposals and design documentation;

•Document and test software/hardware systems and user interfaces;

•Review documentation to verify compliance with industry standards; •

Prepare project schedules and cost estimates;

•Systems testing, including review of test procedures;

•Support of business development and proposal initiatives;

•Current-state business process documentation and future-state business process re-engineering; and

•Report/technical writing.

Qualifications & Experiences

• Candidates must be enrolled in an Engineering program, including civil, electrical, computer engineering (other disciplines will also be considered)

• Have demonstrably above average oral and written communications skills

• Able to work effectively both independently and on multiple teams

• Motivated to support and improve public transit, through use of technology/data to improve operations and the customer experience

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
About Arcadis
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world's most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.

Mobility

We partner with our clients across the globe to design thriving and connected cities and communities that enable opportunity for all and keep the world moving. Climate change, urbanization and digitization trends are requiring today’s mobility projects and systems to address an evolving set of demands from the world’s growing population. We design connected, sustainable solutions that integrate existing infrastructure with new technologies, and optimize the mobility of people and goods.

Role Description

This is an exciting opportunity for those seeking a career in transportation planning, and are looking make an impact on the future of people and goods movement throughout the Greater Toronto Area and across Canada. Your primary role will be to perform technical analysis, data visualization, and report writing to support rapid transit planning studies, travel demand forecasting, transportation system/network planning and operations, environmental assessments, transportation master plans, and active transportation plans. The work we do is highly analytical and data driven in order predict how travel patterns may change in the future. We're looking for a highly motivated, enthusiastic, collaborative and independent individual who is willingness to learn and take initiative. This position is within the transportation systems practice out of our Toronto office (55 St. Clair Ave).

Role accountabilities

  • Conduct research and technical analysis in support of long-range transportation master plans
  • environmental assessments, business cases and active transportation plans
  • Conduct travel demand forecasting and travel demand model development using Emme, TransCAD, VISUM software
  • Support transit service planning and strategic planning
  • Document and verify field conditions
  • Prepare schedules and cost estimates
  • Support of business development and proposal initiatives
  • Various report writing.

Qualifications & Experiences

  • Candidates must be enrolled in an Engineering, Economics, Planning or Geography program;
  • Candidates must have demonstrable excellent oral and written communications skills;
  • Able to work effectively independently and on a team;
  • Strong interest in transportation engineering and planning;
  • Skills and experience in transportation planning software (e.g. Emme, VISUM, ArcGIS) would be an asset;
  • Ability to analyze, visualize and report data using computer programming tools (e.g. Python, R) would be an asset.

Why Arcadis?
We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It's why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You'll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you'll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.

Together, we can create a lasting legacy.

Additional information
As part of Arcadis' selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification and driver's license record.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability.

Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

jobDescription:
Hydro One is proud to be the largest electricity transmission and distribution provider in Ontario, serving nearly 1.5 million customers. We have a long history in the industry with our roots dating back over 110 years to 1906. Since then, we have worked to grow and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers and communities across Ontario. Today, we’re focused on providing exceptional customer service and ensuring we are building safe communities where we live, work and play.

It’s an exciting time to join the team at Hydro One!

Job Description:

  • Operate a variety of meter data head end software applications to process and monitor meter and AMI network device error reports. Clarify problem areas with supervisory, as appropriate. Perform printing, receipting, filing, updating and submissions of meter and AMI network device error reports, as required.
  • Perform daily verification routines on AMI devices and head-end systems and update/edit, as required (e.g. data files, error logs and reports).
  • Assist in the development/revision of processes, tools and procedures documents, as required.
  • Process AMI device exceptions; follow up with internal and external support groups on the status of exceptions and ticket resolutions.
  • Assist in the resolution of AMI device exceptions using established procedures, practices and operational tools.
  • Test and verify the end-to-end communication paths for data errors using the tools of the AMI network component and the head-ends systems prior to commissioning of meter AMI device installations and commencement of meter data collection.
  • Update and maintain network component assets, configuration database and network map in accordance to established procedures.
  • Provide work program and project support for AMI Complex Metering (Retail, Wholesale and Power Quality)
  • Hands-on work in a Lab environment. Knowledge of operating engineering tools and software required to troubleshoot network equipment (e.g. collectors, repeaters, modems). Follow work instructions to perform debugging of network equipment.
  • Maintain inventory levels for equipment/materials required in the lab for day-to-day tasks. Generate monthly reports. Excel and VBA knowledge is required.
  • Track progress of tasks utilizing existing databases. Frequently communicate with other groups to coordinate work.
  • Evolving work environment requires adaptability to new processes and software. Ability to multitask is required to coordinate the flow of inventory, respond to requests from other groups and accomplish daily tasks.
  • Assist with the maintenance of Telecom, Protection, Control and Monitoring Inventory.
  • Work with internal customers to assist with replacing defective equipment and with vendors to repair equipment.
  • Use system of record (SAP) to create purchase requisitions and purchase orders.
  • Operate and apply a variety of software applications in order to produce documents, spreadsheets, presentations and flowcharts, tables and organizational charts. Perform text and object manipulation using the applications of sorting, moving, merging, segmenting and scanning. Produce lengthy numeric tables and flowcharts that involve detailed and/or specialized set-ups.

Selection Criteria:

  • Requires experience with databases, data management, analysis and reporting.
  • Requires knowledge of computerized information systems and business administration to be able to develop and utilize systems and processes for analyzing, presenting and reporting information.
  • Experience with SAP will be an asset.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Completion of third year of Electrical Engineering program.

Skills that will be developed:

  • Development of critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Gain deep understanding of electrical metering knowledge.
  • Gain understanding of technical terms used in electrical distribution business.
  • Gain understanding of utility billing processes and systems.
  • Gain experience with meter data collection, validation, estimating and editing of meter data and AMI systems.
  • Gain understanding of electrical power systems and equipment relating to transmission/distribution assets.
  • Gain experience working with “big data.”
  • Gain practical working and troubleshooting experience related to AMI equipment and systems.

Hydro One requires that all students applying for student opportunities be enrolled in post-secondary level studies and be returning to full-time studies upon the completion of their work term. Exceptions will be made in cases where students require a work term in order to graduate. Only applications submitted via Hydro One's career page will be accepted.

If you are an international student, please ensure you have obtained a proper work permit and a Social Insurance Number (SIN).  Speak with your school’s career centre if you have any questions about acquiring this documentation.

At Hydro One we understand that the success and strength of our business rests with our people. When we develop their skills, we are investing in both their success and ours. To secure the best talent, we seek to create a workforce that reflects the diverse populations of the communities where we live and work and to create a culture based on safety, innovation and inclusiveness.

We are honoured to be recognized by Forbes in its list of Canada’s Best Employers for 2024.

Thank you for considering a career with Hydro One, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you are having difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email careers@hydroone.com. Hydro One will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.

Deadline: 17 September 2024

**Please note that students are to apply to a maximum of 3 co-op positions per term.

In the event you are experiencing difficulties applying to this job please consult our help page here .

If you are available for an opportunity in a future semester, join our Talent Community to receive updates about jobs matching your interests. Click on this link on our Careers Page: Talent Network

jobDescription:
What You'll Do

· Characterize analog blocks and perform PHY/Link Layer/Protocol compliance against various industry standards such as PCIe and Ethernet

· Bring up silicon, debug issues, present test results, and generate validation reports

· Define test plans and develop test methodologies for various tests

· Develop and standardize test scripts for various tests and automate test equipment

· Determine equipment and accessories needs for various tests

· Study signal integrity and power integrity for evaluation boards and for silicon

· Develop and automate robotic handler to do regression and volume validation and develop scripts to automate data analysis

What you will learn and become:

· Understand various specifications such PCIe (Gen1 to Gen6), IEEE 100G CK (C2M, CR, KR), and OIF 100G CEI (VSR, MR, LR), 200G, etc.

· Strong programming skills in Python, Perl, Matlab, C/C++, or other scripting languages

· Proficiency in using and automating test instruments such as Scope, BERT, Logic Analyzer/Exerciser, VNA, Power Supplies and Multimeters, etc.

· Strong understandings of SerDes architecture (NRZ, PAM4) and theory of operation: PLL, CDR, CTLE, FFE, DFE, etc.

· Experience in using industry compliance software such as SIGTEST, SEASIM, COM, etc.

· Experience in PCB design and good understandings of signal integrity, insertion loss, return loss, TDR

· Direct experience in SerDes related electrical validation and interoperability validation

· Working experience with PCIe and Ethernet protocol layers

· Working experience with PCIe workshop related tests

· Good understanding of design blocks like MAC and PCS

· Experience in optical and die2die validation

· Experience in Mango Database, HTML, JavaScript for data post processing and analysis

Education:

· Bachelor’s degree in Engineering Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering or Computer Science is at a minimum

jobDescription:
At The Six Semiconductor (TSS), a rapidly growing start-up, our vision is to offer best in class mixed-signal IP combined with exceptional service.  When compared to competitors, our IP achieve higher performance at lower power and area, while offering the flexibility and ease of integration to our customers in variety of markets such as AI, machine learning, automotive, HPC and mobile. Our team is highly experienced with a long list of achievements and accomplishments in the semiconductor industry.

If you love to work and grow in a fast-paced environment where you can innovate and truly enjoy your work, please send your resume to careers@thesixsemi.com .

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Evaluation of TSS’s high speed PHY designs (LPDDR/GDDR/HBM PHYs) using bench lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, BERTs, etc.
  • Work in a cutting edge electronics lab, applying Analog and Digital circuit concepts to understand and test TSS’ PHY design
  • Develop test methodologies and improvements to current test practices
  • Design and implement automated silicon test suites
  • Author silicon reports including functional and electrical characterization of IP
  • Supporting lab demonstration of TSS’s products
  • Supporting customers issues and debugs
  • Provide inputs for Silicon & PCB design requirements

Requirements

  • Currently in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctorate in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
  • Strong interest in circuit understanding and debug
  • Familiarity with some programming languages (i.e.Python, Perl, C/C++, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Assembly)
  • Experience in setup and operation of test instruments including oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, BERTs, logic analyzer and jitter measurements is an asset
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills
  • Team player and willingness to learn
  • Knowledge in high-speed memory (GDDR/LPDDR/HBM) interfaces is a plus
